Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2015 02:59PM mdg wrote: I would get a second opinion. I actually got second opinions on everything.... I also used Penguin Cold Caps to avoid hair loss and they worked for me. I did not have to harvest eggs or anything, but I think you should look into those options if it is important to you. It's your life and your decision. You need to find a doctor you will be OK with because you see them for years.....I am 5 years out and still see my oncologist twice a year! As far as cold caps.....many doctors are simply uneducated about them because they don't care. Many doctors won't allow people to use them but like everything else in this process it is YOUR choice. I would go to another oncologist. If you are interested in using cold caps there are several offices and hospitals that have freezers and do support cold cap use. I think there is a website that shows which locations have freezers but I can't remember what website it is. Someone on the cold cap thread may be able to tell you. Good luck!

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2011 01:33PM mdg wrote: Oh another thing on the pizza...you can buy a few of the pizza doughs and put them in the freezer so you have them for last minute nights.  I also buy extra organic mozzarella and pop it in the freezer for last minute nights too.  I almost always have some kind of veggies on hand so it's easy to make whenever.  You just have to remember to thaw the dough the day of wanting to make it....I always have a pizza stash in my freezer.  Another option....do mexican pizza on the whole wheat flour tortillas from Trader Joe's.  Again, they are not organic but they don't contain any of the bad oils...they are made with olive oil.  I can't find many whole grain flour tortillas without soybean oil except for Rudy's at WHole Foods which cost about $5+ for five of them (ouch!).  For now I settled on TJ's whole wheat one's and again I keep extras in the freezer for last minute veggie and bean taco's.  For mexican pizza...fat free refied beans or black beans, plus veggies (garlic, spinach, onion, peppers, mushrooms), I like to top with fresh salsa, organic low fat sour cream and a jalapeno or two for some heat..... Again I always keep some tortillas in the freeze and cans of organic beans in the pantry.  My husband cans salsa so we always have salsa on hand.....works well for last minute meals.

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2011 09:41AM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...back from the gym.  I did 60 min on the elliptical today (burned 575 calories).  I am not going to tell the Med Onc as I will get another lecture.....I figured since I eat everything in sight for the few days after chemo I may as well exercise good while I feel good this week right (I have chemo on Wed this week)?  I did my lunges, squats, inner/outer thigh stuff along with my upper body PT exercises.  I feel good today.  I hope you all feel just as good.  I also made some homemade whole grain buckwheat pancakes this morning.  They were good with a little low sugar syrup on them.  Felt like a little treat but at least was a bit healthy.  WHere is the rest of the exercise gang?   Supersally:  It's OK to have a pity party.  YOu are going through a lot.  I have had those days too..I always say "I look like a roadmap under my clothes because I have so many lines (scars)".  I feel completely unsexy and my husband keeps telling me I am....soooo unbelievable at this point.  I find that I do feel more blue the more I sit around.  I was blah yesterday and then got outside with my hubby and son and felt better.  I do think keeping moving when you can helps but in those days following chemo it is really hard.  As far as getting things moving in the bathroom...are you taking stuff for that?  I suffered horribly the first round but did fine the second time due to Senekot and stool softeners.  I hope you feel a bit better soon....it's OK to have down days as long as we can pull you out of them in a few days :)  Hugs!!!!!  I am in the chair Wednesday so I will need you to pull me out of my funk next weekend!  Does your doc let you take the claritin and aleve?  It worked for me after my second chemo......no real aches or bone pain. SueBee:  Burgers are good....I don't blame you for loving them so much!  If you enjoy them, keep eating them.  I have found new ways to enjoy them for me but it's not for everyone.  When I get blogging I will get you a good turkey burger recipe to try just in case!  I do know that if you compare out lean sirloin to ground turkey, fat content is really similar.  So glad you can find good, healthy quality meats so you can still enjoy a good burger now and again!  Keep hitting the Zumba girl!  You rock!

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2011 01:28PM mdg wrote: SueBee:  I want to come to your house for a toastie today....sounds yummy!  I too have been trying to avoid a lot of lunchmeat for my son's lunch.  I do sometimes buy him Applegate Farms turkey.  At least it is organic and nitrate free.  They don't grass feed animals though.  Oh well.  It' so hard to find good things to eat.  I also got my son a thermus and do leftovers in there - I warm them up in the morning and hopefully they are still warm at lunch.  At least this way he gets something healthy.  I also cook extra chicken breasts and freeze them in little ziplock baggies so I can just pull out 1 portion for a sandwich, to toss in pasta or put on a salad.  I like to always have a stash in the freezer for last minute things.  Oh and if you have Costco by you, they sell whole roasting chickens that are organic...FYI.

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2011 05:55PM mdg wrote: Hey gals...did my 60 min on the elliptical today and some stretching.  I was busy today and felt a bit tired.  I did also go to PT - thursday is my last day of that.  I had that last fill....my boobs are ginormous (if that's a word) - at least to me as I am not that big to begin with!  I am not sore from the fill which is good news.  I made dinner...a good pasta salad too!  I had made some whole wheat orzo with olive oil, garlic and fresh parsley the other night and needed to do something with the leftovers.  I added in a can or organic garbanzo beans, part of a red onion diced, 1 large tomato seeded and diced, salt, pepper, red wine vinegar and half of a cucumber seeded and diced.  It was sooo yummy!  It was a great way to use up leftovers and make something healthy.  I also wanted to add in feta cheese but I was out...olives would be good too (if you like olives...I personally do not but my hubby does).  We had that with Italian turkey burgers and garlic green beans.    Rennasus:  I hope your blue feeling goes away.  The exercise may help too though.....it can't hurt.  I do know on days like that it is hard to get motivated.  I am glad you are working out with a friend tomorrow.  That should pick you up a little.  I will check out the recipes.....I am always looking for ideas.  Melanie:  I would love to share recipes.  I am a foodie at heart.  Working on starting my BC friendly cooking blog in the next week or two.  I don't know how I am going to do all of this with everything else on my plate, but I really want to and me and DH love to cook.  Should be fun..... SueBee:  the chicken sounds sooooo good.  Another thing to do for seasoning is take your herbs and put them in the food processor with garlic, a little onion, salt, pepper and olive oil.   It will make a paste kind of like pesto texture.  Stuff it under the skin in the bird....now the meat will get all the flavor...I have even added lemon juice to it before too.  Then when you peel the skin there is still some of the herb mixture on the chicken...it tastes so good too!  The fill went good.  I am now 510cc's!  OMG!  THey are huge!  I am so glad I will be smaller after the exchange...now I have ot hide them for then next few months as they are lopsided and noticeably bigger than my pre surgery small size B breasts.  My hubby is very intreagued.......help me!  Not feeling so sexy right now.  Supersally:  The hair is my little secret.  It's so odd when I went to have a fill today a different PA did it.  I mentioned chemo and she said, "when do you start that".  I said "I am almost done".  SHe just looked at me...not sure what to say so she said nothing.  I said, "yes, this is my own hair...there are ways to keep it now!".  If she didn't know I was having chemo, she would have never guessed.  It is definately my little secret.  So glad you are feeling better!  I hope you had a good walk today.

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2011 02:01PM mdg wrote: Day after chemo and I LOVE the steroids.  I worked out - 60 min on elliptical and did some weights and streches.  I went to my last PT appt...I am officially on my own.  I got the dreaded neulasta shot and smiled knowing I only have to do one more in 3 weeks!  I headed to Walmart to do some Easter basket shopping...if you have kids, don't forget.  Easter is fast approaching!  I have one more thing to get for the bunny basket and that will be done.  I am waiting for my boys to come home in a few for dinner.  I think I will play some Wii with my son tonight....nothing like a little Mario Kart for a smile and laugh!  I hope you all had a fab day!  It is sunny here today but chilly.  My hyacinth flowers are in full bloom....brings a smile to my face when I pull up in front of the house.  Spring must be coming soon, right????  Melanie: I love chicken and black bean enchiladas....post that when you are done.  I do have another recipe for chicken enchiladas in a green chili sauce that I have forgotten about. Really it won't need to many tweaks to be a good choice based on the Anti Cancer guidelines.  I will get that on my list for the cooking blog for sure!  I am so glad you got moving.  I have been taking aleve when I get sore...it helps.  I also find that taking a hot bath/shower and then light stretching helps loosen me up on the day after workout if I am not up to working out or something....just an idea.  Sue Bee:  Way to go girl!  YOu are going to be pushing me now!  That's awesome!  It's amazing what exercise and a nice day does for you hu? Supersally:  I don't know how I have gotten by with no nausea.....I usually get sea sick very easy.  I also puke after any anesthesia for any type of procedure.  I have not taken any antinausea meds other than Ativan which is given on chemo day.  I have been pounding the water and not missing any workouts....I don't know how I have gotten so lucky with this.  I do get really hungry in the days following chemo though.  I have managed to stay busy and out of the house today so I did not go nuts eating.  This morning I had home made whole grain and buckwheat pancakes.  Snack handful of almonds.  Lunch garlic and olive oil infused whole wheat orzo topped with organic green beans.  I have been trying to eat more veggies at lunch...I make extra at dinner and reheat them for lunch.  I hope the stomach lasts OK.  Last night I chowed on a huge bowl of popcorn....OMG!  Someone stop me with the popcorn!  Although 3 cups of popcorn has a good serving of fiber!  I pop it in EVOO so it's healthy and add a few dashes of salt.  I make  huge bowl so I have some left for a day or two - if I can keep my 4 year old away from it!  I hope you are nausea free and feeling good.  I know this last round made you feel bad..... :(  I am glad you are going to workout tonight.  YOu will feel better...I promise!!! Annie:  soup is my favorite...if you were closer I would be on my way over for a bowl and a tupperware to take home!  Glad you got in that workout!  You ladies amaze me!!!! You are all inspiring me....I do want to do this food blog....I am going to find a way to get this going and my hubby is going to help!  This will be fun!

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2011 04:46AM mdg wrote: Melanie:  sorry about your arm but I am so glad you are seeing a specialist so you can treat it now and prevent things from progressing.  THey say if you catch it early it can make all the difference.  Please keep us posted.  Do the have you do some exercises for it?  Just curious...... Annie:  Thanks but have always not liked the frizz/wave in the hair.  My sister got blessed with dad's nice curls.  I got the frizz mess.  Yes, the grass is always greener.  How is your hair?  Hanging in OK?  Aren't you almost done with chemo now?  I know what you mean about coming up with dinner ideas...especially on last minute nights.  I have been known to keep a jar of organic sauce in the pantry for emergencies (don't tell my mom.....as we are Italian this would be known as a mortal sin!!!!  Jarred sauce...big NO NO!).  Breakfast for dinner is always another last minute option...eggs and pancakes.  Interesting on your PS.  Mine makes me over stretch to place in a smaller implant, not larger.  I am 510cc's now and will get a 450 cc imlant.  Rennasus:  I LOVE brisket.  Eventhough we are 100% Italian, my mom makes a mean brisket!  She had a jewish neighbor when she first got married who shared her brisket secrets.  I have not had it for a long time but may have to splurge on some good, grass fed, organic brisket for a treat.  Things are still not healing?  Ugh!  How frustrating....here is an article I found on healing:  http://www.livestrong.com/article/32778-foods-skin-heal/   Maybe it will help....Keep us posted.  I am off to the gym this morning then grocery shopping (probably two markets....I can never get everything organic that I need at one market these days).  The snow has melted but it's gray and cold here.   I guess I won't need my sunglasses today.....

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2011 05:00AM mdg wrote: Good morning!  It's Tuesday and I am up and about.  Anyone else knee deep in hard boiled eggs?  Two for breakfast with some toast (minus 1 yolk...don't need any more cholesterol).  I am off to the gym.  My chemo is making me gain weight....gained back almost 5 lbs of what I lost since getting diagnosed.  I need to step it up a notch I guess!  Back to running...and weight training. I was going to mention the impotance of weight training. When you lift weights you will increase the amount of lean muscle on your body.  Muscle burns more calories than fat does - even when you are resting because it takes more calories to sustain itself than fat does.  Another thing to think about is that fat cells produce more estrogen (that matter for us that are ER/PR+).  So if you can reduce fat on your body by adding muscle mass you are doing yourself a favor.  In addition weight training helps maintain bone density which is also a potential issue if you have to be on meds to block estrogen.  So I guess what I am saying ladies is try to make weight training part of your workout at least three times a week and push yourself to lift a little heavier weights to challenge your muscles.  For me right now I am doing lower body weight training and limited upper body only because of my port in the arm which is uncomfortable at times.  I plan to make sure I lift weights 3x a week. If you are pressed for time and want cardio and weights you can do 30 min of interval training (cardio where you alternate a high and moderate intensity at a ratio of 3 min moderate intensity and 1 minute of higher intensity - you can do this on any equipment - bike, elliptical, treadmill, etc...) and then do 30 min of weight training.  To keep moving during weight training and get it done, I alternate upper body and lower body exercises  so I don't have to do the "rest time" in between sets.  Do a set of lunges and then pick up some dumbells and do shoulders while your legs rest and then repeat both.  Another thing you can do is circiut training...alternate high intense weight training exercises and some cardio and get it all done in an hour.  I hope this gives you something else to think about.  Also in general you lose 3-8% of lean muscle mass per decade after age 30.....it's going unless you do something to keep it ladies.  Let me know your thoughts on this.... Annie you are a rock star girl!!!! Hugs!  Woo hoo! Rennasus:  I have seen that blog.  It's good.  I am working on my blog just so you know!  I have had some editing trouble and have not had time to sort it out yet.  I do have it in the works though and it will all be cooking and articles relative to the Anti Cancer book principles.  I am even putting the best food finds I have found that meet the criteria for convenience foods and snacks.  It's so hard to find anything that meets the rules but I have found some things.  I am also going to discuss organic shopping and the best finds by price and store.  I hope all of this will make it easier for people trying to improve their eating.  Oh and I have a fab low sugar brownie recipe to put on there for you all to enjoy! Even my son love them! Have a great day gals.   Keep movin and think about weight training.......seriously!

I just feel bad that this is not working well for you.....hugs!  Min:  No - you are not doing anything wrong!  My port is in my arm near my bicep and I feel pulling in my veins when I extend my arm.  That is why I have chosen not to do any arm things.  It feels uncomfortable...so I am a bit limited.  Hopefully they won't make me keep this dang port in long after I am done next week...I want it out!!!!  I also have a PS that does not want me to do much with my upper body since I have TE in and have more surgery in June. Supersally:  I have found some hummus with no tahini but they use other bad oils instead.  I have checked whole foods and trader joe's with no luck. I am going to experiment with Italian white bean type hummus and see what I can come up with.  The deodorant I am using is by Bubble and Bee and you can order online.  It is Pitt Putty.  It works well and is natural.  Just don't take it anywhere warm...it will crumble.  I forgot that and took it to the pool last week and it crumbled because the locker room was really warm.   Seeing the big wedding will get me all choked up again about Diana being gone....I cried and watched the whole funeral......what a shame. The fritatta sounds so good.  I love asparagus!! Suebee:  I will look at whole foods.  I did check the regular market but they had nothing without the bad oil.  I am ok with canola or EVOO.  Those are the only two oils I really want to have.  I have tried to eliminate safflower, sunflower, corn and soybean oil since they are all on the bad list for Anti Cancer diet.  It's hard!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 01:10PM mdg wrote: Hey Girls!  Got my workout in this morning - the elliptical and some weights.  I am still itching from the chemo so I saw a dermatologist yesterday and got another Rx for something topical.  I hope it works!  I have bruises all down my legs from itching....thank God it's cold again so I can cover those up with pants.  Tonight my work colleagues are all in Detroit for a meeting so my boss asked if I could join them all for dinner (we don't get together often as we are all sales reps with different territories and live in 3 states).  My boss lives here so that is why the meeting is local.  I am going.  They know nothing other than I had surgery.  I am freaking out on how to be normal and avoid the questions.  It will be hard since we are all surgical sales reps and spend time in the OR watching surgical procedures.  Lying will be hard....they don't know I had BC.  I don't know whether to just tell them or what.  I really don't want to go to dinner, but my boss begged.  He is the only one that knows what is going on.....Ugh!  This stinks!  I just hate talking about this let alone with work people.  Did you all just tell everyone at work?  I never worried about it so much as we don't see each other except for a few times a year....now with the new boobs it will probably be noticeable.  HELP!!!!   Other than that DH is interviewing everywhere....I am starting to freak out that this is going to happen fast and it can't as I have surgery next month. The job in Amsterdam wants him to come there for a face to face interview...he's in Kansas City next week and will hear back on Austin next week.  Yikes!  Life is nuts right now.  I am busy checking out the cost of living, school systems, cancer centers and stuff like that to see if we should even consider some of these.  That's a full time job! Suebee:  It is still cold here today...gray and icky!  I want spring back!  It is definately easier to hide the strange boob reconstruction issues under layers.  I am sure my aerobics class thinks I just got a bad boob job (since the TE's are so ugly and uneven).  Supersally:  Guess what?  DH is interviewing for a job in Austin.  I may be TX bound!  Yikes!  I guess I can escape the nasty winters here but be super hot in the summer hu?  So glad you are done this week.....you have me smiling on that!  I still have boob greed too...keep wondering should I do another fill?  Talked myself out of anymore...I am done!  Whatever will be - will be, right?  I can't tell by looking at them anymore..... I am glad you don't have an infection though.  I have not had any tightness in my TE's anymore...keep on the stretching and maybe it will help.  When will you have exchange?  I had to wait 6 weeks post chemo. Melanie:  Yippy! You are done with chemo today!  That's great.  Glad you went on the retreat.  I hope it gave you renewed spiritual strength as it certainly drain going through all of this.  I also hope you are rested from that.....with steroids on board it may be a few days. The mammo sounds painful...I never have to get another one since my breasts are gone.  Won't miss that much........Let us know how you feel.  I wish I could bring you a big bowl of Italian Wedding Soup..that was my favorite in the days following chemo.  Hugs! Redsky:  Sometimes I think it would be easier if everyone knew so I would not have to continue "acting" like everything is normal.  I am not a good actress but feel exhausted from keeping the secret and acting all the time.  How is the tightness in the chest? Any better?  I hope so.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 12:32PM mdg wrote: Heeellloooo ladies!  Glad it's Friday.  Can't wait to spend time with my DH and son this weekend.  Got my workout in today...60 min elliptical and 25 min of weights.   I can tell you my legs are feeling it today!  Ugh!  I can't wait until the tired leg feeling from the chemo goes away.  I feel it more now than during chemo.  The itch is settling a little...hoping that continues.  Dinner was good last night so I will put it on the blog...DH had seconds so that's a good sign!  Suebee:  You are not a slug..sometimes life gets in the way of things and some days the body doesn't cooperate.  Tomorrow is a new day...so Zumba away and you are good!  You will get back on track (otherwise I will hunt you down - you know MI is not that far from OH!!!).  I too am going to be transitioning into summer foods...salads, marinated chicken, kabobs and I don't know what else yet!  My DH loves to BBQ.  Now if I could just find some healthy BBQ sauce!  I guess I will have to make that too.  Melanie: CONGRATULATIONS!!! Girl you are done!  That's great news!  I too feel like it has not registered that I don't have to go and get chemo again next week......I am so use to the 3 week cycle.  It will take time for our bodies to recover but they will in time.  I am glad your arm is doing better...that is great news!  The dinner you had sounds great....I miss beef sometimes!  I for sure miss mashed potatoes!   That's great that your dad has been losing weight and you have lost body fat!  I think you should just focus on being healthy and seeing how your body changes.  Don't get fixated on the scale, ya know?  When do you start rads? How often/how long?  Have a great weekend ladies!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 22, 2011 06:14AM mdg wrote: Hi ladies...it is a gorgeous day here again!  I am going to have to get out and take my little one to the park or something - but avoid the sun for me.  The rash came back last night on my torso (Ugh!)).  I have no idea why.  Every time I stop the oral steroids, the rash comes back in a day or two.  I put the topical cream on it....I don't want to take the oral steroids.  I am going to see if the cream will do the trick.  I wonder how long this is going to last!  I washed my hair again yesterday...it's hanging on though.  It still sheds more than before chemo, but it's doing OK.   I was good yesterday .....we had a graduation party and I did not eat anything - no chips, no cake, no nothing!  We had pizza dinner last night with some friends...I did have two slices of pizza with veggies and sauce and just a sprinkle of parmesan.  I made a huge salad and had lots of that...they had a plate of cupcakes I did not even have one!  So glad.  I am having such a hard time eating out or eating at friend's houses.  My diet is so limited I just hate going anywhere without my own food.  Because I am hormone positive, unless they use organic dairy or meat I really can't have anything.  I don't even want to eat anywhere but home anymore.  Can anyone relate???  We have a BBQ at the Monster In Law's house in a few weeks and she is not having one thing I can eat.  Is it rude to just bring a salad with grilled chicken just for me?  She's having roasted pig, hot dogs, brats, potato salad, cole slaw, etc...nothing healthy.   I can't have hot dogs because of nitrates and can't eat pork either.  Potatoes are out and I don't like cole slaw.   Is anyone else hormone + and dealing with the same thing? SubBee:  I don't know why no pizza places have wheat crust....I guess if you are going to eat pizza most people don't want it healthy at all....  I am glad you zumba'd.  Good for you.  The fluffing must be getting hard.  Can you buy some padding from the fabric store that you would use in a bathing suit or something?   I don't know how you "fluff".....I haven't had to.  A baggy T shirt may help you feel less obvious.   I will look into the photo posting next week.  I have not been on the photo forum in a while.  I think you are right...a few of us are the same size so it may help to see how things look and compare notes.  Thanks. Redsky:  We have similar body sizes. I will try to post photos next week and you can look.  I have a 350 cc TE in right now that is over filled to 510cc's.   That should give you a good idea....just ignore the fact that one of my TE's is 1 inch higher than the other and will be corrected in exchange.  Mine are firm but with the stretching they are not tight at all.  They really don't bother me other than how they look.  I will let you know when I post photos so you can look.    I will also look at yours and see if that is how mine looked at that point.  I do have photos for most of my various fills except the last two I think.  Supersally:  I am so glad you are done!  Eventhough you are in a fog, it will be the last time girl!  Enjoy having your mom there..that's great!  THe job search is going OK.  The Austin job didn't work out...still pushing forward on Amsterdam and Kansas City (what a difference between those two cities!).  Just think ladies...if we wind up in Amsterdam, you will have somewhere nice to visit with a guest room (free rent!) for a vacation!  Wouldn't that be fun to actually finally meet up - especially somewhere so cool?  I told DH that we MUST have a guest room for sure so people can come and enjoy Amsterdam with us!  Renn:  I am so glad you forgot about BC for the weekend.  I hope to do the same next weekend in Chicago.  That darn incision...what are we going to do with that??? I hope it heals up.  Goodness it has been a real pain hasn't it?  How is it today?  I hope drying out.....keep us posted.  Soooo cool you won money in Vegas.  What was your game of choice?  I am a roulette gal when I gamble.  I love it!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 05:09AM mdg wrote: Goodmorning gals!  I am off to the Med onc this morning..I am sure she is going to give me the tamoxafin Rx today.  I have my list of questions ready for her.  I am heading to the gym after that to do the elliptical without my arms.  My arm is pretty sore today from port removal.  It looks gross too....I will have to keep my arms down at the gym so no one sees that - ick!  Tonight it's turkey tacos...my son requested those.  We do organic fat free refried beans, whole grain flour tortillas and organic cheese/sour cream.  It's all good!  DH flys to KC tonight for tomorrow's interview.  He also has an opportunity now in Chicago (much closer to home- only a 5 hour drive!) that he will find out more about today on a phone interview.  Austin is out which is a bummer - good job and Austin looked really cool....oh well.  Still waiting to hear on Amsterdam so we can decide if we are still interested.  Supersally:  Glad you are feeling a bit better.  My legs are still burning too!  Hopefully it won't last long.  Glad your skin is healed up well and there is no concern.  It's nice they will remove your port at the same time..I just wanted mine out as it's in my arm and harder to hide now that it's summer.  So exchange in July/Aug.....good deal!  My PS also waits at least 6 weeks post chemo for exchange to make sure counts are back up.  Redsky:  How is the fill pain today?  I found I got sore even in my upper back after fills....things are all connected so it's not odd to feel pain in other areas I would think. Try to keep stretching....twice a day.  I do believe it will help.  Suebee:  How is your fill pain today?  Better I hope!  I guess I won't complain at all about how my PS handled my scheduling compared to your military situation.  You are truly at their mercy....at least it is covered.  I hope it all works out well for you in the end.  So I am laughing at all of you and the boob greed.  I told my DH about our boob greed conversation last night and then confessed that I had the largest boobs in the group too!  He really thought that was funny and was shocked I was the biggest one with the most boob greed!  LOL!  Workout and eat healthy today ladies....every day makes a difference!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 07:22PM mdg wrote: Hi all...I missed you gals!  My BFF came on Friday night for the weekend with her 2 boys.  We had so much fun this weekend!  I made them pizza for dinner on Friday night (healthy with whole wheat crust...her 13 year old was like "what are you making???" - I know him well so we joke).  Sat we went to the pool - I hid in the shade due to the rash and did not get in the pool except my feet for a few minutes.  I managed to keep the boobs harnessed in the bikini top..BFF was on "boob patrol" just in case.  My sister and kids came up to the pool too....love seeing my neice and nephew.  We came back and grilled out a healthy dinner of chicken, salmon, scallops, slow roasted tomato and basil couscous and garlic broccoli.  I made them try my Black Bean Brownies...BFF loved them and wanted the recipe right away!! Her picky 3 year old (does not eat anything) even liked them!  Too funny!  My son loves them and was telling them "mommy makes good brownies...I love them...they are soooo good".  Oh how I love my son.  I did NOT workout all weekend and ate way too much.  I teach class tomorrow night so they are going to get worked hard!  Shannon:  I hope your energy level picks back up...I just started tamoxifen and hope my energy does not go down!  How long have you been on it?  I think you should keep moving...I know during chemo I felt better exercising - and on the days I didn't I was way more tired.  Keep moving!  You have to! Suebee:  I love how much we all talk about our boobs!  We talk about boobs more than men do these days (LOL!).  I can't beleive I will have surgery in 2 1/2 weeks too....gosh I hope the implants turn out OK.  I want to have faith I will love the results.....getting worried.  Oh and I bet you look stunning and people are jealous of your hot bod in Zumba!  You got it girl so you "shake it" when you are in there!  WIth your new boobs...you will be even hotter!  Just think of all the cute cleavage tops we can buy once we don't have ugly TE's anymore!!!  Shopping for everyone!  I LOVE the underconstruction sign...hilarous!  I am now worried about the 450cc implant being a double D!  I am suppose to get a 450 cc implant.....yikes!  Oh and I am dreading October...too much pink crap everywhere.  I don't need anymore reminders...I think about it all the time on my own thank you very much.  Maybe we should all go out of town together for the month of October....just an idea.  Somewhere without pink reminders....tropical would be good too!  I am also so sorry about your MIL.  Prayers are being said for your family.  So sorry.... Renn: I am sorry about BFF dad.  My BFF lost her mom 2 years ago....it is so hard to see someone you love so much be so sad.  Hugs and prayers to her and her family.  I know you probably want to go but your BFF knows you need to heal yourself right now.  You can find other ways to be there for her.....that's what BFF's do.  I hope you had a good hike.  Also how much things can change in 4 months...this week on the 8th will be 6 mo's since my diagnosis....so much has happened since then.  I still can't believe this is my life!  How are you healing?  I hope better...please tell me it is shrinking.... Supersally:  How was your ride?  Good that you are going early...99 degrees is killer girl!  Without SE's most of us could not handle that!  How are you feeling?  I hope better...so glad you are done with chemo!!  LOL at office space....I work alone though so I have no local co-workers.  I am working from my home office all this week too.  I guess I don't have to worry about how I look or even shower much....nice!  Makes it easier after my morning workout...just rinse off and don't worry about make up or hair.  Redsky:  Glad you found a suit...what a relief. Hiding these things is stressful!  I have no idea what kind of TE's I have...don't know what a 4 tab thing is...I didn't see that on my surgery report so I don't think I have the same kind as you.  I am sorry you are in pain.  You do have to listen to your body.  Remember that I was in a world of pain until I stopped fills for a while so I can relate.  I hope it gets better soon.  Do what you can and listen to your body in the coming weeks.

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2011 06:55PM mdg wrote: I taught my step class tonight and I have to say that all of my training on the elliptical has made my class feel SO easy!  I was walking through it tonight...hardly seems intense anymore.  I guess the added resistance of the elliptical has made my legs so much stronger than what I usually get in step class.  I only teach a few more classes before surgery...then I think I will quit.  The director is still not giving me Saturaday classes (she only gave me 1 in June and kept the other instructor on the others).  I figure I will just bail on her after surgery just how she took my class away when I had my last surgery.....I don't care. We will be moving anyway I am sure so whatever......(am I being mean????).  I have too many other things to worry about right now.  Not much else going on.....DH had the interview in KC and we are pretty sure they are making an offer.  He is very interested in two jobs in Chicago and now Seattle is in the mix.  I can't keep up....Amsterdam is out of the mix which is OK.  I have not talked to him today (it's his golf night with the guys) so who knows the latest update (it seem to change daily!).  I will let you know.  I also went to my holistic MD today.  I got put on some citrus pectin, vitamin C and floresence tea and one more thing I can't remember right now. Anyone else taking anything like this?  I am still on iron, vitamin D, multi vitamins, B complex and a probiotic.  He also said to pick up some biotin to help with hair growth.  Just curious if anyone else takes supplements/herbs.    Melanie:  Glad to hear from you.  I know family is frustrating....don't feel bad.  My brother lives 10 minutes from me and hardly calls.  Saw him on Easter and not since that....he never even called before my last chemo.  I called him and asked for a favor last week and he said no.  I get it....what is it with brothers anyway???   You will be running marathons again before you know it if I have anythign to say about it!  Don't you worry....when the time is right I will bug you enough!  Let us know how RO appt goes.  I don't have to do rads so I don't know much about it.  Let me know how many and how often.  I hope it goes quick...painless.....  Suebee:  You go girl!   You are so dedicated!  Look at you! OK I feel better about the double D.  I hope zumba is fun tomorrow.....enjoy!  I agree with you - checking in with you gals is a high priority each day!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 06:15PM mdg wrote: Busy with work....I did manage to teach class tonight.  Not much new...just chillin and watching the ultimate in TV trash...The Bachelorette.  DH has a golf league followed by beer on Monday night so it allows me control of the TV..he he!  I am going to pop some popcorn next and continue watching this train wreck of a show!  It's mindless.....I need that right now.   No news on the job front except Seattle is now in the mix.  Waiting on the offer from Kansas City.  Chicago and Boston now in the mix.....why can't we at least end up in a city where one of you gals are????  That would be a treat.... :)  Hope you all had a healthy and happy day.    SueBee: Congrats!  I am so glad to hear you are doing OK.  I did not know we would have a surgical bra after.....at my pre op appt they told me not to wear a bra after but I don't know if they meant after a surgical bra...they never mentioned anything about it...each PS does it different so who knows.  475 girl = yowza!  That guy at Zumba will have some t-shirt to read when you get back (LOL!)..... Renn...you are right about toxic people.  I have to just not think about them and avoid them.  I think it will be a bit easier once we move away and really don't even have to see them.  Living in the moment should not allow much time for thoughts about toxic people....  How are you healing?  We need an update girl! Shannon:  2 hours!  You are giving me motivation...my 1 hour step class today isn't going to cut it!  I am stepping it up tomorrow...LOL!  Glad you survived the road trip. I am sure it meant a lot to your son that you went.   It does feel good to go somewhere and be a "normal person" and not have people look at you with pity.  Melanie;  I think I would completely break down and go all teary if someone asked how I "really" was.......I seem to keep that to myself or share with you gals who get it.  I am too afraid to tell the people so many of the things I think...you gals know what I mean??  I can't wait to hear what your new PT says about the arm.  I hope this PT has some good ideas on how to cure this and cure it fast for you.  You deserve that.  I am saying a prayer for you about that arm tonight for sure!!! Supersally:  So glad the trip was fun...I hope you were super relaxed and rested after that.  It's hard to go back to the "real world" after a trip that was needed as much as that.  Isn't it hard being away from the gang sometimes?  Checking up with all of you is a special part of my day now!  I miss you guys when I can't log on!  Sometimes I check what's going on from my phone but it's hard to type well on there so my comments have to be short...but at least I can see what you gals are up to!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2011 05:50AM mdg wrote: SueBee:  What a messy little eater you are having food down your shirt!  LOL!  My 4 year old still does that :)  YOu must invest in some Shout or Spray N Wash or you will ruin all your new foob flaunting shirts!  I am glad you are doing ok.  I was going to ask if I would need help or anything after my exchange?   I have my surgery on Thur and my cousin is going to have to take me because DH can't take more time off work because of interviews....he is off to Chicago today for an interview and used the excuse of my surgery.  I will be home alone on Friday and over the weekend DH will be here.  On Monday DH has to go to Seattle.  Will I be able to drive 2 miles to take my son to school and back if I don't take pain pills?  I have no help.  Not one person has offered other than my cousin that is taking me to surgery.  I hope I can manage....let me know your thoughts.  I hope you get a new boob trick before the dr....I think if you knock on it - it may do something back!  I can hear you saying Hello and having your foob respond "hello, hello, hello, etc.." in an echo or something:) Renn:  I get it...no one offers to help with anything!  I don't consider myself a dependent person but it's like as soon as my surgery passed everyone just backed away and does nothing.  They just think I am fine.  Most people are like "oh, you are having another surgery?"  Then I tell them and then they say nothing about helping.   I guess because we look fine they assume we are.  It would be nice to have someone just help a little at times. Julie:  Thanks for the encourgement about moving.  I know it will be OK the timing just couldn't be worse given the whole BC thing.  I will get through it..what choice do I have?  As far as the enema...I had on after surgery and during chemo...didn't know I was not suppose to do that until after when the NP yelled at me.  I was desperate.  Both times I had to send DH to the pharmacy at 3:30am and 5am......he made me get another enema to have on hand after my surgery this week so he did not have to go there in the middle of the night.  So gross....nothing like being in the kind of agony where you have NO shame or modesty.  So degrading......just another SE of BC hu?  Shannon:  I noticed I had a small bump from scar tissue from my drain on my R side.  Could it be that?  I also discovered a lump on my Left hip.  I go see the dr on Wed.  I am nervous because I am having a lot of pain in my R hip/glute area and have been on and off for a while.  I am convinced it has spread to my pelvis or something....I know my dr will talk me off the ledge - at least I hope so! Redsky:  Have a fab trip.  HOw fun.  We want to hear all about it when you get back!!! Annie:  Yes..work is dreaded....I am working through Wed and then I am off for a month for surgery.  I am glad about being off....it gets in the way of everything and seems so insignificant now...a waste of my time after the BC dx.  Try to have a good week. ANyone else exercising today?  I am teaching my last class before surgery tonight.  I will miss teaching again.......a whole month of no classes - boo!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2011 04:53PM mdg wrote: Julie. I was one of those small boobed gals and most women in my family were big and would ask me "what happened to you?". I have been waiting for the boobie fairy for a long time...since I was 12 I think. She finally arrived... As for the mojo comment coming with SueBee's twins....I got ripped off. I did not get any mojo with mine. I am calling my PS first thing Monday morning to complain...or should I page him right now???? I want my mojo! I am pretty sure DH wants it too......
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 06:01AM mdg wrote: Redsky:  I hurt a lot in the ribs and under the arms lower like where your lat muscle comes in.  My PS had to re-do some stuff to even me out. He moved Lefty up and moved Righty inward.  They still look a little uneven but I really can't tell due to bandages and a little swelling.  So far they look smaller than I hoped (yes I am still boob greedy) but I will be OK with it...they are healthier than the breasts I had before and that's what matters.  I get to remove bandages today and take a peak...I can even take a shower which will feel good.  I feel gross!  SueBee:  Your antibiotics are done?  I have to be on them for 1 month!!!  I was shocked by this but then again my WBC were down slightly before surgery and below the normal range.  I guess it is precautionary.....My PS has me letting them hang..he does not want me in a bra or anything for at least a month.  I feel ok as long as I am on the pain meds.....right now I feel fine.  I am going to go for a leisure stroll today as our subdivision is having a garage sale.  I never go to garage sales but I thought it would be a good excuse to walk and browse around.  It is going to be 75 and sunny here today.....I think I will put on one of my new "boob" shirts that I bought a few months ago...cute tank with ruffles in the front.  I have been dying to wear it!  If it's warm enough I am putting it on.  So DH is marinating the Greek Chicken (in my blog) and I also put on another batch of slow roasted tomatoes (I am addicted to them....OMG they are my favorite).  I am going to make some bruschetta with them for dinner.  My mom is coming for a visit and for dinner tonight.  She wants to see me after surgery and had to work yesterday.  Other than that.....I got nothing going on.  I am starting to plan my son's birthday party  - it's next month.  He wants a Harry Potter theme.....I am googling Harry Potter like mad......he's so excited.  I designed an invitation for him yesterday and he loved it!  I am trying to stay busy......  I will chat with you later...I have lots of time on my hands for a month!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 02:59PM mdg wrote: Suebee...my PS never talked about drop and fluff...I just googled that. Who knew?

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 04:57AM mdg wrote: Shannon:  therapy....I can't wait to start some once we move.  So nice that you did the walk.....were you jumping around in front of the hospital doing the crazy dance?  As far as nipples, my PS does some type of flap procedure and then grafts the areolas too using skin from my c-section scar.  He does fat grafting at the same time.  I have to look more into that....all I know is he is taking fat from my thighs!  (I want to talk him into taking extra out...do you think he will go for that???).  I think this technique for nipples makes them look so much more real.  I don't like the look of just the nipple and then the areola tattoo by itself.  It looks too odd to me.  My PS does not do the tattoos until 3 months post nipples.  I have to research PS's in Chicago.  I don't think I can come back and have my nipples done her as it would require me to stay here at least 2 weeks and he does not want me to drive.....that will be too hard to coordinate as I don't have family here willing to help me with getting to/from the hospital.  My friends would probably do it but they all work and I just feel horrible to ask them to take a day off for this....plus it would be too hard to be away from my family for 2 weeks.....especially right after moving.  I am going to see if my PS can refer me to someone in Chicago he knows.  I have to get on that quickly or I will be waiting forever to get an appointment.  One more thing to worry about..........

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2011 01:30PM mdg wrote: I did also look the weight of my implants up too...at least 2lbs total.  Who knew?  I took the weekend off from exercise as my mom and sister were visiting.  I ate horrible!   Oh well....tomorrow is a new day and I am back on salads.  I think I have gained a few pounds with vacation and then our move so I need to get strict again.  My clothes fit a little tighter.  I so want to try yoga but the class times are crappy at our club.  If I have time this week maybe I will try the CD's I have...it's better than nothing. Red:  Glad your back is feeling better.  I had horrible upperback pain during my fills.  It has been bothering me here and there again.  It really hurt on Friday after cleaning the whole apartment.  I think  I need to get back to doing my upper body strengthening exercises the PT gave me post MX.  I think the musles are weak and it's hard to hold up the foobs....I am going to try my exercises again this week.  My PT gave me some good one's. Renn - It cooled off here...only in the 60's!  I had to pull out pants today!  Yikes! I hope everyone had a great long weekend......I did enjoy the time with my family.  Jayden was so happy to see his cousins and so sad when they left today :( Oh and I made a really good broccoli and egg breakfast casserole this weekend.  When I get time I will post it to the blog.  It was easy and you could make it the night before and just pop it in the oven in the morning.  I made it special for my nephew who loves broccoli in his eggs in the morning.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2011 10:39AM mdg wrote: Red:  No post exchange exercises.....I just went back to some of the things I did before.  Now I feel good...no tightness except for my R shoulder in a certain position is painful but that happened after my lumpectomy - they screwed my shoulder up during surgery.   I posted the casserole recipe so check it out if you like eggs. Shannon - I so wish I still had a yard..... Renn - I was told the only follow up would be physical exams by me and any docs I see.  I will continue to see a Med Onc because of tammi but no scans or things because I was stage 1.  I will be curious what my new med onc will say....I feel like they are just abandoning me....I feel like they should be doing something.  Tonight I am going to try something odd for dinner.....a tomato sauce made with lentils.  I am trying to do some meat free dinner.  I hope it turns out OK.....I can already picture Jayden sayng "yuck"!

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2011 08:03PM mdg wrote: Sue we all have those same questions with each step we take in this.  I was checking out boobs in the gym today and so wished mine looked better and was wondering...hummm should I fix that?  Then I realized that is rediculous.  I have been through so much already and I am very happy to have my BC breast gone.  I too worry that the nipples won't work well or won't look good but I also have to realize that I will never look natural no matter what the dr does or how good he is.  I had a BMX and I will always look that way naked.  The main thing is looking good in clothes and feeling good about how I look.  DH was still interested when I looked my worse (post surgery with hardly any fills) and he was obsessed with the nasty TE's too.  At least I know none of that matters and he loves me regardless.  That part does make me feel better about myself.  These decisions are hard because we all want perfect breasts but given the situation I am not really sure that's possible.  I hope to have a good outcome from my nipple surgery at some point but hope I am not disappointed.  This all sucks....  Oh and on the topic of checking out boobs at the gym, can I just tell you that everyone here in Chicago has huge boobs?  There were lots of large perky one's (fake) on the 40 year old mommies......we all know they had help.  There are way more huge boobs at my gym here than in Detroit.  Lordy!  One girls boobs were so big and she was thin....I am a D so what the heck size was she???  I can't even imagine!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 07:04PM mdg wrote: Barbara,  as far as my workouts, I really just workout hard and push myself.  I don't measure heart rate anymore or any of that.  I do the elliptical 3 days a week for an hour at a higher level to provide a good resistance.  I am trying to run 3 miles two days a week and do weights on those days.  When I do weights, I choose to do things that use lots of muscle groups and keep me moving and sweating.  I do lunges with arms, deadlifts, squats off the step, lunges off the steps, etc....I try to work all major muscle groups but am not doing too much on my chest until I meet with my new PS.  I also do the PT exercises I was given for my posture.  I can tell with these huge foobs it is easy to start hunching over.  I do some upper back/rotator cuff exercises to keep me strong to hold my posture correctly.  I also stretch for about 10 minutes after every workout including chest stretches and shoulder stretches.  As far as food...I mentally track what I eat for the day.  I try to limit some carbs. I have moved away from wheat more these days and am trying to eat less inflammatory types of grains when possible.  I stopped obsessing and weighing myself.  I use to have eating disorder issues so I am careful to not go there again.  For me I go by how my clothes fit to keep things in check and every few months I may weigh myself.  I also try to pre-package snacks to have on hand and eat more frequent small meals.  I cut up apples and toss them in lemon and put them in individual sandwich ziplock bags so I can just take them on the go.  I also put 1/4 cup (1 serving) of walnuts or almonds in snack size ziplock bags so they are ready to go too.  I drink 2 water bottles of water (in my stainless bottle of course) while working out and eat a snack of nuts after my workout.  I try to eat carbs in the morning pre workout....multigrain type cereal.  I just don't have the patience to record it all everyday.  I just know that if I have a crazy eating day, the next day I try to buckle down.  I also avoid extra carbs...for dinner tonight we had salsa chicken tacos.  Instead of the spelt flour tortilla, I put my chicken over spinach and made a salad.  I do this often....skip the pasta or carbs and have more salad.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2011 05:48AM mdg wrote: Shannon - I too have been wanting more vegtarian things.  I am dying to make stuffed portabella mushrooms and eggplant parmigiana right now!  Before I ate chicken almost daily...now not as often.  I have also been eating more beans/lentils lately.  In the past I always made chicken soup -now I make veggie soup.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2011 06:26PM mdg wrote: I use to meal plan for the week before BC and lately I have been laxed about it and more fly by the seat of my pants.  I have to get back on track! I like meal planning better - I save money, waste less food and it is less stressful.  As far as beef, I had given it up all together for a while and now I eat it once every few weeks.  I don't eat any meats that are not grass fed or organic.  I don't eat any chicken or turkey that is not organic either.  As far as cheeses (I don't eat a ton of dairy but I do eat a little) I do organic or hormone free (Trader Joe's has a lot of hormone free cheeses).  Eggs- organic and free range only.  We hardly eat out anymore (not that we ate out much before anyway, but now it's less).  When we do eat out, I select restaurants that have amish chicken, grass fed beef or organic chicken/turkey/beef.  If we eat somewhere that doesn't offer that, I eat salad and a few sides of veggies.  I don't eat pasta/rice out because it is never whole grain.  We have found a few restaurants that have amish/organic/grass fed meats/poultry so that is where we eat when we go out a lot of the time.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 05:42AM mdg wrote: I did not have a face rash, but a burning hive like rash at one point that covered about 75% of my body.  It lasted for at least 3 mo's.  My med onc said it was not from the chemo....whatever.  I did go to my internist and dermatologist multiple times and they tried to help me since my med onc dismissed it.  I was on multiple rounds of steroids and when I stopped the steroids it would come back.  I also took antihitamines daily to help with the burning/itching.  Sarna cream was cool and menthol like which gave me temporary relief.  I also used topical steroids and hydrocortizone cream.  See your derm....I know it's a pain but they may be able to help since your med onc won't.  I hope you can get rid of it quicker than I did.  I think it was from taxotere.  I didn't get it until after my 3rd chemo. I think it took time to build up in my system.

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2013 08:34PM mdg wrote: The recovery will depend on which type of reconstruction you do.  I had BMX with TE's placed.  I was not allowed to drive for a month.  I didn't have a dog at the time - I do now though and have had dogs in the past.  I would not have been able to do anything with a dog on a leash....that would have been impossible!  I was in the bed for a few days after getting home.  After a week or so my husband did not work from home anymore and I could get myself something to eat, get showered and get dressed.  I still could not have done much with a dog on a leash....I would be able to bend down and put a dog on a leash but there is no way I could have held the leash with a dog on it and had the dog apply any pressure to the leash.  I was off work for a long time because I have a physical job and I also ended up doing chemo.  Your surgeon should be able to tell you how long you need to be off work based on whatever surgery you are having.  Do you have any neighbors that can come over and help with the dog?  Maybe there is a neighborhood kid that you can pay to come over and help?   Good luck with everything.  LEt us know what type of reconstruction you decide on then we can help give more information.

Posts.Content: May 10, 2011 08:57AM mdg wrote: I just wanted to send a big hug....I started my journey in December.  Take things one step at a time.  I know it's hard not to think about everything at once, but you have to try.  I am a mom of 4 year old so I know what it's like to worry about your kids through this.  I had a lumpectomy, bilateral mastectomy and just finished chemo last week.  My son doesn't even know what cancer is.  I have done really well through all of this and life is normal for him.  He knows I had a boo boo and surgery.  He knows I get some special medicines sometimes but he has never seen me sick.  I was able to keep my hair through chemo too so I never had to explain chemo.  He doesn't even really know I was sick...that gives me peace of mind.  I know all of this is scary...you will get through it.  Take care of yourself - be kind to yourself.  Accept help from others to make things easier for your family (I could care less about eating through this but people offered to bring meals after surgery and I thought that would be good for my husband and son).   I just tried to keep things as normal as possible for my son and that has made this easier.  Feel free to PM me if I can offer any help or support.....hugs!

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2013 07:02AM mdg wrote: I am sorry you have to walk down this road.  These are very difficult decisions.  I think like others have said, there is no right answer,but only the right answer for you personally. There are so many things to consider when making the decision but most of all you have to decide on something you can live with - with no regret.  I choose BMX and the things I considered were: I had a young son - only age 4 and I wanted to treat thing aggresively I was not that attached to my breasts - always wished they were a bit bigger but would have never done surgery for that without BC I knew the survival rates for lumpectomy vs MX were the same,but the recurrence rates were slightly lower with MX.  I just wanted to give myself the best chance of not having this happen again I had great surgeons and had confidence in their abilities to do reconstruction I am a worry person and I knew I would handle it better to not have breasts to worry about I knew my body already had the ability to grow cancer in my breasts so I did not want to keep them You will have to think through what matters most to you.  I know it is hard,but you will come to a decision. Talk to your doctors.  Ask good questions and even get a second opinion if you want to  - just to hear another doctor's perspective (I did).  Good luck!

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2011 05:00AM mdg wrote: This is a hard decision.  For me I was Grade 1 based on the core biopsy.  I decided to do BLMX and am still deciding on chemo.  I had the oncotype test which has not made my decision clear on the chemo yet.  My SNB showed clear nodes which was great, but when my surgeon was in there he saw the tumor and removed it because it was right there so I got a surprise lumpectomy (eventhough I had already planned BLMX).  The path report came back and I learned two new things about the mass - it has angiolymphatic invasion and there were some Grade 2 cells in it so the final pathology indicates Grade 2.  So I guess my point in all of this is the final pathology could show something else so just be prepared.  For me the decision for BLMX was not that hard.  The key things I considered were: age - I am 45 and have a 4 year old son - I want to be aggressive in treatment to give me the best odds Survival rates for lump+rads vs. MX are the same, but recurrence rates are higher in lump+rads Now that I have BC in 1 breast I am twice as likely to get it in the other breast This was all I needed to hear. I am having BLMX with immediate reconstruction in 4 days.  Am I freaked out?  Yes - I am, but I know I am really OK with my decision and know 100% it is the right thing for me.  The decision is personal and there is no right or wrong answer....just your answer.  Good luck!

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 04:51AM mdg wrote: I am Stage 1 and on chemo.  I started 2 weeks ago. You can see my stats below.  My oncotype came back at 17 which is the highest score in the low range.  I had hoped it would be much lower so I could just turn my back on chemo, but it was not.  My doc's said if the score was low, no chemo but if it came back in the mid range it would become a choice.  I got two opinions.  The first one said no chemo based on the oncotype.  The second opinion felt there was potential benefit to me.  The thing that made me choose chemo was that I had angiolymphatic invasion listed as present on my pathology report.  This means the cancer had a pathway to travel by blood even though my lymph nodes were clear.  I was also upgraded from Grade 1 to Grade 2 after my lumpectomy.  Eventhough I ended up doing a BLMX I was still worried about the angiolymphatic invasion.  I have a 4 year old son and I want to do everything I can to blast the cancer now.  I don't want to do this again and I hope by doing it now I will get anything floating out there.  I don't know if it was the right thing or not but I do know that I can live with my decision knowing I did everything I could.  I knew that I would never be OK with skipping chemo if my cancer came back down the road.  I would blame myself.  My compromise was keeping my hair duing chemo.  My doctor is a supporter of the cold caps and I am doing them to keep my hair through chemo.  I will know this next week if it works for me.  It was not as bad as I thought it would be at all...it was very tolerable for me so doing it three more times on my next chemos won't be a big deal.  So I have a total of 4 rounds of chemo over 9 weeks and at the end of that I hope to have my hair and just close the door on cancer.  This is a hard decision.  I agonized over the chemo debate for weeks and it caused me the most stress of the entire BC process.  Once I made the decision it was like a sigh of relief for me.  I was scared to start but once getting started it's OK.  I tolerated the first round OK with a few minor side effects, but all is normal now.  I get my son up for school every morning, run errands, workout daily and cook dinner for my family just like I always did.  It's only 9 weeks...that's what I keep telling myself.  Now I only have 7 weeks left! Good luck with your decision.  I know how hard it is.

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2012 09:34PM mdg wrote: I did not move for treatment, but I did go through bilateral mastectomy and reconstruction followed by chemo.  For me the worst was after the surgeries as far as needing help.  I was not allowed to drive for a few weeks and I could not lift anything for a while.  As far as chemo - I did not really have much help but I also felt decent through chemo.  I was able to do most things during chemo.  I don't know if your doctor will make you stay away from work through chemo.  I did not work during chemo because I wanted the time without the stress, but I was allowed to go to the gym and exercise daily.  In addition to that, my son was only 4 and went to pre school so who knows what germs he brought home...and I did not get sick.  My doctor also gave me neulasta shots to help keep my blood counts up.  I know lots of other people that worked in a school during treatment, so you may not have to be off.  Another thing to consider is that you will have an ongoing relationship with the doctors that treat you.  Once you move back to CA you will have to find all new doctors.  This is a pain.  We relocated after my chemo and during my reconstruction so I had to find new doctors.  Blech!  I wish I could have stayed with the same doctors through all of it.  I still see my oncologist a few times a year and my plastic surgeon once a year. I would have still been seeing my breast surgeon for an appointment or two but we moved.  If you do stay where you are for treatment, the American Cancer Society does have lots of free services.  They have people that can even drive you to chemo.  You may want to look into their services if you don't travel to get treatment.    Best of luck with treatment.  Hugs!
Posts.Title: Relocation for treatment??? Krissy5 wenweb

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2011 08:43PM mdg wrote: I am sorry your mom has to go through this....it stinks!  As far as chemo, I had to make a decision myself.  My stats are below and my oncotype was 17 which is the highest score in the low group.  The problem is at a score of 18 or higher my one onc said chemo would be my decision.  At 17 she said no chemo.  I was concerned because on my pathology report it indicated I had angiolymphatic invasion in my tumor...meaning the cancer had an opportunity to spread by blood but we don't know if it did/didn't.  I too am stage 1 but I am Grade 2 which is intermediate.  So I saw another med onc.  She reviewed everything and presented my case at tumor board and 3 of the 4 med onc's suggested chemo because of intermediate grade, my age (45), angiolymphatic invasion and because I am in excellent health.  I had to decide..I chose chemo.  I am on taxotere and cytoxan...4 cycles.  I am half way done and have my 3rd treatment next Wednesday.  It has been easier than I thought it would be (not that it is fun at all).  I guess I would also completely review the pathology report and see if there is anything else in ther that gives you any reason to do/not do chemo.  The angiolymphatic invasion made me decide.  My doc's never talked about the angiolymphatic invasion piece much until I personally read the entire pathology report and brought it up and asked a ton of questions.  Make sure you understand the entire pathology report.  Best of luck in your decision.
Posts.Title: Failed oncotype - chemo or no chemo? allmylove NormaJean65

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 07:14AM mdg wrote: Oh as a mom too my heart goes out to you.  I did not have to explain the big C or hair loss (I used cold caps and kept my hair through chemo).  My son is only 4.  I often wonder how I would have explained all of this if my son was older - old enough to know more.  I think I would tell him there are lots of different types of cancers and not all are the same.  Some are very mild and some more strong.  I would also use the example of my mom...she had thyroid cancer over 30 years ago and is fine today.  I would let him know that the good thing is they have strong medicines that help make the cancer cells go away.  We know that the medicines are doing what they should when my hair falls out.....I think you keep things simple and ask her if she has questions.  Only give more information if she asks......also ask questions to fnd out how she feels about what you have told her.  I was so worried to tell my son about my BLMX...I simply told him I had a boo boo and the dr said he had to do surgery to take it out to make me healthy.  My son got sad and made a face and I asked him why..he said because it would probably hurt me. I assured him the surgeon said I would be OK but I would be sore and recovering for a while and I could not run, play and lift him for a while.  I told him what I could do though...play wii, read books, color, watch movies etc.....  I also told him I had special treats for him (I got him a goodie bag full of things we could do together during my recovery...movies, games, etc...) and that he would have a sleepover at his cousin's house when  I had surgery.  After explaining all of it...I asked "do you have any questions?"  He said "yes, can I bring my light saber to uncle John's for the sleepever"?  My husband and I laughed.....kids handle more than you think.  I think less information is better and if they ask questions, just answer them with a very light simple answer....they will indicate to you if they want more information.  My son only asked once where the boo boo was....I said in my chest.  That was enough for him.  While I realize your daughter is older and the conversation will look different....I just wanted to let you know that the conversation was way easier than I imagined....he went on playing right after we were done talking.  Good luck....I know how hard it is.
