Posts.Content: May 9, 2011 08:06PM mdg wrote: I am sorry you are going through this but I am glad you posted it. I am going through the same thing with my family and my husband's family.  Quite honestly it seems like they just don't seem to care that I have BC, had a BLMX and just completed chemo Wed.  My own mom doesn't call because she thinks I should call her....she didn't even call before my last chemo...I hadn't heard from her for 2 weeks!   I am dealing with so much - I am not going to be all worried about my mom's needs right now.  She needs to grow up.  I would never do that to my son!   My brother also did not even call for over a month.  I live 10 minutes from my family.  Niether my brother or mom even brought a meal after my surgery of during chemo when my friends organized meals and contacted them.  My husband's family has not done anything either.  No card, email or phone call from his one brother and wife that live 35 minutes from us (his other brother lives out of state and they organized meals for us and sent me a care package - oh and lots of cards/emails/phone calls).  I am deeply hurt by my family's lack of concern.  I am done doing things for them or expecting anything from them.  When I have my exchange surgery in June we will ask friends to take our son - not family.  After the way they have acted I don't even want their help.  I am not even going to talk about my surgery and the date....if they don't remember when it is, I could care less.  I am not going to remind them or say a word.  I will just handle things on our own. Despite my family and husband's family sucking royally, our friends rose to the occasion like you couldn't believe.  My one friend hugged me 3 times on Saturday when we spent the afternoon with them - with tears in her eyes each time saying "I am so glad you are done with chemo and have done so well..."  My family didn't even call....(except my sister - she calls and brought meals - even came to chemo with me).  So I am hurt and have realized that I can't count on them for anything so I won't expect anything.  I guess they probably care but have a shitty way of showing it or acting like it.  Whatever.  I am not wasting my time on that.  I am done hosting all the holidays for all of them - and doing nice things for them.  They too will get nothing from me.  I guess I have realized what others said....those I thought I could count on let me down and others really rose to the occasion.  I am blessed to have such good friends and to have found out how much they really care about me.  I have also realized that I expect people to be more like me (I am the kind that calls, sends cards, sends food etc... when someone is in need) and I guess my expecations of others are too high.  I am trying to expect less but I am still hurt and will not rely on them for anything anymore.  I don't know how to not be upset with my mom.  I am really hurt by her behavior......I just don't feel like spending much time around her lately because of it......

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2011 09:07PM mdg wrote: Katiebug - I am sorry you have been diagnosed.  I know all too well how scary and overwhelming this is.  As far as making decisions, just understand the recurrence rates, survival rates and such for both lump+rads vs. MX.  There are pros and cons to both and it is a hard decision.  I personally chose BMX with reconstruction with implants.  There are several reconstruction options so I suggest if you are considering a MX at all to meet with a plastic surgeon up front to understand your options.  I was not a candidate for any other type of reconstruction.  I think the type of reconstruction you can have also is part of the decision making process.  I can tell you I did pretty well with my recovery from my surgeries.  My son was 4 last year when I was diagnosed - it is doable with some help with young kids.  I was not laid up too long.  I have one more surgery in two weeks then I am done....it is a long process but I am happy so far with my results.  Good luck with your decision.  Hugs!

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2011 05:35AM mdg wrote: Just popping in from the March Chemo Lounge...I did TC x 4 and started 3/3.  I finished on 5/4.  You can do this ladies!  It is not "fun" but it is doable. Keep track of your side effects the first time around and then plan ahead for the next cycles to combat the side effects.   My first cycle was the worst...constipation, bone pain, body aches, heartburn....I combated these things on the other 3 rounds and I was so much better.  Drink tons of water the day of chemo and in the days following to flush the chemo out! Try to keep moving - exercise got me through chemo.  I did it  5 days a week and did not miss one day....forced myself on the days I didn't want to.  I had more energy and felt better.  On the weekends when I took rest days from exercise, that is when I was most tired.  If you have any questions - PM me.  You CAN do this.....Hugs to all of you.  I know how hard this is.  I am doimg fine now.  Good luck.

Posts.Content: May 24, 2011 02:18PM mdg wrote: First of all, I am sorry you had to join our little club....hugs!  I also had some changes after my pathology and hearing them change the grade and such was a huge blow to me.  I get it!  I know how you feel!  I had a lumpectomy unexpectedly (I went in for a sentinel node biopsy and my BS saw the tumor there and just took it out) eventhough I was planning on a BMX from the start.  I got the pathology from the lumpectomy and they changed me from Grade 1 to Grade 2.  I was really upset by that.  The pathology also indicated that I had angiolymphatic invasion present from the lumpectomy - which it was not present on the biopsy.  This all scared the crap out of me!  I did the oncotype and it came back the highest number in the low category.  I now had to decide on chemo...ugh!   I know how scary and frustrating this is.  All I can say is take it one step at a time.  Each decision is hard, but think through it and find a decision you can live with.  There is no one right answer...only the right answer for YOU.  As far as follow up after surgery - there is a lot with MX and reconstruction (with tissue expanders).  I saw my PS the week after surgery and then weekly for fills.  If you do chemo, that is also very full of appointments.  You have the chemo days, the shot the day after chemo, weekly blood draws/dr appts, etc.....  I feel like all I do is go to the doctor!  Moving during all of this would be hard.  I know we may move soon and I am realizing I will have to change doctors and find a new plastic surgeon to finish everything...that is stressing me out.

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2011 08:27PM mdg wrote: First of all, I am sorry you are going through this.  We all completely understand.  To answer your questions: I was told it looked benign 6 months ago and then went back for a follow up and was told it no longer looks benign and had a biopsy at that point. You did the right thing by getting the biopsy now - I wish someone would have offered that to me 6 months ago.  I had my first mammo in Sep 09 and nothing showed on it.  I found the lump in June and by then it was 1cm and showed on the mammo/us.  I can't answer the other question as I had a lump.  I do have calcifications in the same breast but won't know what that means until after my surgery and final pathology.  I don't want to tell you that each situation is different and most of the ladies on here have been DX with BC so you may get biased results in your questions.  I hope for you that this is nothing and your tests come back clean.  If for some reason they don't, you have come to the right place.   YOu will find amazing support, help and encouragement here as I have since my DX in early Dec.  I wish you good luck and good health.   Please post an update when you know!

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2011 12:52AM mdg wrote: I don't know the correct answer but I do believe it has do to with size and if there is more than one area.  I was stage 1 and was given the choice of lump+rads or MX.  My tumor was 1.4cm.  I chose BLMX.  The one thing I had to realize is that even with BLMX BC can come back. They can't guarantee they can remove 100% of breast tissue so there is a possiblity it can come back locally though it is a low chance.  One thing you have to consider is the difference between recurrence rates of Lump+rads vs. MX.  I evaluated it and because of many reasons (including my 4 year old son) I selected BLMX.  Though the survival rates are the same for both options, the recurrence rates are not the same. That mattered enough to me.  My doc also told me I had twice as much risk of getting BC in my good breast now that I had it in the other.  There are so many things you have to consider even if you have the choice of either sugery.  Some people are not given a choice based on the way their case presents.  In the end the decision was mine.  My doc's did not push me either way.  I am happy with my decision.  It was the right one for me.  I hope you don't have to make this decision and all is benign.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: A question...thinking WAY ahead NurseBeth 2much

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2011 07:41PM mdg wrote: I am half way done with my 4 rounds of Taxotere and Cytoxan.  So far it has gone good.  I guess for the first round I wish I would have taken something for constipation...that was NO fun.  The second round I was prepared!  I also wish my doctor would have let me take something for the bone pain and aches to prevent it or treat it.  The second time around I took claritin and aleve and it worked like a charm.  I don't have other things I "wished I had known" but I can tell you the things that are working well for me.  I continue to exercise (5 days a week - haven't missed a day yet since chemo started on 3/2).  It keeps me moving and keeps my stress levels lower.  I am also glad I read about cold caps to keep your hair during chemo.  I am half way through and still have a full head of hair despite the fact that other body hairs have long since left me!  I am keeping a log of my side effects and trying to see if there is a pattern...so far the first chemo was worse than the second.  The second chemo did not keep me in bed at all and I felt pretty good.  Maybe when I finish chemo I will have more enlightening things about chemo....for now that's it.  I just wanted to tell you that some people tolerate it really well like I have so far..(hoping that continues) and it has been easier than I thought SO FAR.  We will see when I finish the next two rounds!  Good luck!

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2014 02:12AM mdg wrote: I would check and see if a second opinion would be covered.  Remember that most of us here have been diagnosed with BC so there may be more of us posting about this that have BC.  I was told to watch my lump which they said was a fibroadenoma.  I went back in 6 months and it was bigger and it no longer looked benign and was Birads 4.  It was cancer at that point.  I am not saying yours is, but I am saying I regret every day NOT getting a biopsy right away.  Push for a biopsy.  Dense breasts make it hard for mammograms to detect lumps.  I had a CLEAR mammogram 4 months before I found the 1 cm lump. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Help with results...so confused lilrebel MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2014 01:32PM mdg wrote: I agree completely!  I was only stage 1 but people act like it was fun or easy....I still had BMX, reconstruction and chemo.  What part of that is "easy"?  Just curious.....  I know that there are so many stage IV women out there that have struggled far more than myself and I pray for them every day.  I wish that when they would try to increase "awareness" they would really share information that is more real....like what it is like to live with stage IV cancer or that mammograms don't always catch BC (I found my lump a few months after a "clear" mammo) and that the majority of women that get BC DON'T have any family history.  All this pink crap and supposed "awareness campaigns" don't show and tell women what they REALLY need to know.
Posts.Title: Mad tonight at Susan Komen JudyO april485

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 08:43AM mdg wrote: I am sorry you are going through this.  It is very hard...I know all too well.  I had a BLMX in January and the first week or two was the worst emotionally.  I am now done filling and waiting for exchange surgery.  Now I feel great.  I like my new figure (I was smaller chested before surgery).  I no longer feel grossed out when I look at myself.  I am looking forward to finishing reconstruction and having new, perky breasts.  Time is the thing that has helped me.  Sorry to sound so cliche...but it has.  In time you get use to what is going on and have time to accept it.  I have found a great plastic surgeon that makes reonstructed breasts look pretty real.  I am optimistic that I will have good results.  I wish there was something I could say to really make you feel better, but I know there isn't.  Just know that you are not alone in this journey.  So many of us are going through it too.  This board has offered me so much support and compassion...it has helped me tremendously.  Find a good plastic surgeon that you feel confident in.  Meet with more than one...second opinions are a good thing here.  Ask for photos of their work so you can see what they can do.  You would be surprised at some results.   Just so you know I too cried horribly when I saw photos of mastectomies the first time...now I am over it.  I guess a few months makes all the difference.  Best of luck in your journey.  Hugs!

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2011 08:18AM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...time for my confession...went out last night for date night with friends and I ate like a complete piggy!  I was starving...lord!  It was mexican...chips, salsa, chicken, more chips, more of everything.  Then we munched on popcorn all night!  Oh and a very nice sized chocolate chip cookie and part of a brownie!   I went off the deep end.  I didn't drink at all.....that was the only good behavior I had last night!  Boy am I glad I don't keep that kind of food in the house!  I will really have to up my workout this week but it's a chemo week so that probably won't happen.  Oh well...maybe I won't be hungry from chemo this week and it will balance out!  Silia:  Glad to know you are joining us!  Welcome!  As far as surgery prep, I can tell you I used my abs a lot in the days following surgery to scoot on the bed since I could not use my arms.  I was glad I had strong abs...I could feel them working!  I also used my legs a lot to get on/off the toilet and in/out of the tub (I could not shower becuase of drains but baths were ok) without my arms.  I wish I would have stretched my shoulders and chest muscles more in the months before surgery as I had tissue expanders put in and things were really tight after that.  I don't know if stretching a ton before would have made a difference before or not for sure.  I would also ask your surgeon if he/she will be providing any post surgery stretches/exercises for you to do.  I personally believe the sooner you get started, the better as your body loses a lot fast from the trauma of surgery.  My breast center gave me a booklet of exercises and stretches.  If your doc does not provide any, let me know and I can email you my booklet but you would need to show it to your doc to see if that is something they would want you to do.  I can't make any recommendations to anyone...your doc knows best.  I would also check and see if your doc is open to you having physical therapy post surgery.  Mine was and I am going.  It's great.  My therapist helps loosen things up and even massages the tight areas which has helped a lot.  I think the better in shape you are prior to surgery, the better.  That's great that you lost 9lbs.  We tend to post our daily activities, share healthy snack/recipe ideas and chat.  This is my virtual fitness class since I am not back to teaching aerobics yet.  These gals are great...you will like hanging with us! Welcome!

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 06:31PM mdg wrote: Melanie...thanks!  I was googling for homeade tortilla chip recipes...you saved me!  I am trying a new recipe tomorrow for wheat crackers...I have never made crackers before, but I am excited to try them as they won't contain the bad oils...going to use all organic ingredients and olive oil too.  Stay tuned.  Tomorrow is another day ladies.  Who's working out with me?  I am on single mommy duty for the next few days (hubby leaves on a business trip in the morning) so I am dropping my little one off at school and heading straight for the gym after.  I am going to do the elliptical and some weights for legs tomorrow along with my stretches.  I also wanted to share the stretch that has really helped me reduce the "bricks in chest" feeling from the TE.  I lay over a large exercise ball with my back on the ball and my chest to the ceiling.  I put my hands behind my head and just let my elbows fall back towards the floor.  I have been holding this stretch for a minute or so a few times.  I also do the same thing with arms extended out to the sides with palms up....I don't feel the bricks in my chest anymore.  I am ready to get one more fill this week I think!  My back seems to be all better too!  Yippy!

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2011 06:00PM mdg wrote: Thanks girls.  They were suppose to call me back today and of course no phone call.  Nice customer service hu?  I thought about calling but I just could not deal with them today.  I felt emotionally drained from yesterday.  I did my workout this morning (45 min on elliptical) and some PT exercises for upper body.  I also had my post chemo blood draw. Blood was good today. OK I am just wondering what the notes are in my chart at the med onc office are like because I have seen 2 different PA's there now and BOTH of them have completely grilled me and been upset that I am exercising!  I am stunned!  I had to defend myself completely now on two separate appointments and I am sick of it!  I have explained to them at nauseum that I am not doing anything that resembles my pre-surgery workout.  I do the elliptical with NO ARMS because I did have back issues (which is fine now).  I do 45 minutes at level 10 (I usually do higher) and set no goals for steps or calories...what ever I do that day is what I do.  I am barely sweating and my hair is not really even sweaty after 45 minutes.  I do weights on my legs...lower than normal and with more reps because I just want to stay in shape and feel healthy and not push myself.  I do the PT exercises 5 days a week as instructed.  I am so sick of them giving me crap about working out!  Can you believe that?  So you would rather I sit at home, wallow is self pity, have no stress releif, gain weight and have zero digestion because you are opposed to exercise?????  I am going to say something to the dr on my next visit.  I have had it!  OK...glad I got that off my chest.  There has been too much doctor drama for me this week....... So where are my workout girls???  Claire.....thanks for all the exercise support!  I bet my doc's office would really give you crap if you went there!  I finally decided to make some homemade granola yesterday because the stuff in the stores is loaded with sugar or the bad fat.  I had never made it before.  It was sooo easy and it tastes good too!  I have enjoyed it for breakfast but will also be packing it on the go for snacks!  Just another healthy idea..if you buy granola though, check out the sugar and fat....usually it's pretty bad.  Let me know what you gals are up to!

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2011 06:17PM mdg wrote: Redsky:  I agree that the expansions make things worse.  I started expansion at 2 weeks post surgery and got them on Fridays.  I could not sleep flat again until Wednesdays.  I would start to get better and then it was time to go again.  By the time I was 410cc's with weeklly fills, my upper back got injured and I stopped filling for a few weeks.  I can tell you that after no fills for a few weeks I felt great!  Even with 410cc's in I felt NO tightness in my chest at all - didn't feel like there were bricks in there anymore.  I then had a 60cc fill on Monday this week and didn't really even feel it....no real tightness in my chest at all this week.  I have one more fill on Tuesday for another 50-60cc's.  I am 5'3" and weigh about 120 lbs.  My rib cage is 31".  I don't have much body fat at all, especially on my chest area (pretty much NO body fat).  My doc says if I stayed at 410cc's in the TE that would yield a B and he would use at 375cc implant.  I am going to fill to 510-520cc's and he can use a 450 cc implant which should be a C.  I hope that help.  I can tell you the PT really helped me a lot. I was pretty sore in my arm pits for weeks after surgery and after each fill.  I just want to give you hope....I don't feel any different than before surgery at this point...so hang in there!  SueBee: Glad you enjoyed dinner.  I was thinking of making the same type mixture of the veggies and tossing it in pasta.....you could even put it over seafood too I suppose.  I need to make it again.  My hubby LOVES that recipe!

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2011 05:24AM mdg wrote: Good morning fit gals!  I am getting ready to hit the gym this morning!  Can I just tell you how sick I am of taking all these pills????? OMG..this is what I had to take this morning: Claritin, Aleve, 3 multivitamins, vitamin B, Senokot S (laxitive/stool softener due to chemo), Vitamin D, Iron (low iron due to chemo), pro biotic.   THat was 11 pills this morning....I am getting sick of taking all this crap!  It makes drinking water easier as I need a ton to get all of these down!  At night it's only magnesium, xanax and stool softeners...so I get a break.  So far today I feel OK.  Waiting for the chemo hangover to potentially hit....keep hoping it will just pass me by this round.  Cross your fingers.  Have a healthy day!  Tonight's dinner is veggie and refied bean quesadillas.  I think I will do salad and fruit with that tonight - keeping it light!  What are you ladies making tonight? Redsky:  I was going to PM you because I hadn't seen you post lately...I was getting worried about you girl!  So glad to get your update.  As far as the fills I just got really tight after them and until I took a break I didn't realize how much that was really uncomfortable.  So take your time if you have time.....after I took a few week break and got back to fills I really had no more tightness for the last two...didn't even realize I had them.  I am now 510cc's and done with fills!  As far as the PT.  She was treating me for the mastectomy and rotator cuff injury I got from my first surgery (nice hu?).  I will PM you all the stuff we did.  Let me know if you have questions.  I hope you are doing ok and make it through a full week with the kids home!  How old are your kids?  I have a 4 year old.  I am so glad you are hanging with us...you will get good attention and support from us since we have already done this part.  Hang in there!

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2011 09:44AM mdg wrote: Suebee:  OK so you skipped your workout today hu?  Tomorrow you are back on girl!  We need to find you something new to do on Wednesdays other than St Arbuck's!  Love that by the way!  We have good food stores here but they still contain so many products that have soybean oil, safflower oil, sunflower oil or corn oil.  I usually hit Costco, Whole Foods and Trader Joe's.  I sometimes even hit Miejers which has improved organic choices and now and then Kroger too.  Redsky:  I did PM you.  I really think the stretches and PT helped.  Did not skip one day of doing it.  I feel great now..don't have any tightness....you will get there.  My doc believes in overfilling and using a smaller implant.  I too am confused why they all do it different.  Did my workout today.  I did a 2 mile run, 1 mile walk and then hopped on the elliptical for 30 min.  I also did my leg workout...will be sore tomorrow!  I have started back into doing abs - mostly lower abs to avoid anything bothering my upper torso near alloderm just in case.  Who knows if that matters or not..just trying to be good just in case.  I hope you all got to workout today!  What's for dinner?  We are doing leftovers and salad...I have so much food right now that needs to go!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 8, 2011 05:40AM mdg wrote: Good morning - Happy Mother's Day!  I was greated with cards and a huge gift this morning in bed.  I got a bread maker!  (I had asked for this since most breads these days contain soybean oil or something else bad).  So excited!  We are laying low today and heading out for dinner later.  Chemo kicked my butt yesterday...I was exhausted after we went to Greenfield Village for the day and a ride on Thomas the Train for my son.  I was in bed at 9pm.  I feel so much more rested today which is good.  I hope you are all enjoying your day.  The sun is shining here...it's making me smile!   My son is eating my "healthy" whole wheat/buckwheat pancakes for breakfast.  I thought he would never touch something like that...he's eating them up.  It's so good to see him eat something healthy!  Renn:  So glad you had such a good visit with your sis.  Sometimes having a visit like that does wonders for us!  I am so glad the incision looks good!  I am praying it continues to heal.  Has your doc considered the hyperbaric chamber for you?  I know someone else with healing issues that is doing that and it helped but hers was way more serious (a DIEP that went bad) because it was a larger area.  Anyway - that meal sounds soooo good.  I have not made tebbuleh in a while so I am going to have to get on that soon now that I have a craving for that!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 9, 2011 07:04PM mdg wrote: I did get Lemon Oregano Garlic Chicken Pitas with Tzatziki posted on the blog....really good!  Check it out.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 14, 2011 04:20PM mdg wrote: SueBee:  You inspire me with your biking!  I don't even own a bike....maybe soon now that my little one is using one with training wheels.  That would be fun to do together.  My class was good.  It was hard to dodge the questions....one person directly asked what kind of surgery I had.  Then she asked "was it your back, your neck???"  I just said "no, I'd rather not say".  It was awful!  Ugh!  I just wasn't up for getting in room of people and say "ok let's get started with aerobics...oh and I had BC".  I had a band aid on my port (in the arm) so it would not be noticed.  I imagine they notice the boobs though..I am now a C and was a small B before.  At least  I have my hair so that looked the same.  It felt good to be teaching again though.  It was a lot of fun.  So by teaching today I got in an extra workout this week!  I did have a great lunch...simple but good.  I sauted up chicken breasts in olive oil, garlic powder, S&P and a little organic veggie broth.  I sliced it thin.  Served with whole wheat pitas, red onions, tomatoes, hummus, spinach and lowfat cheese.  It was super good.  Served it with a salad of garbanzo beans, cucumbers, capers, tomatoes tossed in red wine vinegar and olive oil.  We had friends over for lunch so it was simple and very healthy.  Just thought I would share...would make a good dinner option too.  Anyone else working out this weekend??
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 23, 2011 07:06AM mdg wrote: Hey gals...I don't know what to do with myself this morning as I teach aerobics tonight so I am not off to the gym this morning.  Soooo I am cooking already.  Yesterday I made the black bean brownies and froze some for the coming weeks.  Right now I have whole wheat sundried tomato and basil bread in the bread maker and I am slow roasting roma tomatoes in the oven.  I am going to make up a batch of whole grain buttermilk pancakes to freeze for my son today too since my oven is tied up with the tomatoes all day (you slow roast them for 8 hours....they smell soooo good right now!).  Melanie: Thanks for the food support.  I just panic so much.  I am so scared I won't be here to raise my son one day and just want to take few chances.  MIL is such a freak (we don't get along) and she is so controling.  She asked my DH to bring cole slaw, but then she tells him how to make it (the exact nasty recipe).  I asked DH if we could bring a healthy cole slaw that I could eat but he said we would need to bring two kinds then because his mom is expecting the kind he usually makes.  Blah blah.....whatever.  She's a freak.  I guess I will have to pack a whole cooler for my own appetizer, dinner and dessert.  Then I have to explain to everyone why I am eating my own food...I guess I will blame it on a food allergy or something.  I guess I don't even want to go in the first place to her dumb BBQ since I don't really like her and she's mean to me.  Whatever.  I too have prayed to God on a daily basis to let my faith be greater than my fear in all of this...I guess we all pray for similar things hu?  I just find it so hard to stay on track unless I pack food everywhere I go.  It's exhausting!  You figure - oh I will have a salad but then can't put any protein on it at all (cheese/chicken with hormones).  Then you think...hmmm I will just have pasta and veggies but then you can't have white pasta.  The list goes on and on of what is bad for me....agh!!!  Glad you got your flowers planted and got a walk in.  Do you do a veggie garden?  I don't really have a spot for one in my yard without making it look horrible.  I hope in our next house we will have a good garden spot.  I would love to grow fresh veggies.  How is the arm?  Swelling still gone???  Oh and I had no idea anyone did anything with SPAM anymore......that must have been a hard meal to swallow...literally!  Suebee:  Yes - love Kings Island!  We took our son there 2 summers ago. The kiddie part was so much fun for him.  Maybe we will go again this Labor Day weekend. My BFF lives in No. KY so we usually stay with her when we go.  You guys are good for trying to talk me off the ledge on the food thing.  I am just paranoid.  I guess it's because I have been so focused on surgeries and chemo for the last few months and now I am not "doing" anything to beat cancer.  I guess the diet and exercise is all I can do to help myself.  I am LOL at Melianies comment about sharing my food ideas with my MIL....we barely talk to each other now! I can't imagine sitting down and having a full discussion with her about anything....that would require lots of wine which is also very bad for me (hehe!).  I did get some bras the other day (thought of you) that have no wires and really defined cups.  They were called Bandini and they are comfortable.  I found them at Kohl's.  I don't know how they would work though with padding the real boob.....just wanted to share in case it helps.  I needed something to wear under my work clothes when I go back to work next week (boo!!!).   I too have boob greed and think that my boobs will be too small...they are 501 ccs........oh well.  I am done filling because it will delay my surgery.  I am hoping for the best...... Well that's all I got going on today.  I get my port out tomorrow....another surgical procedure oh joy. Wish me luck!  I wil try to post tomorrow.  Obviously no workout for me tomorrow...I may try to get a walk in tomorrow morning before I go but since I can't eat anything it won't be much of a workout.  You ladies better workout good for me tomorrow!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 26, 2011 04:47AM mdg wrote: Renn:  Thanks for the info on the iron.  I will listen to my body and modify where needed to be safe. I agree with you on being patient for your incision to heal.  Your PS knows best and only wants you to have good results.  I am sure you will look beatiful when all is done.  I am so glad you are beachside this week.how relaxing.  You deserve that.  Take time to really enjoy it!  Wish we had a beach nearby!! SueBee:  I too have had clothes issues...my boobs are too big for some of my cute summer shirts. I will pawn off my cute stuff on my friend's 17 year old daughter.  I have some cute halter tops.  My friend's daughter has recently lost a ton of weight and is tiny now.  She has such a cute figure now she will look great in some of  my clothes.  I already gave her all of my newer bras that I bought shortly before dx that no longer fit me.  She was so excited.  I have some cute dresses too that will no longer fit my boobs.  I guess I should clean out that closet! I am off to the gym shortly.  The weather has been really nasty here.  DH was suppose to head to KC last night but they had a tornado touch down there yesterday and his flights were cancelled.  His interview has been postponed.  I am so glad he did not have to fly last night...I was really worried.  Today I have a ton of errands to run....I go back to work next week.  It is suppose to rain all day so that should be fun to run so many errands in the rain.  Oh well.  At least it's not snow.  Be healthy today!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2011 08:02PM mdg wrote: When will this week be over???  I am completely overwhelmed right now.  Going back to work, DH interviewing for jobs all over the place, the rash and having exchange surgery in two weeks has me completely emotional....oh and I also started tamoxifen a few days ago.  I had a complete meltdown today.  I am really having a hard time with work....I just feel like for the last four months I have been off work in my own little BC world only dealing with my health and my family.  Now I am thrown back into my old life which I can hardly relate to anymore.  My poor DH had to console me over the phone while he was at work while I bawled on the other end of the phone.  I forced myself to go to the gym this afternoon.   I did 30 minutes of circuit training....I just didn't even feel like doing that.  What is wrong with me????  I don't feel like myself.  I hope tomorrow brings a better day emotionally.  I just feel spent emotionally right now.  I can't relate to feeling like this....it's just not me.  Ugh!  Tomorrow has got to be better, right? Suebee:  It makes me feel better to know others have "family dynamics" too (that's a good word for it).  I love the nipple conversation.  Along those lines, when my BFF was here we were talking about my TE's and I told her how hard they were.  She wanted to feel them so I let her.  I never thought my BFF would be feeling my boobs...we cracked up!  Heck at this point they have been felt and seen by so many people in the medical profession....whatever......I too was wondering that if my boobs got too big if it would be hard to shop for shirts since I am a smaller build gal.  I think my size will be OK without making that happen.  I hope so.  Jo:  thanks for the information on the exercise.  It may be a good thing to check out. It's so nice to hear someone say they are 7 years out.....we are still in the thick of this crap!  Thanks!  Shannon:  I love that you are foob obsessed!  I too am foob obsessed and hair obsessed!  (I just got done with chemo and kept my hair with cold caps but it has thinned a little and needs a color job horribly).  I have never worried about hair, boobs, eyebrows and eyelashes so much in my life - not even when I was single!  So glad to hear you had a nice walk today.  Keep it up!  The exercise makes a huge difference!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 04:41AM mdg wrote: Renn and Suebee: Thanks. I appreciate the support.  I have never been this emotionally drained person that feels so dependent on my DH.  I am use to being independent and taking care of everyone else before me.  I don't know how to relate to all of this at times.  I also feel like I spend so much time convincing everyone else I am OK but then I stop and think about it and realize "how can anyone be OK after all of this?".  I feel like sometimes it's all an act.  Does anyone feel like they should be nominited for an Academy Award for "Best BC Patient"?  I do.......maybe I when I quit my job I shoul become an actress......  Oh and I am glad it is BFF day.  Will call my BFF today.  When I read your post about that at first I thought it  said National Breast Day (yes, I am foob/boob obessessed...I LOL after that....sick hu?).  I am off for my pre-OP appt in a few and then I am sneaking a workout in (I don't care about work for an hour!!!) before coming home to work.  My son has his end of the school year show at his pre-school today.   He's so excited.....it will be adorable I am sure.  I cried at the last one (because of cancer......I just sat there and was so emotional - the other mom's probably wondered what was wrong with me) but all of these little things touch me in such a different way now.....so worried I won't be here for him one day.....  Boy I am a real "downer" this week.  Sorry, but I knew you gals would allow me to vent.  I am also glad I am not the only odd one letting people touch my TE's foobs...... :)  Thanks gals.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 06:40PM mdg wrote: Hey girls....I am totally feeling yesterday's circuit workout....it was only a 30 min workout and lord my butt is killing me today!  I did do the elliptical today for an hour and hope to do it again tomorrow and some weights.  I had my pre op appt today and have realized I better enjoy the workouts now because in two weeks I can't do anything again for a whole month!  UGH!  I can "leisure walk" at the mall or something (that will get expensive quick).  No gym and no real cardio for a month.  I am going to lose everything I have gained in the past few months. Right now my legs and cardio are so strong...my arms even look decent considering I have not done much with arms until lately. I am bummed to lose all my progress......poop!  My son had his end of the year preschool show today.  They sang 6 songs and did two with singing and sign language.  It was adorable......  The pre op appt went well except they said no more steroids for the rash (I finished them yesterday) and if it comes back I have to cancel my surgery and reschedule once they resolve it.  NOw I am scared.....if you can spare a prayer for me that the rash stays away, I would appreciate it! Melanie:  I am sorry that nights are so hard for you too with your arm.  It seems like sometimes the oddest moments bring me to tears.  I really also hate the night time..I still take xanax and watch TV until I fall asleep with the tv on.  I just can't be left alone with my thoughts in the dark and silence yet.  I too would be completely upset if I had the lymphedema...I can only imagine how hard this is for you.  Just keep doing what you are doing.  Did you meet with the new PT yet?  I am glad you are getting started on rads so you can get it over with.  As far as the pool, with my rash, I can't go in either.  We were at the pool over the weekend and I hid in the shade and had to go take a cold shower instead of getting in the refreshing pool.  I have to stay out of the sun given my skin issues right now....usually I am an olive skinned gal with a dark tan after a few days at the pool....no suntan for me this summer I guess.  Oh and I wanted to give you hope...my chemo legs are gone I think!  I have not noticed it anymore!  Hang in there...... Shannon: thanks for the support and understanding.  Some days are just easier than others.  It's nice to know I can share that here anytime and you all "get it".  There is so much I don't even have to say to you gals and you just know.  I can't imagine having teenagers through this...I thought a 4 year old was hard but now I am not sure!!  Hi Julie:  Welcome!  Feel free to join us.  We like to chat about exercise, diet, cooking and our families (oh and some of us are obsessed with boobs and foobs right now!).  Congrats on finishing chemo! I finished on 5/4.  I had a BLMX on 1/27.  I do my exchange surgery in 2 weeks.  Suebee;  You crack me up with the old man and your tshirt!  OMG!  I am 45 and no one has ever checked out my boobs and recently and old guy did and I was shocked (especially since they are ugly tissue expanders which makes it hilarious!).  I do like his creativity that he was "trying to read your shirt".  Give him some points for being creative at least!  LOL!  Pre op went well.  As long as the rash stays away I am OK otherwise I am going to lose it!!!  It is super hot here too...heat alert all day.  96 degrees today!  I stayed inside!! Renn:  Instead of an academy award that they give, ours should be a foob with good projection, don't you think?  I would have several lined up on my mantel from all of my "outstanding actress awards".  I too played "happy girl" during xmas after having a secret lumpectomy on 12/23 without my family even knowing......good thing there is vicodine!  You are right....my inner little girl is terrified because a giant monster is chasing her!  I never let family or friends see the "inner little girl" side though...they see the put together, OK version of me.  At least here I can let the little girl out all I want.  Thanks for that ladies.....really!  Sappy is good now and then....no apologies necessary girl!  Thanks for understanding.... :)
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2011 12:14PM mdg wrote: Hi all...so much to catch up on here..you gals are all so chatty lately which I love!  Work keeps getting in the way of keeping up with all of you girls.  I managed to hit the gym this morning for a quick hour with my little one in tow...no school today as they start summer sessions tomorrow.  He is now with my friend's daughter (babysitter for the day) while I work.  They went swimming and had pizza for lunch...he's a happy little guy today.  I am getting revved up for surgery and have resigned myself to the fact that the new foobs will be smaller than I wanted...thanks SueBee for the reality check and info on projection.  Don't think I can get them to project very far as I am not a big person and don't have a large ribcage.  Oh well...at least they will be bigger than the pre BC breasts and be healthier than my BC breasts.  Supersally:  thanks for all the advice....oh and there is not enough xanax in the world for me to call up the MIL!  LOL!  Not an option.....no way.  DS can stay home with me I guess.  My neighbor around the block - her hubby works from a home office so maybe I can ask him to drop DS off at school after he takes his son to daycare.  I just am not into asking people to help...I feel better about it when they offer and I can take them up on it.  The last several times I have asked family they have said no.....that's why I am done asking.  Most of my friends work full time not near our home so it's too hard when they have kids.   Some of my good friends live 45 min from me and have kids...they just can't help.  I will get some good movies for him for Monday if I have to...and some new coloring supplies.  I just hope I can rest if I feel crappy....I don't like taking vicodin and being the one responsible for DS when DH is not home....you know?  I will just try to be off pain meds by then....last time I only took them for 5 or 6 days...I assume this will be easier.  As far as the move....I don't know if it's permanent or not..,.I don't like the idea of moving again and again but who knows what will happen in the next few years.  I do plan on working - I have been starting a business and I will pursue that from where ever we move as it is all internet based for sales and I do my work from my home.  I will also be teaching aerobics - more classes than now and trying to launch my cooking blog for profit plus a public speaking career on exercise/fitness/nutrition for cancer patients (I hope!).  So I think I can do that from any market...as long as it's a decent size city.  I don't plan on going back into surgical sales but if I wanted to do some other things in the pharma/medical device industry, the best city for me would be Chicago.  I really appreciate all of your comments and good advice.  It's so hard to explain this stuff to friends that don't get BC and all that comes with it.  I have been stressed because I see how stressed my poor DH is.  He is usually so easy going and this whole thing has him all worked up....he never gets like this...I finally decided last night that until we know what the offers are and if they come or not, there is nothing to decide and worry about.  We may find that the offers are so good or so bad (or worse....lacking!) that it may make the decision a "no brainer".  I am trying hard to tell DH "it will be OK as long as we are together and healthy and have a safe place to live".  I have taken a deep breath......blowing air out.  I feel better on the days that I work out......it relieves more of the tension.....today I worked out this morning so it's not bugging me so much. Julie:  I am not so worried about him missing school....I am selfishly worried about myself (being able to take care of his needs all day....I may just want me time after surgery.......there, I put it in print...yes, I am being a bit selfish for once!!!)  I just may need to hibernate in my bed with my shows on and trashy magazines vs. playing Candyland, making snacks and watching Jake and the Neverland Pirates all day - LOL!!!   I have been a fitness instructor since college and I use to be a personal trainer and sports conditioning coach.  Right now I teach an advanced step aerobics class twice a week...I wish I could teach more but I work full time right now.  I have pretty much taught everything other than yoga and pilates.  I really want to get back into teaching weight training and boot camp conditioning classes.  ONce we move I will be able to teach more.  I am looking forward to that.  On the foob front...I am filled to 550cc's and I think that will be a full B or small C.  They told me they would most likely use a 450 cc implant for exchange.  Who knows...I will let you all know in a few days!  OK here we go...you said you wanted accountability on the fitness front.....I am gonna get that started girl!  I know the lack of energy that exists after all of this, but you can start slow.  It can be a walk or a few light exercises at home.  For me I know I can't do regular exercise after surgery for a month, but I am planning on focusing a lot on my diet...getting 5-6 servings of fruits/veggies a day and lots of water.   There are so many things you CAN do when you don't have energy that help your overall health and well being.  Even meditation and relaxation can be helpful and don't require lots of energy.  Just make a committment to do something everyday.  Tell us what you are going to commit to and we will check you on it daily!  We are here to support and encourage you.  Many of us have also read The Anti Cancer book and it really enpowered me to take control of my diet and help myself avoid recurrence.  I learned so much even with a degree in Health....it made a difference for me and makes me want to try harder.  You CAN do anything if you set your mind to it.  You have a little control in this whole BC thing..your attitude, your diet and exercise...the rest is out of your hands.  Take control of those things for yourself.....be the best you can be and do the best you can do.  :)  OK, I am putting the soap box away..... :) Melanie; I hope you like your new roomates and get into the new swing of things there.  It will be nice to have more people that are supportive right now.  I am glad radiation seemed so easy.  I hope you breeze through that part easier than chemo for sure.  It's great you got outside and got to enjoy nature.   Don't worry, next summer you will be back at that camp better than before!  Let us know how rads go.  I don't have to do that so I don't know much about it.  I am so glad you did exercise on Sat.....come on, keep going girl! Renn:  I totally get it on the helping (or lack there of) when it comes to hosting.  I love to entertain but it is so much work when you work full time, teach aerobics and have a family.  I find that the longer I have done it the less help I get.  I am done hosting for a while and I guess if we move I won't have to anymore.  I do enjoy it but the aftermath of cleaning the house and everything is exhausting especially since my family is full of kids so the house looks like a tornado hit after they all leave.  I am not going to worry about the help for my surgery....I will do it all myself.  I know you all want me to ask for help, but I have and they say no or simply don't offer.  I was at my moms last night talking about how DH is traveling after surgery and stuff...she never offered to come over or bring a meal.  When she does help because I ask her, I end up doing everything myself anyway because she is 79 and she likes to be waited on.  I told DH not to invite her over to help because I end up having to cook her dinner....when she's not there, I can simply eat cereal for me and pull from the freezer for my DS.  I know that sounds terrible, but it is more work for me to have my mom here......though I love her and appreciate her.  After my port surgery, she sat there and waited for me to cook dinner on the same day I had my surgery...never offered to help.  Shannon:  I hope the lump is nothing as your doc suspects.  Glad you are getting it checked out.  I have a lump on my L hip I am talking to the med onc about tomorrow....freaking me out!  You are so right how exercise helps clear the head. I find that when I do it in the morning I am better all day. WHen I teach class on Monday nights...I am a bundle of stress most of the day.  Keep walking and moving....let us know how the lump situation is..a prayer for you on that! SueBee:  I hope you get whatever job you want...I like the idea of tuition reimbursement and having a plan for job C.  You may as well get some benefit out of that.....keep us posted on what you do! As far as the DH job update:  Interview in Chicago yesterday.  Not sure he's really exciteda about that one.  He is still waiting for a renegotiated offer from KC as the first offer was not acceptable to us.  Seattle interview is next Monday.  We will see...... Marie:  Welcome!  I am an aerobics instructor and had BLMX on 1/27 with TE's and SNB.  Many of us gals have been chatting since then and we have a few newer gals that just joined in.  Feel free to hang with us!  As far as recovery..it was not as bad as I ever imagined and I do believe because I was more fit it helped me a ton.  I did the PT exercises twice a day that I got in the booklet from my Breast Cancer Center.  It really helped me get range of motion back...they did hurt like heck somedays but I never skipped them. I wanted to work with a physical therapist and asked for a referral as I wanted to get my mobility back quick.  I am glad I did that...insurance covered it so I did it.  My PT was great....she had experience with BLMX patients so she knew what to do with me.  I started walking at the mall about 2 1/2 weeks post OP - not quite power walking as my PS would not let me, but kind of brisk walking for about 30-40 min per day.  At 1 month post OP I was back to the gym on the ellpitical with no arms (held stationary handles) for 45 min a day.  Soon I was up to an hour and several weeks later started using arms.  Now I do 60 min a day with arms at level 15.  I could have done more weights with arms but I had a port in my arm from chemo and that was uncomfortable.  My PS would not let me lift more than 5 lbs for at least a month.  Feel free to PM me about other questions since I had the same concerns as you.  I also have the exercises on my computer I can email to you for post OP and you can ask your PS if they are ok for you to do....Best of luck!  The BLMX was not as bad as I thought..honestly! OK - I have to get back to work now!  Surgery is on Thursday...I will check in before then!

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2011 10:00AM mdg wrote: Melanie:  I agree with Supersally - make up a bunch of food and reheat it.  I make several chicken breasts and just season them and cook them in a skillet.  I then reheat it during the week in different ways:  in a whole wheat flour tortilla with veggies and avacado, over pasta with steamed broccoli or asparagus with parmesan and EVOO, on top of spinach salad with fresh veggies, in a whole wheat pita with onion, cucumber, hummus and tomato, in tabulleh salad with lemon juice type dressing, etc....  I also make things that freeze well like soups, stews, casseroles and freeze them in small glass containers and just reheat them for lunch when I am home.  The Spaghetti Pie I just posted freezes well - great dinner with a tossed salad or something you can take to work and reheat for lunch.   I sometimes make pasta and lots of veggies at the beginning of the week and just heat that up for meals with some EVOO and Parmesan.  A crock pot may be another good investment...put it all in there in the morning and dinner is done when you get home....Planning ahead is key - I know this from being a full time working mom....trust me!  If I did not have a family I would be eating eggs, peanut butter sandwiches, bagels, etc... :)  I hope you have more energy in the coming days.  We are all waiting to see the photos..I am sure they will be gorgeous! Supersally: I won't tell anyone if you crush up the xanax and it makes it to the coffee!!!  LOL!  My DH is not cranky, just stressed over the whole job search extravaganza.  No, I have never seen a corgi swim, but it sounds adorable!  I am so happy to hear you are being so active!!  I am super jealous too.....  I have heard the Marissa Tomei likeness before...it's such a compliment...thank you!  Everyone also always says "you look like a Maria".....I guess it's the Italian thing.... I will keep you updated on the job thing.  Right now I am waiting for the realtor in Chicago to call me back for some information on housing so we can weigh this out. Oh and this morning I was kind of busy...I am knee deep into planning Jayden's 5th birthday party for 7/30.  He threw me for a loop about a week ago when he declared he wanted a Harry Potter birthday party...for the last year all he has talked about was Star Wars...I had the whole SW party planned in my head already...now I am researching Harry Potter....called the cake lady, ordered cookie party favors and designed the invitation - sending it out to printer today.  Now I have to order party supplies and decide the menu..... Suebee:  Is there such a word - boobalicious?  If so, it would be you!  You are so gitty now that the boobie fairy came.  Your messages crack me up girl!  Now - just a reminder when shopping...look for professional attire...no shopping at Forever 21 or for boob shirts - LOL!  Be careful with packing..don't lift those suitcases!  I hope you have a good time and I also hope you have internet access.  What would you do without us while you are gone???  What will we do without your boob talk???

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2011 05:42AM mdg wrote: Melanie:  Before you know it you will be half done!  That's great!  I am sure the rads make you tired...be kind to yourself and rest when you can....your body needs it.  Hope you have a good weekend. OH and can you post the link to your caring bridge page again?  I went on there to read it and I was on my phone that day and it didn't navigate well....I keep wanting to go back and read and I don't remember what page you posted the link on....thanks! Shannon:  Thanks for the tea suggestion.  So far the rash seems a little better this morning...I took the antihistamine last night...I slept like I was drugged....I feel so tired today.  I guess maybe I should be using that instead xanax at night for sleeping - LOL!  I also make the crustless quiches in the muffin pans.  I love them.....I freeze them and then reheat them and sandwich them with a whole wheat english muffin.  DH loves those in the morning...so do I as he can have eggs without messing up my kitchen!  I also hard boil a bunch of eggs at the begining of the week and slice them and put them on toast or chop them and put them in salads.  I toss black beans and garbanzo beans in salad too.  Have you tried quinoa?  I have only made it once and it has protein in it...can be used like a rice or pasta so it may give you some new ideas and different choices.  I am trying to only eat some type of meat once a day and some days no meats.  I am just trying to reduce it too and trying to embrace more vegetarian things when I can.  Renn:  I have to get caught back up on your blog.  Will do that this morning.  Blogging has been a great way to release all the crap in my head from BC.  It's kind of therapeutic in a way.  I am going to check it out again.  I can't believe you get that TE out this week.  How long before your doc will try to reconstruct again?  Just curious.....  I was fine driving..really this recovery is much easier than BLMX for sure....barely even feel anything unless I really reach far for something.  So glad it was an easier recovery this time.

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2011 07:50AM mdg wrote: Oh gals...just a note on eating beans. If you are ER PR+ try to avoid canned beans because of BPA. I have been avoiding anything in a can...I was so excited two weeks ago to find tomaotes in a carton instead of a can! Pomi tomatoes are the only kind with no BPA. I found them at Meijer. I was going nuts....you can't take tomatoes away from an Italian girl. That is just wrong! BPA has estrogen like effects....fyi. One more thing to worry about.

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2011 08:25AM mdg wrote: OK - I only have a quick minute to update....busy weekend but I missed you gals.  As far as canned foods...it stinks!  I will research this week for you but I believe Eden Glen and Muir Organics are BPA free.  I too stocked up on canned beans and have a ton...I am using them very slowly as I don't know what to do with them.....I am going to see.  For tomatoes, though Pomi are BPA free but not organic.  Whole Foods also carries them..I saw them there the other day and Meijer just started carrying them.  Opt for organic foods in glass jars....those lids on the glass jars are not BPA free, but at least it only comes in contact with the lid when it is on it's side or something....better than sitting on a full BPA can.  I have noticed these companies don't seem to have the whole BPA free thing on their labels so you have to read on their website.  I am going to look into this and I will let you know next week.  Marie:  Hang in there girl!  You will get through this and be talking beautiful ta ta's and exercise with us in no time!  You will feel like a new woman when the drains come out..I hope very soon.  It gets so much better in time.  Right now I am sure you are overwhelmed...I know I was.  Hugs! (gentle of course!) Sue Bee:  sounds like you are having a blast!  I am sure no one knows what to say about your new "rack"....LOL!  I just decided I would start asking my friends - "so, what do you think of my new rack"?  Good for a laugh!  Shannone:  I am SO impressed!  I am so glad you are hitting the gym in my absence.  I am going to start walking daily after the holiday..too much going on now to have time.  Good for you.  Glad the foobs are more comfy. Supersally:  Hey girl!  I hope you are staying cool....thought of you yesterday as it was in the 90's here !  I so wish I could go in the pool...until the rash is gone I am scared though! Melanie;  THat would be cool to work for your doc.  My sis is a chemo nurse and she has done that for years. Maybe you could be more the nurse that works closely with him and have more patient contact...answer questions about SE's and discuss treatment and what they will go through.  My BFF works for a breast surgeon in this capacity and loves it.  Keep us posted.  That would be a cool thing if it works out when your contract is done and the job is interesting for you.  Renn;  Sorry about the parking ticket...boo!  As far as cans, I suggest checking out Amy's website and see if they note anything......Like I said I am going to do more research into this hopefully this week and post it on the blog.  As far as antihistamines and Tammi.....I believe it's claritin that interacts with tammi.  I talked to the PA at the derm office and she checked for me...whatever she prescribed for me was fine with tammi.  So if you gals are taking tammi - it may be a good idea to check what drugs/food interact with it.  I am off to the pool today (to hide in the shade) but let the girls make their first "debut" in my regular bathing suit!  I am going upstairs to try it on...but I must do something about the bikini line hair...yes, unfortuantely it started growing back after chemo and now I have to do something about it.  I was hoping it would just stay away....boo!  I will catch up more tomorrow or Tuesday.  Oh and the foobs are good.  No pain.  I am driving easily.  They feel so much softer and I have no feeling of tightness like the TE's did.  Happy with them.  I decided they look pretty much like I use to look in a padded bra before surgery when I was 15 lbs heavier.  I can't wait to add a padded bra and see what I look like...then they will look a big bigger.  I was hoping they would be a bit bigger than they are, but I am OK with it. Chat with you all later!  Happy 4th!

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Now I am off to see when schools start in Chicago so I know when we have to move..I think it will be in about 5 weeks....OMG!  I am freaking out! Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 11:30AM mdg wrote: Barbara - I don't track much.  I do try to use sparkrecipes to calculate calories in my recipes so I know how much I am eating.  I mentally try to get at least 5 fruits and veggies in a day...some days are better than others.  I try to eat at least 1 salad or veggie type soup a day.  I snack on raw almonds or walnuts - a handful of one or the other each day if possible.  Water - I try to drink a lot.  As far as exercise - 5 aim for a minimum of 5 days a week.  If we go on the weekend it's a bonus.  I am trying to do weights at least twice a week now as building and maintaining muscle is very important especially the older you get (you lose muscle with age).  I want to include yoga but my health club doesn't have times that work for me. I am waiting to see where I teach aerobics to see if their schedule is better and I can fit it in.  I don't have the patience to track what I am eating on paper.  I ate way to many tortilla chips with lunch yesterday .....it's best that not be written down anywhere!!! :)  There are phone apps you can use for food tracking.  There was one I tried a while back...don't remember the name.  At least with the phone app you have your phone with you all the time making it easier to update.

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 12:32PM mdg wrote: Annie - I have not encountered the hemoglobin thing.  Just think if it is low like that - once it is higher you will have even more energy!  Hold on to that....listen to your docs now and get healthy.  Sue - that's good that you can avoid tamox.  My doc says I have to take it for sure...apparently the diet/exercise route didn't do much for me all my life cause I got BC anyway - although I would like to blame it on being on birthcontrol and having my first child at 40.  I am also pre-menopausal so they want to zap me with everything.  Oh well....zap away! Today I did a 35 minute mall walk and a good 5 minutes of leg stretching.  I was going to remind you all to stretch out those legs good after your walks. I don't know about you guys, but my hips and butt have been kind of sore and tight and I think it's from sitting around so much because of surgery.  Stretching the lower body is just as important....just choose stretches that won't involve your upper body (pulling with arms or such) to stretch your lower body. So a funny story about my mall walk.  I was lazy this morning and just put on a cute baseball hat, no make up, a long sleeve fitted shirt and some yoga pants for my walk.  I was walking and got totally checked out by two younger guys (maybe in their 30's).  So for a split second I felt really good - then I realized quickly that I was the only non-elderly person walking in the mall....Here I thought I looked good with my size B boobs that don't move around and stand up by themselves..... he he!  Gotta love men....they must like them anyhow and any shape/size....tissue expanders and all!  LOL! I went back to phys therapy today and she had me doing a lot more.  It felt so good to move my arms.  I did the bike thing for your arms for a few minutes.  I also did a back machine for a few sets and used the elastic bands for a few exercises.  She then stretched me out and massaged my tight area to loosen it up.  I felt good after.  I did my exercises this morning and will do them again tonight.  I promise!  So tonight's healthy dinner is all natural fed/hormone free chicken topped with tomatoes, basil, garlic and artichokes served with brown rice and garlic green beans.  I also picked up some fat free, organic greek yogurt - in a chocolate flavor as a treat.  I will let you know if it is good.  Sounds good...they also had a carmel flavor, but I had to take the chocolate. :)  How are we on food?  What are you cooking healthy these days?  I need a healthy dinner menu for next week - please share your ideas....please!  How are we on fruit, veggies and water for the day?  I am having a hard time getting 5 servings of fruit/veggies in...I just can't eat that much.  I did get spinach and an apple in at lunch.  I am struggling with this a lot - I just can't eat that much!  Are you guys on track with that?
