Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2011 11:32AM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...it's the weekend!  So I had my fill yesterday and I now have 290cc's in each side....lord I was tight last night and I suffered through my exercises last night.  I felt much better after doing my exercises this morning though so after those fills, don't give up!  In a day or two you will be back to where you were.  I still have a few more fills....I think they want me at least 350cc's (which seems huge since I was only an A+ before surgery....but I do want to be a little bigger than that).  I did good on veggies yesterday and water - oh and vitamins.  I have been hitting lots of vitamins these days! I was happy that I got my 35 minute walk in before my fill as I would not have wanted to do it after that experience~ So made a tasty appetizer last week I wanted to share - it's healthy for us too! I sauted organic veggies (garlic, onion, spinach, mushrooms, red pepper) in olive oil.  I tossed in some organic finely chopped sundried tomatoes (they were in oil, but I drained them first) and some S & P to taste.  I then toasted whole grain wheat bread slices (I got a good, hearty fresh loaf from Whole Foods and sliced it and then cut it in smaller pieces) in the oven at 350 degrees for 10 minutes on each side.  I then topped the bread with some hormone free/organic goat cheese (just a little smear...not much) and put the veggies on top.  I served it to friends (I also did some without the cheese too) and they were yummy!  That is a good appetizer to bring to a party and you can actually enjoy it!  Thought I would share.....I love bruschetta and this is my twist on it.  I am going to  a party tonight and making a canellini bean hummous with olive oil ( I can't have sesame oil or tahini) and making some herb baked whole wheat pita triangles.  I will also serve it with some organic baby carrots.....so I guess what I am saying ladies is be creative with the foods you CAN have!  We can still eat really good and really healthy.  Annielynn...good job on the treadmill!  That's great!  I agree with you on the rounded shoulder thing...it is so easy to do as those chest muscles shorten when they tighten up.  As they shorten up, the back rounds out.  We need to keep stretching the chest muscles (pectorals) by contracting the back muscles (as your doctor directed).  I do this exercise throughout the day instead of just twice a day because I am sure it can't hurt.  I am gentle and listen to my body.  Also if you don't correct it, you have so many other muscles that can get out of whack.  Nip it in the bud now and you will benefit! Annie 3:  I am so jealous you are on the elliptical!  My doc still says no and I am being a very good patient right now.  That's great. Doesn't it feel good to sweat and feel your body working?  After is a great time to do your streches when everything is really warmed up.  It will ensure you have good range of motion. I am so happy you are half way through chemo.  Which one are you on an how many cycles?  I can't wait to say I am half way through.  You are my hero today!!!  Redsky...I know you are waiting and my heart goes out to you!  How many more days til surgery??  You are smart to keep active now.  I can tell you I think my recovery is going so well because I was in good shape before.  My NP at the PS office is just amazed at how much I am able to do and move around and she said I am much more fit than other patients and she is sure that is what makes the difference.  I can tell you that I used my abdominal strength A LOT in the first few days post surgery to move around in the bed.  Don't forget your abs!  I would think that pectoral stretches and strengthening would be good and upper back strengthening (seated type rows) and stretches would be good.  Let me know what the PT tells you for sure, but for the chest strengthening push ups (do them on your knees if you can't do them on your toes), dumbell presses or dumbell flys (laying on your back and doing them in an upward movement towards the ceiling) would be easy one's to do.  To stretch the pecs you need to move your ams in the opposite direction - I like to put hands behind my back with palms facing back wall and hands placed on back of hips.  Pull elbows backwards and feel the pecs stretch in the front.  For the upper back streching, extend arms in front of you at chest height, clasp hands and round your upper back forward.  This will allow the musles in your back stretch.  For strengthening, the seated rows where you pull your elbows back and almost stick your chest out work well.  Again these are normal exercises that work well for a regular fitness routine - NOT post surgery until the doc directs you to.  So who else is checking in today???? Anyone? Are you exercising? I hope so.  I have a birthday party tonight and will try to dodge the cake!  Thank goodness my friend orders me pizza with tons of veggies and sauce but no cheese so I can have a little piece of pizza.  If you like pizza, try it that way.  I just add a sprinkle of parmesan and it's good!  (and without the added fat, hormones and calories from the cheese).  Let me know how you did today ladies!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2011 05:18PM mdg wrote: LLL-6500 Nice job.  Now I feel like a slacker not walking in the snow here......tomorrow I will get my walk in for sure now that I can drive to the mall again since the roads are clear (hopefully).  Annie - you are half way there on the chemo!  That's great. I can't wait to tell all of you the same thing...it will be on March 24th (not that I am counting or anything.....).  Good for you walking on a chemo day a bit.  Treat your body kind in those days following chemo.  Drink lots of water to stay hydrated! Did my morning rehab exercises.....no walk today for me as all the schools were closed and my son was home with me today.  I am going to do my rehab exercises again tonight.  They felt easier today which is good considering how tight I was after Friday's fill.  I wanted to share a good and healthy dinner idea with all of you.  Tonight I made the lemon, garlic and oregano chicken with tatziki sauce and garlic broccoli on the side with wheat pita bread.  Simple....just marinate the chicken (cut in small pieces) in the juice from a lemon, a few cloves of garlic minced, oregano, S&P.  Marinate for a few hours or overnight.  Put a little olive oil in a large skillet, saute the chicken.  As the juice builds up, pour it off so the chicken will brown a bit as you cook it.  I like to make a lot of this and keep extra to put on salad or in sandwiches.  It's the best and it's healthy!  Just something simple...but you have to like garlic (I am Italian so no problem here).  Give it a try.  It also makes you get you water in for the day much easier...I was pretty thirsty from the garlic! :)  Just a reminder - hormone free chicken is best for us hormone positive gals.  I know what is for tomorrow's lunch....wheat pita, chicken, roasted red peppers and spinach with leftover tatziki!!! Who else did the exercises today???
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2011 06:12PM mdg wrote: Suebee....I will be looking for iron fortified cereal this week as I start chemo next week.  I have to organize what I should be eating during cheno this weekend.....for now I have mostly given up red meat because of er/pr+ and it's not recommended.  I will need to find some other sources of iron.  I do eat spinach almost daily but need to find a few other options.  Here is a list I found online for good iron sources.  The recommended daily amount for women is 18mg. Top 10 Food Sources of Iron So today was a stressful day.  I had to get my chemo port put in at the hospital.  I did manage to do my morning routine of rehab exercises before I took my son to school.  I was at the hospital until 3pm today....and they kept me awake during the procedure which freaked me out a bit.  I had the port placed in my right arm (inside of upper arm about mid-bicep area) so you can't see it unless I lift my arm up and have a tank/really short sleeve shirt on.  It is a lump under the skin (all covered up with skin - no part of the port is visible).  It is about the size of half of a small grape or so.  Yet one more scar and ugly thing on my body.....ick!  Needless to say my arm is a bit sore to move around so I am skipping the exercises on the Right side tonight.  I took some tylenol and hope to get a good sleep tonight and hit the mall for a walk in the morning.  I hope to do my exercises again tomorrow.  Wish me luck (and pain free).  How did you all do today with exercises?  Does anyone still have the tightness deep in the armpit when fully stretched?  That is what hurts me the most....that part where the pec muscle goes up into the upper arm.  It does feel better each day, but how I long for a day where it does not hurt when I stretch!!!  The nerve pain accross my chest is a little better - still there but not as sensitive as a week or two ago - either that or I am getting use to it! Keep up the exercises ladies....I need to keep moving through chemo and may need you to push me in the coming weeks a bit too!

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2011 07:20PM mdg wrote: Ladies...can I tell you how bad this fill today is hurting??? OUCH!  My upper back is so painful.  My DH gave me a back rub and then I took a hot shower...got temporary relief and it's back.  I am going to take some tylenol closer to bed time so I get some better sleep tonight.  I even did my exercises in the shower thinking it would help...it made my chest feel less tight (so the exercises do work) but my back is just suffering even after stretching it.  OK - I am done complaining.  I am going to assume it will be much better in the morning :) My hubby is back from his business trip!  He has been gone since Wed and he got my mom to come over and "babysit" me for the past few days.  Nice hu?  I feel like I am twelve again!  I am looking forward to having my hubby home for the weekend.  I am going to do some low sugar and low fat healthy baking this weekend....working on some new recipes.  I figure I still want to eat things that taste good and are not bad for me.  I figured I need to do that after I ate a big chocolate chip cookie after dinner tonight!  (yes, my confession...I teach aerobics, but I am human and love sweets too!).  I did have a large spinach salad for dinner though (I should get points for that!).   Annielynn:  My husband is dying for us to go skiing and I said "are you kidding me?".  I then followed it up with "it ain't gonna happen this winter".   I think he plans to take our son to a local ski place at some point (he wants to get our 4 year old skiing and just can't wait - but that is a whole different conversation.....).  I like the big, fat "NO" from your doc...it doesn't hurt to ask....LOL!  45 minutes...that's great!  I have not done any leg workouts yet...I will start on Monday now that I am cleared to hit the gym.  I will be sore next week...that should be fun with starting chemo and all.

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2011 05:30PM mdg wrote: Hay my healthy fit gals!  I am just settling in after getting my little one tucked in bed.  My back was all better today!   I am getting ready to do my evening round of exercises.  I don't have the tightness in my chest either from Friday's fill.   I feel good!   I am behind on my water today.....so that means I will be playing catch up this evening (which means I will also be up going to the bathroom several times in the middle of the night).  Tip to all:  Drink water early in the day!   Did you all drink your water today??? Today I worked on baking....yes I said baking!   I did some healthy baking.  I wanted to find a way to make foods that are good for me to enjoy that don't contain things that are not good for me (refined sugar, white flour, fat, etc....).  I was in my test kitchen and made some brownies (low fat and no refined sugar) and some pumpkin/bananna spice muffins (no fat, no refined sugar).  My son actually tried my test recipes and said he would have some muffins for breakfast in the morning and the brownie was good.  So if anyone wants recipes, PM me.  They are not exactly like the real thing but at least when I want something that seems "normal" I won't feel so guilty.  I am actually thinking about writing a cook book for us ER/PR+ BC gals since there are so many things we shouldn't have, so I am trying new things and collecting all my newly created recipes.  If you want to try my recipes, PM with your email address. Tomorrow I am going to the gym!  It will be the first time I have been there since 1/26!  I don't know what to do first.  I will definately do some cardio and my rehab stuff.  My legs have been neglected so the leg machines too.  Even if you can't do arm exercises yet, ask your PS about leg exercises.  There are a lot of leg exercises you can do while your upper body heals.  Who's going to the gym tomorrow?  Anyone????  I feel like my class is getting smaller....where is everyone? Reminders: Re-hab exercises twice daily!  (this is a must) 8 glasses of water per day! 5 servings of fruits/veggies per day! Get moving....walk, ride the bike, whatever.....20 min minimum per day if you can!  Avoid fat and refined sugar products....whole grain pasta and brown rice a good substitute!!!  For oils - stick to olive oil and canola - both are better for you.

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2011 04:46AM mdg wrote: Anniemomofthree:  Glad you even got 30 minutes in...take what you can get when it's crazy!  I also feel like no one calls me....it's like I have the plague, not cancer.  I use to talk to friends and family all the time before BC and now no one really calls.  It makes me feel a bit disconnected.  It's hard because their lives are going on completely normal and I am dealing with so much crap.  I hate calling them when all I have to talk about it my cancer lately.....you know what I mean?  So I just don't call them either.  My mom is driving me crazy...she keeps guilting me "I haven't heard from you...".  Well mom, sorry but I have cancer and don't always feel like calling to talk about it....ugh!  So the bone pain from the neulasta shot finally hit at 2am this morning...oh what fun.  It was like crazy, shooting, sharp pains going through my saccrum and hips and then aching all through my hips.  It's the oddest pain I have ever felt but it goes right through me and brings me to my knees when it is shooting.  Lord!  I am taking some tylenol and going to the gym to see what happens.  I don't want to lay around...it actually hurts worse laying down or sitting than standing up.  Gosh I hope it passes.  I did not sleep well again last night.  I have not had good sleep in a week now....I am just feeling tired. Get those exercises in today.....I will let you know what I can do at the gym and physical therapy!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 07:13PM mdg wrote: I don't know what to cook this week.  I did make veggie soup yesterday so I am eating a lot of leftovers of that for lunch.  I need to do more crock pot stuff...it makes things so much easier.  My family loved the salsa chicken I made in the crock pot last week (recipe in blog...super easy).  I am getting ready for some Italian meatloaf, chicken cacciatore, Italian baked rice.....all good comfort foods....Oh and chicken marsala.  Yum!  This week will be super busy for me though,....don't know when I will have time to shop or cook.  I head to Northwestern on Monday for an appointment with my new med onc...that should take all day considering the drive and traffic.  Then I go back there on Thursday to see the PS.

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2011 07:57PM mdg wrote: I am making stuffed portabellas tomorrow....spinach, garlic, goat cheese, roasted red peppers.....I am going to grill them.  I bought all the stuff today.  I am really getting into roasted cauliflower.  I eat a ton of it when I make it.  Have you tried it?  It's super good...last time I also added brussel sprouts and I never like those but enjoyed them roasted.....so good! I have not made eggplant parm in a while...I save it for winter.  It's good comfort food!  DH loves it.

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2011 04:24PM mdg wrote: Supersally:  I don't like brussel sprouts either and they are good this way.  I mixed them with carrots and cauliflower and really liked them.  You could always drizzle with balsamic and bake a little longer...>I am sure that would be good.  Try them...I think you will be surpised.  I was.  I never liked brussel sprouts before unless they were full of butter and tossed with bacon! Julie:  I had no drains at exchange.  My PS doesn't do them.  He had to revise both sides as I was uneven and still did not use drains.  Ask your PS how he typically does it.  Good to hear you are able to walk - even when it rains.  Glad you are healed from rads.  That's great!!

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2012 05:27AM mdg wrote: Samantha, I am so sorry you have to walk this road too.  My heart goes out to you.  There are many young women on these boards so check out the threads pertaining to young women.  Here you will find great support and lots of women that understand what you are going through.  Hugs! As far as advice, find doctors that you feel comfortable with even if it means getting second opinions.  Evaluate all of your options before you make any decisions.  Lean on family and friends - and us of course!  Take it one step at a time.  Don't think about the big picture....just the next step in your treatment.  I just kept telling myself if would be one year of BC crap and then I would have my life back.  It was....at the 1 year mark I finished my reconstructive surgeries and had finished chemo months before.  It is almost two years out from my diagnosis now and life is good. Hugs!
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with BC at 22 scozy07 3Cbrca

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2011 10:27AM mdg wrote: Good morning ladies!  It's a beautiful sunny day here with the sun shining despite the fact it is freezing and everything is still covered in snow!  My boys just went out sledding so I am of to do my rehab exercises in a few.   I had my first fill today and it has been a little uncomfortable.  I had to sleep propped up again last night and my exercises were harder to do last night after I had the fill.  Motrin has helped a bit with the discomfort.  I did some label reading at Whole Foods today.  Can I just tell you that almost every food produced contains sunflower oil, safflower oil or soybean oil?  How frustrating.  I am not trying to be a freak - just more choosy about what I eat and since those oils are not the best for me it's getting frustrating since they are in everything!  I did find some foods with my continued reading of labels and walked out with some good choices.  I am trying to do some new recipes rich in the foods that are good for me...Tonight, chicken with tomatoes, basil, artichokes with brown rice and garlic green beans!  All organic ladies and fresh.  Again, you don't have to go nuts with avoiding everything, just figure out which foods are good for us and find some recipes that use those ingredients.  In case you have not checked out low calorie recipes, www.cookinglight.com has a lot of good ones to choose from.  Many have been rated by other users too so you can see if they are really good or not.  Just another resource for you So, who did the rehab exercises or walking today?   I am ready to get started now that the boys are out of the house.  Just remember you can do the easy exercises (shoulder rolls and upper back contractions) almost anywhere and any time!  Cindy - after my fill, my skin on my breasts has gotten so sensitive!  The NP said that is  normal and to try to prevent it from getting over sensitive by lightly rubbing a dry washcloth over it a few times a day on bare skin.  Sounds painful...since it's already sensitive, but I guess none of that is fun.  I guess we can do that after our rehab exercises each day too! Sue - I was not a bad eater either.  It must have been the wine and birth control pills or something.  I don't know how the heck I got BC!  I am glad you are getting back into Zumba.  What a great way to clear your mind and lose yourself in the music while doing good for your body!  Enjoy that!  Just listen to your body and do the parts that don't hurt anything.  Soon enough you will be doing all of it with no problem!  You are GOOD on the nightie!  I haven't even thought of going there though we had our first intimate experience since surgery...(sorry if this is too much information.....no one else understands but you gals!).  I kept a tank top on and was nervous....it made my kind of emotional after feeling uncomfortable with my body.  My husband was so reassuring and said none of that mattered....I guess this will take some time to get use to.  I guess when I get more use to things it will settle....for now it gets me feeling a little strange and self conscious.  Post your progress for the day.  Anyone cooking anything else healthy and good this weekend and want to share the menu so we can get some ideas?  Just remeber, the rehab exercises are twice a day!  No slacking ladies...you will lose progress.  Stay on top of it and we will be going full force by April!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 12:58PM mdg wrote: Sue Bee - glad you have had 3 days leak free.  You have to refrain for now, but you can still work on getting all those good foods in you.  You may even enjoy doing some relaxation and visualization things to exercise your mind.  Time will pass quickly and you will be back to doing everything soon!  Hang in there.  I am soooo glad your incision is on the mend Supersally...glad the raisinette is holding on!  That is good news!  We take ALL good news here and celebrate!  Good to hear range of motion is on track too.  Keep it up - your efforts are paying off!  I am jealous it will be 70 there....only 20 something here for the HIGH today, but the sun is shining bright so I am enjoying that (I wore my sunglasses today!).  Dinner sounds fab....wish I were closer, I would have stopped in! Annie - I am so glad to be back to cooking too.  It feels nice to do something "normal" again! :)  Tonight I am making chicken and whole grain pasta with a fresh broccoli and shallot sauce.  My little one likes broccoli so I have to make him eat the veggies he WILL eat!  That's a battle for him...veggies! So I went to the physical therapist today for my evaluation.  SHe measured my range of motion and it is pretty good.  She was impressed but it is not 100% yet on two areas so we will work on that.  She also did a few stretches with my overhead range of motion.  It actually felt good - better than when I do my exercises.  She also did some massage of the pec muscle where it inserts up under your arm (in the arm pit area) which is where I feel tightness.  That actually felt good too.  We spent most of the time doing the evaluation but she said in thursday she is taking me into the gym for some more stuff and is going to get me moving.  I will keep you posted. One thing I wanted to share in case anyone else is switching to all natural body care products (chemical free, organic and paraben free).  Meijer has quite a selection - the best I have seen outside of Whole Foods and way better than Target.  They had lots of choices for face care, body care (soaps, lotions, scrubs) and shampoo/conditioner.  They did also carry the PHysician's Formula Organic Make Up.  They had quite a bit but no real eye shadows, consealor or lipstick.  It's a start though.  I just thought I would share in case anyone else is making the big switch as it has been hard to track down organic products.  Keep up the good work ladies!  I have 6 of my glasses of water in already today and feel like I am going to float away!  Ugh!  Drink that water girls - it's good for you!

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2011 04:54AM mdg wrote: Hi Cody and welcome to our group!  Glad you found us.  I don't know much about the tram flap as I had tissue expanders and implants to follow later.  Can you speak with you PS about getting you started with a physical therapist?  If you started with a PT at least you would have a better sense of what you can and can't do.  I know a few years ago I had a c-section but that is a bit different as they only cut through muscle and did not remove any and they did not remove skin (I wish they would have since my child was almost 10 lbs!).  I am surprised you PS did not provide any exercises or stretches for you.  I would definately call his nurse and ask.  It can't hurt.  As far as milk, I am not sure as I have issues with dairy and was eating it minimally before my DX.  I only eat lowfat, organic, hormone free type cheeses.  I eat those in moderation though.  I did some reading on www.foodforbreastcancer.com and found the website helpful.  See what you think.  As far as soy - there is controversy about it at this point.  Some say it's good and some say avoid it.  At my nutition consulatation through the American Cancer Society, they said avoid it until more reliable information is available.  I can't recommend what you should do, I have chosen to iliminate as much soy from my diet as possible though.  Glad your doctor said you can walk.  That is a great start.  I was reminding the walkers the other day to make sure and stretch after you walk each day.  If you don't stretch your legs, things can tighten up and effect your back and other things.  We also have all been trying to work on our upper body posture.  With surgery done to the chest and many of us with tissue expanders, it can make you round your upper back and hunch over just in the upper part of the back.  The chest muscles become tight and the upper back muscles get overstretched and weak.  You need to focus on your upper back posture to combat that and pull the shoulders back - as long as that's not an issue with your tram.  Definately talk to your doc about rehab exercises or a PT to get you started.  Also - a nice alternative to beef is ground turkey.  I get the hormone free, low fat, all natural fed ground turkey.  It has great flavor if you are using spices.  I make tacos, meatloaf, chili, stuffed peppers, hamburgers, meatballs, and more...just about everything with it.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2011 02:23PM mdg wrote: Sue Bee - I am glad it is not infected. That is good news.  I know you are disappointed but if your doc is cool with you walking than do that.  It is still good for your body!  You are doing some good regardless.  Eat lots of beef hu?  So you are eating steak every day?   I am not a big beef eater so I would be in trouble! So ladies....today is another day.  I am hoping all are on track with rehab exercises.  I did my 35 min mall walk (stopped and window shopped at Pandora...yes I have picked out 4 cute, inexpensive rings I plan to get - 1 after each of my 4 chemo sessions!).  I also did my physical therapy.  SHe actually is letting me do some of the exercises now with the elastic bands and since I already have them at home I can add those exercises to my daily routine.  I will do those again tonight!  Tomorrow I get more chemo port in....so I won't be checking in until later as I will be all doped up for the surgery.  I will try and do my rehab exercises..hopefully I can do those after surgery but I am not sure they will let me since my port is going in my upper arm. Here's an interesting tidbit on eating out.  I was out running errands all day and needed to get lunch because I did not have time to come home in between things to eat.  Chipotle has hormone free chicken and organic veggies in their food.  I am not a fast food gal, but getting a salad with organic veggies and black beans worked well for me.  I just wanted to share in case anyone else is avoiding hormones in meat and eating more organic.  Just a little tip I learned today :) Keep your exercise updates coming ladies!  I can't wait til this snow melts so I can walk outside....maybe next week.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2011 07:14PM mdg wrote: Today I did my 40 minutes on the elliptical and did leg machines.  I was running errands all day and did PT at 1pm.  I finally got home after 3:30pm from all of my last pre-chemo errands.  I cooked for a few hours making food for the next few days so my family is set if I don't feel like cooking after chemo.  I even packed a special lunch and snacks for my hubby and friend coming to chemo with me tomorrow.  We will be there from 8am until about 5pm due to the cold caps. I packed chicken, spinach, sundried tomato and goat cheese sandwiches on low cal wheat bread, apple slices, baby carrots, lemonade, sugar free candies, organic whole wheat pretzels, low fat pumpkin spice muffins and lots of water.  My friend has recently lost 20lbs so I told her I was packing a guilt free lunch for all of us!   I also made a huge pot of organic chicken and roasted veggie soup for the week since that is good comfort food.  I am as ready as it get's for chemo.....I guess exercising won't happen tomorrow, but I will make it up on Saturday which has usually been my day off.   That's my plan!  I hope to exercise 5 days a week all through chemo....please hold me to that!  It may be hard!  Oh and by the way, my legs are sore from the machines this morning.  It feels good to workout again! Supersally:  Corgi's are so cute!  And who doesn't love labs...they have such personality!  What great little babies to keep you company going through this.  I miss the unconditional love of my puppies.  I need to reschedule my dental appt.  It was originally the same day as my lumpectomy and SNB in Dec and I have just not rescheduled it.  Knowing my luck I will have a cavity on top of everything else going on.  I did have a pelvic u/s last week and have my annual pap on Monday.  That sounds like lots of fun considering I have chemo tomorrow and a TE fill on Friday this week.  All I do is go to dr's!!!!!  I can relate.  I like you exercising at the doctor's.  That is multitasking at it's finest!!!!  Annielynn:  Let me know how the class is.  Sounds great! I will stop complaining about being cold here...Montana has to be way worse, although tomorrow with the cold caps I will feel like I am in Montana........ick! Anyone else exercise or makes something healthy and good for dinner?  I am always looking for ideas......

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2011 11:39AM mdg wrote: Good Saturday ladies.  It is raining and gloomy here......ick!  The chemo constipation got the best of me early this morning...poor DH had to run to the pharmacy at 6am because I was miserable.  Feeling better now....I am starving again today.  I feel OK but nothing foodwise sounds good or appealing. I am keeping it bland...toast, whole wheat pasta, pretzels....but feel good.  My fill yesterday did me in again...I stretched last night but my back is tight again. I think I am done with the whole "filling up" routine.  The boobs are big enough....now I have to convince the nurse of that.  I am a bit tired today because I just didn't sleep well which is normal when I have a fill.  My legs are sore though...I did deadlifts yesterday (with light weights) but boy do I feel them today!  My hamstrings and glutes have been neglected in the past month!  It feels good to workout kind of normal again!   I am doing rehab exercises only today - no cardio.  I am going to save my energy for tomorrow or Monday.  I just can't muster up going out in this crappy rainy, cold weather!    I am baking some fat free bananna muffins later.........yum!  How are we doing?  Hanging in there?  Annie - are you feeling any better??

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 08:00PM mdg wrote: Anniemomof3:  Yes, alcohol of any kind has been linked to BC.  That just stinks....I miss my wine.  I do try to have a glass here and there but I feel like I can't enjoy it because I now know it could kill me.  At least now that I am in chemo I am not having it anyway....I will hopefully get over it and at least learn to enjoy a glass here and there without having bad thoughts.

Suebee: So glad you got to ride.  WHat a nice feeling!  It's nice to do something normal.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 01:24PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies....today was a good day.  I took my first Step aerobics class since surgery.  I hadn't planned on it but it was just starting when I got to the gym so I hopped in.  It felt soo good!  I decided that I am teaching a few classes next month - even during chemo!  I miss my class so much (not that you gals aren't fun!) as I have been teaching them for 8 years!  They have no idea about me having BC.  They just know I had surgery and will be back soon.  I will have to put on my game face...they will be full of questions wondering what happend  and why I have lost so much weight.  Oh well....I will deal with it I guess.  I also did physical therapy today and my R side is finally caught back up to my left side on range of motion.  I am still having upper back pain - I think from all the fills in the TE's.  ANyone else have back issues after getting filled up???  Anniemomof3:  You are good staying away from the cookies!  I would never be able to do that!  I was also wondering how to raise hemoglobin as mine was at the low end of normal last week...worried it will go down!  I googled and found this information: http://www.home-remedies-site.com/health/foods-that-raise-hemoglobin.htm I also read this: Foods to increase Hemoglobin To increase hemoglobin level, the diet is the most important thing. A modified diet rich in vitamin B12, folate and iron is essential for the rapid rise in hemoglobin level. Folate is commonly present in liver, kidney, spinach, cabbage, yeast, nuts and fruits. Vitamin B12 is exclusively present in foods of animal origin. Meat, liver, eggs, dairy products contain adequate amount of the vitamin B12. Vegetable sources do not contain vitamin B12. Iron is present in red meat, liver, egg yolk, green leafy vegetables, dry fruits, jaggery, brown bread, unpolished rice. Milk is a poor source of iron. Other foods which can help are bananas, black grapes, plums, strawberries, raisins, carrots, radish, celery, tomatoes, beets, almonds, soyabeans, fenugreek seeds etc. I eat almonds every day, I had zucchini the last few nights with dinner and I eat spinach almost daily.  How can my levels be low?  I also take multivitamins and B12.  I am doing great though and drinking water (peeing a lot too!).   Supersally:  The chicken chili sounds good!   Unfortunately due to BC I had to give up beef....that sounds good too but no more for me.  Now I am stuck on your chili.....I would rather have that than the chicken/veggie stir fry I am making tonight.  Darn it...now I am craving chili!!!  I don't mean to make you feel guilty...but I do want you to exercise:)   I hope you were able to get that fill today.  For sure do your stretches in the next few days.  I always get tight after fills! SueBee:  I did not know you were in Dayton.  I use to live in Cinci!  We were neighbors at one time!  You are so lucky girl that you don't need the chemo!  Ugh!  I am jealous!  That's great that you got to Zumba.  Keep it up girl!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2011 06:58PM mdg wrote: Hi Ladies!  I have been sooo busy today I am just now getting to sit down.  I have chemo tomorrow so I had so many things to do.  I literally ran erronds, worked out, went to phys therapy, etc...until 5pm today!  Nuts!  Tonight I had to make dinner for tonight and Thursday (so I don't have to cook if I feel bad), make lunch for us tomorrow (I pack snacks, lunch, etc...for the day as on chemo days due to the Cold Caps I am there for almost 8 hours!), pack up my chemo and cold cap supplies, get my son a bath and to bed....I am exhausted and I am on the steriods!  I was last time too...I slept last time which surprised me on the steriods.  I hope I sleep tonight.  I did exercise 45 min on the elliptical today and did the leg machines.  I also had PT so I got my exercise in today.  So tomorrow I will message you from the chemo chair...I will be bored and there all day.  Workout for me tomorrow as I won't have time!   Rennasus:  I hope you like the meatballs...this was just my creative cooking after looking in the fridge for supplies.  I love cooking and have a blast making up my own recipes all the time.  I guess I need to start writing these down!  Again...still toying with a BC cooking blog but I feel so busy and know that once I get back to work I won't have time for anything.  So glad you lost 5lbs.  What a great thing!  Good luck with the surgery...I want you healed up so you can move on and get this stuff over with!  I hope it goes well.  Melanie:   Glad you joined us!  Welcome!  I am glad you like to exercise..that makes all of this easier.  You will like hanging with us.  As far as the sugar...it's a bummer.  Who doesn't like dessert??  I do!  Also with the tightness, did your doc give you any stretches to do?  I started with post surgery stretches and exercises provided by my breast center and they really helped, but I did not have axillary dissection.  If you need a copy of my exercises to show your doctor, let me know by PM along with your email and I will get them to you.  I would ask that you run it by your doctor though as I can't recommend things for you personally.  Another option would be to ask for a physical therapy referral.  If your insurance covers it - I recommend it.  I am proactively working with one and it has helped a ton.  I go twice a week and it's worth it!  That's AWESOME about the 10K!  Good luck!  YOu can do it! Supersally:  So jealous it is warm there!  Tonight we have freezing rain.  I am worried they will close schools...I have chemo tomorrow and had to line up a stand by sitter.  Ugh!  It is going to be cold here again...my flowers are still sprouting though!  Can't wait to see the tulips and hyacinth bloom!  I hope you feel better..... SueBee:  I am so glad the "booby fairy" has started to visit!  (I have been waiting since I was 11 and she finally visited me too!).  You will be amazed after only a few fills how quick they grow!  I have 410cc's in right now and have to stop filling for now.  He is planning to put in a 375 implant at exchange - FYI.  I guess I will be a B cup (that's his best estimation) but I am still hoping for one more fill if my back gets better.  It was feeling a little better again today.  Don't forget to stretch the chest and shoulders around those fill times!  I always got sooo tight and that really helped! Anniemomof3:  Glad you got the exericse in today!  Good job.  As far as the sweets.....I just posted all about sugar on my blog a few days ago and how it fuels cancer....worth a read.  I got the information from the book The Anti Cancer:  A New Way of Life.  Very eye opening...and scary.  I too crave sweets and I am finding healthier alternatives.  I am baking a lot.  I keep some low fat/low sugar whole grain muffins on hand (banana, pumpkin spice, cinnamon) and since I use organic ingredients they are healthy and low cal - about 140 calories.  I also found some dark chocolates at Trader Joes.  They only have 5 gms of sugar per serving which is two small pieces.  I am also making some brownies using unsweetened cocoa and agave for sweetness....lower glycemic index with that than any sugar.  I also found some ice cream pops made of coconut milk (I am avoiding most dairy) and they have a low amount of sugar too (I just bought them today and have not tried them yet).  I guess I am saying if you can find healthier, lower sugar options to keep on hand you can at least still indulge but with less guilt and less sugar which is soooo much better for you.  Just some ideas........
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2015 07:08AM mdg wrote: Always hate when new members join our club!!! Wish there was a cure for this awful disease.  You are among some of the finest ladies in this group though..you will find support and friendship as you go through this difficult time.  Hugs and best wishes!!!
Posts.Title: Age 44. DCIS Stage 0. Decided on Double Mx. MizMimi MizMimi

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2011 05:38AM mdg wrote: Welcome!  I am sorry  you have joined our club but so glad you found us.   I have been dealing with this since December.  It has been a long 10 months but the women here have helped me get through every step of this.  I also had BMX and it was far easier than I thought it would be.  You will get through this.  I can tell you the beginning is the hardest part.  I too have found blessings through this.  Have hope and keep faith in that.  Hugs!
Posts.Title: So I've Joined The Club.... Blessings2011 Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2011 05:17PM mdg wrote: Feel free to ask questions any time.  I hang out in the March Chemo Lounge with a wonderful group of gals...stop by for a drink sometime!  Those gals will answer anything too.  Really I feared chemo more than my BMX and it was not that bad for me.  Drink TONS of water and try to keep moving.  If you buy in to feeling like crap, you will feel like crap.  I am saying prayers for you girls and hope all goes well!!!
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2011 04:20PM mdg wrote: Rennasus: So glad your surgery went well.  I hope you feel good in the coming days.   I am doing OK from chemo.  No bad side effects this time...today however I am really tired.  I am exhausted.  I don't know if it's completely physical or mental too...I had a rough day.  I did start taking the iron today.  Thanks for the reminder on constipation....reaching for stool softeners NOW!  Supersally:  after the day I have had I think I will just skip the Perrier and order a shot............I have not had any skin issues since starting chemo except my hands are super dry and none of the natural products seem to help.  I am ready to dunk them in olive oil or something.  Lips have been ok with Burt's Bees lip balm and Aveda lipstick.  I hope you got your workout in today.  Melanie:  Hope the headaches go away.....take a break from the workouts with that!  I hope you are feeling better by now......hugs!  Today stared off good...did my workout and such then it got crappy!  I had a huge blow up with my PS office.  I am considering looking for a new surgeon....they told me the doc won't even talk about scheduling my exchange until I am done with chemo which is the first week of May.  Ok - I get that but right now they are already scheduling for late July and he's completely booked.  So by May he will be scheduling into fall.....OK so when I came to you in January and was a new patient, you scheduled my surgery within 4 weeks (so you apparently have time for new patients that will generate more momey) but now that I am an existing patient you won't schedule anything for months because you are too busy to exhchange my TE's.  No one ever told me I would have TE for 8-9 months!   Everytime I asked when I could have exchange they said 2 months after last fill or 6 weeks post chemo and then I would say "so June, right?" and they would say yes.  They neglected to tell me that I "could" have surgery 6 weeks after chemo but "it won't happen because we are more interested in taking new patients".   This is crap!  I am livid........going to lose it.  I had a complete meltdown on the phone with his nurse and told her that I have been a trooper through all of this.  I am being positive about everything.....I am living a normal life - I am up every morning at 6:30am to get my son off to school, I workout every single day, I cook a complete meal for my family every single night.  I have not had any real help since 2 weeks after my surgery in January.  I am not a rock star - I don't want a medal, I am just trying to have a life and as much as a normal one for my family.  I am willing myself to be fine after everything I have gone through and continue to go through.  I am sick of this crap.  All I wanted was "light at the end of the tunnel"....you know the surgery I was told I would get in June so I could move on with my life and have a "normal" summer for my 4 year old son. I then told her that she took that away from me....and started bawling.  I told her it was unacceptable....I don't know what to do.  My hubby is out of town...feel so low tonight.    I have to now cancel our vacation with 4 other families because they won't schedule my surgery and won't tell me when they will.  I have to make those phone calls tomorrow.  WTF?  Am I crazy or would you be mad?  I am completely shocked by this.  I NEVER go this type of impression from my PS.  He is so nice, thorough and has been nothing but generous with his time with me on every appointment I have had.  I love my PS.  I just can't believe he is OK with his patients being treated like this...maybe he is OK with it.  How can this be the same PS that actually called me the night before my BLMX surgery at home to discuss some things with me and put me at ease for the next day????  What would you ladies do????  Advice?  Someone calm me down, please.  I am so upset tonight.  I just feel drained....I so wish my hubby was not out of town...........
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2011 01:25PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies!  So it's almost Friday.   So glad!  My hubby is home - I missed him this week.  I did workout this morning faithfully.  I also got the call from the PS office.  They basically have offered me nothing.  After I complained she offered up an appt to meet with the PS on Monday.  You can bet your sweet $%%$ I am meeting with him on Monday!  I also took time to make phone calls today and think I may have found another great PS.  I am waiting to see if he will meet with me.  If he does and I hire him, they can do surgery in June!  THe girl there was SO nice and understanding when I explained my situation and was shocked they won't schedule anything.....they don't handle things like that at all.  I feel better.  I also called the other PS I originally met with that I really liked.  Have not heard back from them as to whether they will see me or not.  I am going to just solve this problem one way or another!  So does anyone want to come and cook me dinner tonight??? I am not in the mood to cook dinner...which is odd for me.  I guess I am just lazy today.  I have to come up with something quick I guess!  Melanie:  Great that you did 3 miles.  I have not been running in so long...I was letting a foot injury heal up and never tried again since surgery.  Foot is better though.....if I start running my Med Onc will lose it though, right???  Oh well...I can wait.  Hope you are feeling good! Supersally:  Your trip sounds so nice!  I have not been to the Keys in years but it was so beautiful and fun!  Can I also tell you I have never been on a horse?  I have always been scared.  I wish we were closer...I could use a push to do something out of the box.  I would feel better on your gentle horse!  I am LOL at your granny.  It gives me something to shoot for!  Rennasus:  Dust off that workout equipment!  Come on girl!  You can do it and you will feel better after you do! Where is the rest  of our group?  We have lost so many......I am bummed!

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 07:30PM mdg wrote: Annie:  LOL at the steroids!  I do get a lot done when on them too.  I am exhausted listening to your day though!  As far as the sugar thing..it's hard.  I am baking with Blue Agave and Honey because it has a lower glycemic index.  I also use whole wheat and whole grain flour to get rid of the refined stuff that raises insulin levels.  I am also making fruit based things...banana muffins, apple crisp (using canola and small amounts of agave or maple syrup), dark chocolate things (little or no sugar in the cocoa and really dark chocolate).  I am lucky that my son is young and we never had a lot of sugar foods in our house so he doesn't miss anything..it would be harder if he was use to those awesome sounding cupcakes (don't you dare bring one to me......they sound SO good!).   I wish I knew of a good nutrition class...I would sign up too!  Right now I am just reading a lot and getting issues of Cooking Light and googling recipes and adjusting them to meet my needs.  Las Vegas would be often...that would be a LOT of fake boobs all in one room hu?  LOL!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2011 12:58PM mdg wrote: Rennasus...I like the idea of serving over wheat couscous....will have to do that for sure.  I love chickpeas...I use to snack on hummus but since the tahini is not the best choice I have given it up unless I am at my favorite middle eastern restaurant...then I have to have it!  It's the best there!  Annieof3:  so glad you got out and hiked - even around a frozen lake.  We had lots of rain here today.  I did do my elliptical and some weights on legs and my upper body PT exercises.  I keep picturing it being bathing suit season and wanting to look decent after all of this.  I guess if my new boobs are big enough it will distract anyone from the rest of the body....ha ha!  Tonight we are making pizza for dinner. I was able to find some whole wheat pizza dough at Trader Joe's that does not contain the bad oils.  It is not oranic though, but it is whole wheat.  I buy a few and put them in the freezer so we have them when needed.  I am doing veggie pizza with a sprinkle of parmesan for me and DH and a regular cheese and spinach for my son.  My son loves making pizza..rolling out the dough and putting the toppings on.  So if you think pizza can't be healthy...make it yourself and it can be.  I saute up a bunch of onion, garlic, spinach, red peppers and anything else I have that sounds good.  Put the pizza sauce on, then the veggies and just a few sprinkles of cheese (I do parmesan but you could do a little organic mozzarella if you want) and serve with a large salad. It's so good I can hardly order pizza out anymore.  Other favorite toppings...artichokes, banana peppers, roasted red peppers, mushrooms, sundried tomatoes, fresh tomato slices...roasted garlic....SO Good.  Don't forget to add in fresh herbs...basil, oregano, parsley or whatever you have on hand. Just a dinner idea that everyone likes....it also works well on Fridays during lent for us Catholics.  I hope you all have a healthy weekend!  Get to the gym ladies!  It's time to shop for bathing suits..... :)

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2011 05:52AM mdg wrote: Annieof3:  It does feel good to say 75%.  I can't wait to say 100%!!!!  Three more weeks baby! Silia:  Good job on that workout!!! I am on my way to the gym now for my morning boost! Rennasus:  Yes, hubby will like Sat night's plan...LOL!  I have read about the green tea and decided I will start with that after chemo.  I have read so many things can interfere with chemo I just decided to wait until after chemo.  I already got some tea from my holistic MD and am ready to go.  I don't recall if its a green tea but it's a detox tea.  I will start with that and then add in the green tea if needed too.  I hate tea...this should be interesting.  The tea my doc gave me is one you make up in a big batch and take a teaspoon or two a day.  The other green teas I am sure I will have to drink a lot....don't know how I am going to choke that down.  I don't drink any coffee or tea at all....never have.  I don't like them. Ick!  Oh well, I will have to try and find a way.  SueBee:  Good luck with the job search.  I want to hear more about this mexican lasanga!  Sounds good. I do a mexican casserole that is good with a layer of brown rice on the bottom, refried beans or black beans, a layer of cooked veggies and some taco meat made of ground turkey (you could do ground sirloin too) then topped with a little cheese.  I have never done mexican lasagna.......do share some info on that.  We love mexican and it's a good way to do more vegitarian.  I am trying to do two nights a week of vegetairan meals to decreast our meat consupmtion overall.  It's hard for me with a 4 year old.  He loves refried beans but I need more protein options that are not meat.  I can't eat much dairy so I can't rely on dairy for me......  I am off to the gym for my workout.  Today I also have my last day of PT and my neulasta shot.  ICK!!!!  Keep you posted.  Get those bodies moving today ladies!
