Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2011 01:30PM mdg wrote: Hey gals.  Managed my hour elliptical workout and some PT exercises.  The steroids kept me up til 2:30am so I am dragging a bit today.  I am sitting here in my chair - no make up and dressed in sweats.  I showered but due to cold caps my hair has not been washed in 6 days!  I am a sight for sore eyes....I am not going anywhere today!  I am cooking dinner and that's it.  I have been up since 6:30am....I sooo wish I was able to nap.  I can't nap.  Never could...not even while pregnant and I had insomnia for 2 trimesters.....I will hopefully sleep well tonight and feel refreshed in the morning! Melanie:  Thanks for the recipe...looks good.  Does it taste like pinapple though?  I am not a pinapple fan....but it sounds interesting.  That pain in you arm sounds horrible.  Did that happen from your surgery then?  I got a rotator cuff injury from my lumpectomy but it seems to be a lot better now after PT worked with me. It is not bothering me as much.  I am glad you got a short walk in...better than nothing.  Hang in there! Rennasus....I am so jealous of your scenic and warm walks!  It was barely 50 today here.  Spring is trying to come but it is really windy!  Between the pills and worrying about being able to poop after chemo I feel like an old fart!!!!  My husband did buy me a pill organizer but I can't bring myself to use it...it makes me feel old!!! SueBee:  You deserve a day off.  I am sure the puppies gave you a good workout anyway!  They always do!  I have been to Italy three times and still don't appreciate olives......just a little trivia for you all (speaking of Italy), me and my hubby got married there.....in Positano overlooking the sea.  I don't know why I felt like typing that...but maybe it's because every time I think of Italy I think of our beautiful wedding...  As far as soups...I have wanted to make a homemade tomato florentine soup.  That sounds soooo good.  Maybe roast the tomatoes with onions, garlic, EVOO and herbs before...I am going to have to play around with that!  I am LOL and the Mrs. Doubtfire analogy.  I am glad they stopped filling my boobs or I would have that problem for sure...they are huge compared to my old boobs.  I keep hitting things with them and I can't feel it so I don't know!  Too funny...My DH will love that analogy...I will tell him tonight.  My son likes Mrs. Doubtfire and he's only 4.  Anyway ladies....I have to get ready to make dinner for the boys now.  We will chat this weekend!  Have a great night!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2011 01:04PM mdg wrote: Annie:  Glad you worked out.  I just posted my photo with hair on the cold caps thread....see!  I have hair!  How was your wash?  I hope minimal shedding:)  Go get the girls pumped up!  I hope it does not get tight.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 06:40PM mdg wrote: Hay ladies!  How did your weeknd go?  Yesterday I did my make up workout from Thursday when I skipped.  I actually ran.  I have not gone running since before my surgery!  It actually felt hard but good!  I think I will add it in once or twice a week to mix things up.  We had a great Easter weekend.  We were so busy the whole time.  I find it so difficult to eat well while out and at other people's houses.  There is bad food everywhere and I don't mean just desserts. I just mean things that are not refined and don't contain the bad oils.    It makes me only want to have people over to my house so I can control the food that's offered!  I do try to always bring an appetizer I know I can have but then if dinner is out of my control then I am stuck.  Based on that situation, I ate bad this weekend. My friends picked up Chinese for dinner on Fri night.  Sat my sister made dinner which was not too much off my diet.  Today we went to brunch and then an Easter dinner at my cousins - nothing really too healthy offered.  Back on track tomorrow I guess......  Did anyone else workout?  We all have to tomorrow for sure after the "food fest" weekend!  Get your workout in tomorrow!  Don't make me get pushy......... :) Melanie: How is the arm doing? I hope it's getting better.  What do you do for lymphadema - just rest it?  I can't imagine how frustrating this is for you.  Rennasus: How is the healing going?  Getting better?  (I hope so!) SueBee:  About the TE hurting a little..keep strecthing.  It really helped me - especially stretches in the supine (on the back) position.  That loosened me up quickly and I now do it every time I workout just to keep things loose.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2011 07:01PM mdg wrote: Hey gals!  How did everyone do today?  I actually ran again...it felt good!  I only did 2 miles but it was nice to do something different.  I did do my weights again today.  I did start doing some shoulder exercises -  I have not been doing much upper body because of the annoying port in my arm but these exercises did not hurt.  I was actually tired in the shoulders with only lifting 5 lb weights!! I have lost so much strength since before my surgery.  Oh well....it will come back if I work at it slowly.  I was back on the healthier eating today.  I am addicted to organic almond butter on organic 7 grain bread.   I wolfed down a sandwich in 30 seconds at lunch.....so good!  I have read almonds are better for you than peanut butter so I gave up peanut butter (which I love!!!) so I am glad the almond butter is hitting the spot!  Let me know what you all did today.  Annie had her last chemo today!  Hurray!!!! Supersally:  I think the weekend got all of us off track...we are human.  As long as we get back on the healthy track we are good!  I am impressed that I only ate one tiny piece of candy while I was filling all the eggs for my son.  I did eat chocolate cake on Easter....damn it was good!  It was a small sliver piece.....sooooo wickedly good though!  Melanie:  OK - NO working out for you!  You will get me giving you the "sit on your butt" lecture!!!! You have to rest now...really.  I know emotionally it's hard, but the benefits of taking time off and getting your arm better will be better in the long run.  As far as food for nausea...I have not had any nausea I just crave carbs like crazy in the days following chemo.  I have gained 5 lbs since starting chemo! (I did lose 18 lbs before starting chemo though).  I love lowfat banana muffins, toast, pasta, english muffins and such in the days following chemo.  Wheat crackers and pretzels too.  Mashed potatoes may be bland enough.  I also cook orzo or pastina in chicken broth and sprinkle a little fresh parmigiano reggiano cheese on it...yum!  I hope your chemo goes OK this time around girl.....rest if you need it!  Keep us posted when you can. Redsky:  Keep doing those exercises/stretches.  It seemed like once I took a break after my 4th fill I was able to really stretch things out a lot more.  I don't even feel the tightness anymore even with my gargantuan boobs (510cc's).  You will get there.  You are doing great!  I forgot about the hardboiled eggs....eating them in the morning and on some salad.  I love them but forgot as I usually eat healthy muffins or fiber cereal in the morning.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2011 07:22PM mdg wrote: Hey gals!  It's the weekend....yea!  I did my workout today and it felt good.  I totally TIVO'ED the wedding since coverage here started at 4am.  I did wake up at about 4:15am for a bio break and thought....I could get up but my DH would kill me if I put the TV on now!  So I went back to bed and got up at 6:30am and got my son off to school, made breakfast and watched the whole coverage (forwarding through the commercials of course....love tivo!).  It was lovely.  Gosh....wouldn't it be nice if this marriage actually worked out?  It's hard to remain positive considering how many other royal marriages have crashed and burned (oh and for regular folks too these days!).  Oh well.....it was beautiful.  I actually finish chemo on Wed.  I never thought I would say that!  Can't believe it.  I mentioned to DH that it would be fun to head out of town for Memorial Day weekend - just the 3 of us and he said it sounded great!  I think we are planning on Chicago!  We love going there and have never taken our son.  I am so excited!  It's a little celebration for the 3 of us after my chemo!  Oh - my food blog is in progress.  I think it will be up this weekend!  I am finally getting the hang of the technical stuff on there...it's not perfect yet but it should be functional.  I have some brownies you will want to check out on there!  Melanie: I am so glad you are doing better.  That's great news!  I hope that arm continues to get better and better each day.  I love that you are doing the "biggest loser" at home!  That's great that your family is doing it with you!  I find it hard to do things with family and friends because they all seem to eat whatever....I just want to bring my own food when we go places......ugh!  It is too hard to eat right in the "real world" outside my kitchen!  I was also considering getting my body fat measured and setting some goals.  I don't have a lot of body fat, but I would like to have a way to measure any progress as I am introducing more weight training into my routine.  Where are the rest of our exercisers????  It's awfully quiet around here these days.......
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 4, 2011 07:15PM mdg wrote: Just checking in as my BFF is still here visiting.  I AM OFFICIALLY DONE WITH CHEMO!  I still have my hair too which is a bonus! Chemo went well - I was tired though and fell asleep during part of it with all the meds.  I could not eat much as my stomach was bothering me.  I ate a good dinner of Greek Garlic Lemon Chicken, Tatziki, spinach/artichoke squares and whole wheat pita breads. I will get the recipes posted on the blog..the spinach squares are on there already.  I hope you all worked out today for me!  I will double time it tomorrow...dragging my BFF with me and am going to make her work out hard.  I will write more when I have time.  Get movin' girls!!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 9, 2011 06:02PM mdg wrote: Hey gals!  I hit the gym - ran a mile (kicked my butt today...wanted to do 2 but couldn't make myself) then got on the elliptical for 50 min.  I wanted to do weights but had no energy for that.  I stretched good and got out of there.  I guess I will let myself off the hook since I am still in the last post chemo tired phase a bit.   I will hit the weights tomorrow or Wed for sure.  My DH is out of town for the week so it's just me and the little guy.  Tonight we made pizza...l did my healthy version for me (I will get it on the blog) and he did organic cheese and pepperoni.  Served it up with some fruit and we were all set.  Tomorrow I am doing Italian Chicken Tenders...I will post that for sure.  My son loves these, so they are kid friendly but I love them too!  Tomorrow I am going to try out the new bread maker....I want to make whole grain cinnamon bagels.  All the bagels in the stores are with white flour and contain soybean oil.  These better be good....I will let you know how it goes!  I figure if I make a bunch I can just freeze them.  Crossing fingers that they taste good!  SueBee:  I would hate to get near you on a bike...you would give me a run for my money!!!! Go girl!  You rock!  It's funny on the weight thing..>I lost 18 lbs since dx in Dec.  I gained back about 5lbs but I am smaller now from working out more.  I went shopping today and had to buy all new capri pants...I only have 2 pair that fit (and those have not fit me in 5 years!).  Everything is too big!  Oh well...I hit TJ Maxx and now that I am a small size they have lots of stuff that no one else can fit into! I got Hilfiger, The Limited and Izod capri's - each for only $14.99!  What a designer deal!  I also got more workout clothes for summer - shorter workout pants since it's hot.....so $170 later I got out of there with my new clothes!  I did also get 2 new shirts for work.....sooooo dreading going back to work in a few weeks. MelanieAnn:  I am so glad the new LE specialist is helping so much.  That's great that you have gotten back to baseline.  That is a step in the right direction for sure.  It seems like I have read that exercise helps prevent LE now in some of the new studies.  Who knows.....whatever you are doing, it's working though and that's great.  I hope you can get in some walks at least - the weather has been sooooo beautiful here. Anyway gals....hope you all had a healthy day!  Keep moving and working out!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 11, 2011 01:22PM mdg wrote: Well it was almost 80 here today and sunny!  I am enjoying the nice weather but my skin is so sensitive to the heat and sun from chemo...I get an itchy rash all over!  Ick!  So I am enjoying the weather in small doses.....This last chemo kicked my butt.  I am really drained of energy by the afternoon.  I hope that goes away soon.  I am really having anxiety about going back to work in 2 weeks.  I am dreading it.  I talked to my med onc PA today about work and the stress with it.  She suggested I take more xanax.......nice.  So now I have to medicate myself to go back to work.  Right now I only take it at night time so I an settle down and sleep.  She suggested I take it 3x a day to help with stress/anxiety.  I don't know how I feel about that.  I did manage to do the elliptical for 60 min today but boy did I move slow.....I just don't have it in me these past few days.  I am OK with whatever I can do exercise-wise but am not use to feeling drained.  DH is still out of town and doesn't get home until Friday night.  Things are nuts...he's interviewing for a new job.  We are most likely going to move out of state.   One job is actually overseas too......I am taking a deep breath.  I know this is all good for us - we can get out from our underwater house, I can quit my job and he can secure something with more longevity.  He is pretty stressed about it. I think he is worrying about me....I finally said "we have had to make much more difficult decisions in the past few months - we will get through this too - somehow it will all work out".  So for now our most likely move cities would be Kansas City or Amsterdam.  What a difference between the two......he has some other things in the works so who knows.  I am taking a deep breath...............sigh.   I did some more retail therapy today...I needed work clothes.  I bought 2 pairs of pants, 2 summer sweater sets, 2 professional dresses.  Now I need some new shoes and I should be set for a while.  I kept putting off getting clothes like I was not going back to work or something....nothing in the closet fits.  Tomorrow I will get some shoes.  Cha Ching! HAPPY BIRTHDAY SUPERSALLY!  I hope you are having a fabulous day!  I hope all heals up and it's not an infection.  I have been bruising horribly...I had over 20 bruises on my left thigh alone!  It is nuts!  Now that chemo is over hopefully that will stop.  My hemoglobin is a bit low so they hope it will go back up.  Are your blood levels OK right now?  Hopefully blood is good and that doesn't change.  Melanie:  It's great that you were able to get out and walk.  I am wiped out a bit from my final chemo.  Today it was like doing the elliptical in molasses or something....I felt like I could barely force myself to do it.  Oh well..hopefully my energy will come back soon.  OK on the 15 lbs.....that's a goal.  Just promise you will do it slow and steady?  You still need to be eating good through all this chemo to heal your body.  I know you can do it!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Dx 12/13/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 12/22/2010 Lumpectomy: Right Surgery 1/26/2011 Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Chemotherapy 3/2/2011 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 5/18/2011 Surgery 6/21/2011 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 12/9/2011 Reconstruction (left): Nipple reconstruction; Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 19, 2011 01:58PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies!  It's finally warming back up over here...the sun is out after it rained all night and most of the morning.  I hit the gym today...my legs are still feeling tired from the chemo - like I ran a marathon.  Hopefully that will pass soon.  My rash from the chemo is hopfully on it's way out!  Still using the topical cream to get rid of the itching.  I spent the afternoon baking healthy stuff...banana muffins and granola...all organic, whole grain and with honey - no sugar.  I am making an Italian bulgar wheat salad with grilled chicken tonight (artichokes, tomatoes, roasted red peppers, onions, basil and garbanzo beans tossed in balsamic dressing).  If it comes out good I will post the recipe.  The work dinner went OK.  It was kind of awkward for me at first but I seemed to relax a little into it.  I did tell my one female co-worker and friend when we went to the bathroom.  She said "yea, we have been speculating and wondering what was going on since you have been out so long"...they knew something was up.  She is going to keep my secret.  I could not tell everyone else...it is such a downer and I just couldn't bring myself to do it.  Oh well....I will just leave it alone for now. DH's job interviews are moving forward.  He is going to Kansas City next week for an interview.  The company in Amsterdam wants him to come there for an interview.  We are trying to get more information on the relocation package before he goes there to see if it would even work financially.  We are still hoping to hear he will move forward for the job in Austin - that's a great opportunity. Renn:  I am so sorry about your doc appt.  I am taking a deep breath for you!  Lord!  I too got 2 opinions and one said "no chemo" based on oncotype score of 17 (highest score in the low risk/no chemo range).  The other onc said I may benefit from chemo and recommended it (based on angiolymphatic invasion).  I had to make the decision myself...that was the hardest decision I had to make through this whole thing.  What type of chemo would the doc recommend?  I got the 4 rounds of Taxotere and Cytoxan.  PM if you want to discuss....Please let us know what happens and what you think you are going to do.  I am sure you are completely overwhelmed by this.  Hugs!  Glad you are heading to LV for a few days of R&R. Suebee:  Glad the choir event was fun.  Get in that zumba girl!  Keep shakin' it!  I have not even gone there with photos....I have taken some but have not posted anything or gone to the photo board in some time.  I am trying to get psyched up for my exchange next month.....ugh!  Maybe after that I can think about photos.  I am also jealous your BFF is going to Hawaii......oh how I love Maui - one of my favorite places ever!  Redsky:  Interval training is a great way to challenge yourself!   I do that on the treadmill sometimes....it will kick your butt!  If you keep that up you will notice a big difference in a few weeks for sure!  Glad the fill pain is settling down.  I too was worried about my skin but so far it has done OK.  I will most likely laser the scars after all the surgeries are done to fade the scars.  I am so sorry about your mom.  I am saying some prayers that she will do well with the chemo....hugs!  I can only try to imagine how you feel right now.......
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 06:19AM mdg wrote: Now you gals are making me think I should check the photo board and post photos....I will try next week.  I took photos at different fills and have not taken any at my ginormous 510cc fill yet.  I am shooting for a 450cc implant....or a little larger if the doc can do it.  My skin is OK but at the incision line there is some discoloring that fades out from the incision line.  I know I will get nipples there to cover some of it but I wonder how much of it will remain.  I am thinking about laser to fade the scars.  I will have to post photos and look at photos to see if others look the same.  My doc said my skin looks fine at 510cc's.  Today is gorgeous out!  Sun is shining!  It is going to be in the 70's.  We have a graduation party this afternoon and a get together with friends tonight.  No working out for me...the chemo has really hit my legs hard.  Last night my legs felt like I ran a marathon...thighs burning even while just sitting.  I was super tired. I kind of thought that would start going away....I wonder how long that takes to go away after chemo.....  Trying to be good on the food front tonight but it's so hard going out or to anyone elses house...no one else eats healthy.  I am bringing a large salad tonight - southwest chopped salad.  They are ordering pizza.....I try to avoid white flour because it's evil.  There is no where to order pizza with wheat crust around here that I can find.  I order the pizza with just veggies, sauce and a sprinkle of parmesan to avoid the cheese (I can't have the hormones) and it's good, but the white crust is also a big no no.....why can't anyone make wheat crust pizza anyway???  Just a vent....I can't help it as pizza use to be my FAVORITE food to eat......now I make it myself so I know it's healthy. Melanie:  I will post the bagel recipe next week.  The bagels were good but not enough cinnamon so I wanted to try another batch.  They were easy to make though and it was so nice to have a bagel again (have not had one in months due to the soybean oil in them).  They toasted up fine too.  Stay tuned. I am also going to post the Italian Bulgar Wheat Salad recipe.  It was a hit...DH liked it a lot.  I have to rely on him as my tastebuds are still a bit off.  I am also going to make more of the black bean brownies today (did anyone try those??).  My son loves them....I laugh as he stuffs it in is mouth knowing there are black beans in them - he he! Have a fab weekend ladies.  Be well!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 23, 2011 06:15PM mdg wrote: SueBee:  I am glad you are rockin' it in the shorts and new bathing suit!  Good for you!  All that Zumba is paying off girl!  Thanks for the sympathy on the monster in law....I had to see her this past weekend too - ick!  I count every minute I with her and can't wait to leave.  Hopefully at her BBQ I can avoid her.  We have some good friends that will be there so I will have other people to talk to so I can stay away from her.  I am going to bring my own cooler with snacks, drinks and dinner.   I really don't care what anyone thinks.  I am sick of going places and being served things I can't eat.  I am going to reserve my "splurging" for things I am looking forward to (like Chicago this weekend) and dinners out with DH - not on crappy food at MIL's!  Sorry the one job didn't work out but it's great news they had something else for you.  Congrats!  I hope DH gets some good job news soon too!  This is a big week for him! Melanie:  THe bread came out good (the first loaf I ever made!) but I need to add more basil and sundried tomatoes as I would like the flavor stronger.  I can't wait for DH to try it tomorrow!  I am so jealous of your fabulous garden...wow!  In my next house - that's it.  I am doing a veggie garden!  It's healthier and cheaper.  Glad you got to chekc out WHole Foods.  We have it here...love it but we call it "Whole Paycheck" since it's so expensive.  I can easily drop $200 on each visit if I am not careful. Thans for the MIL sympathy.  She is just a control freak and I don't let her control our lives so that's why she doesn't like me...everyone else lets her have her way.  I don't (because she tries to do it at my house - completely in appropriate).  Oh well.  I limit my time with her.  I don't have a buttermilk pancake recipe yet.  I didn't get to them today.  I was going to scout the internet for ideas and then do my own.  I will let you know when I get to it.  As far as buttermilk - I bought organic nonfat powdered buttermilk at Whole Foods a few weeks ago.  I figured that way I would not buy the real stuff and not use it all.  If I had your D boobs I would have loved my boobs...my little one's didn't cut it.  Now I think I am hot stuff with the C's!  I will let you know how the port goes....I am surprisingly calm (maybe that's because I already went through a BLMX and chemo....this is nothing, right?).  I am bummed that they did not schedule me first thing in the morning....I go at 10:30am which means they won't even do the procedure until 12:30pm and I can't eat anything tomorrow morning.   I am going to have a nice snack right now so I am not soooo hungry in the am.  I hate not eating breakfast!  I will be cranky for sure! Supersally: Sorry the last chemo kicked your butt.  Me too on the last one.  My legs are still feeling like I have run a marathon!  It's worse now than it was during chemo.  I hope you had some quality time with your mom while she was there.  Let us know how your follow up appts go tomorrow.  I have my med onc appt this week to discuss tamoxifen and follow up.  Do you have any fun plans for Memorial Day to celebrate being done with chemo?  We are doing Chicago!  Can't wait.  As far as the food....I am going to try to stick to my plan as much as possible.  I would rather save my splurging for fun things and really GOOD food..not MIL's junk food.  At this point I am going to bring my own food.  Don't care what anyone thinks.....  I hope your energy level comes back up before the weekend!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 23, 2011 06:34PM mdg wrote: Ok - strange trivia for you all!  I wanted to know how much my new boobs weigh (yes, I still have too much time on my hands as I don't go back to work until next week!).  At 510 cc's they each weigh 17.245 ounces.  Just thought you would like to know (I gained a few pounds but still swimming in my clothes...I figured since I had "boob greed" they had to weigh a lot...I wanted to know how much!). So of the 4-5 lbs I gained back after my BLMX, over 2 lbs are in my boobs.  FYI.  I am going to stop now.......not write any more.  :)
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 11:54AM mdg wrote: Thanks Annie. My doc said nothing....in fact I went to the med onc in my workout clothes this morning and told her I was headed to the gym after my appt.  She said I was slightly anemic but did not say anything about not working out.  I have had the chemo legs...I did not mention that to her.  I do listen to my body when I am there and do whatever pace I can that day but try to complete my 60 min.  I did not do any weights today because I was not up to it......I will ask her what she thinks.  I certainly don't want to do damage but I don't want to skip my workouts either.  Next week will be interesting...I go back to work.  I wonder how much energy I will have for that....
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 02:09PM mdg wrote: Hey Gals!  I am back from our Chicago trip.  We had a good time other than the nasty weather (horrible rain and thunderstorms - it really came down a ton most of the weekend!!!).  We were able to enjoy some good quality family time.  We did the Children's Museum, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and a bit of shopping.  We wanted to do more outside but weather did not cooperate...I guess we will save those things for our next visit - or if we end up moving there (DH has to go there now for a face to face interview too!).  I tried to eat good....packed some breakfast and snack foods for myself and did good with that.  I did split a chocolate cupcake with DH on Sat night and had a wicked piece of carrot cake last night (but I did eat a vegetarian healthy entree)...oh I had a glass of champagne at dinner to celebrate being done with chemo on our special family trip while we overlooked the Chicago River at a very upscale chophouse!  (You gotta live a little!!!).  I am now trying to mentally get prepared for going back to work tomorrow (Yuck!).  DH and I talked about it...we know it's temporary until he gets the right job offer.  His interview in KC got cancelled due to tornadoes last week - he goes there this Friday instead.  He also has to schedule the interview in Chicago - hopefully for early next week.  We will see what happens.  Amsterdam is still in the mix too.  I can't wait to exercise tomorrow....I need a real workout after the eating all weekend! Redsky:  How is your mom doing?  Did she start chemo or is that starting this week?  Let us know an update....saying a prayer.  GLad you got some new PT exercises.  I really did not do any exercises for my chest muscles...my exercises were for shoulders and upper back to strengthen things and keep range of motion along with stretches for shoulders and chest.  I hope the new things you are doing help you and feel OK.  Suebee:  You must take the family to Chicago when you can.  There are so many fun things to do there and the drive it not bad.  We got a decent hotel deal - Marriott Residence Inn Miracle Mile - they had a small kitchen and separate bedroom and the rate included Shedd Aquarium tickets.  The room was nice too - oh and it included breakfast in the rate too! (I packed my own breakfast by DH and my son enjoyed the included breakfast!).  I am glad you went to Zumba on Sat....good for you!  What is your Zumba schedule for this week?  I need to start doing more abs - I have not done much because I was kind of worried it would bother the alloderm if I did upper abs.  I guess I could do lower ones...I have done them a few times in the past month but not consistant.  You have inspired me to do abs regularly again.  I will most likely be cursing you later this week when I am sore! (LOL!).  I hope this week to get on the photo thread and see how you girls look and post my photos.  With starting work this week...who knows if that will happen or not.  I am glad you found some bras that work..who knew shopping for bras and shirts would be so difficult?  I tried on 10 shirts before packing for the weekend before Icould find one in my closet that best hid the ugly TE's!  Can't wait until they are gone!  I hope that TE pain is gone...what a bummer!  I noticed when I was filling I had much more pain and discomfort with TE's.  I felt pressure in my ribs under them too and it even bothered me when I was eating food.  Not that fills are done, the pressure and pain is all gone...hope it's the same for you! Renn:  What's the latest on the incision?  Please tell me it is getting better!!!  Gosh what a pain that thing has been.  I hope so badly it is improving so you can move on with it already.  I know you must be frustrated.......sending "healing vibes" and prayers your way!!!  I hope you got some good R&R on your beach trip. Rehm46:  My cancer center gave me a booklet of post op exercises and stretches I could start after surgery.  I would ask your PT - give them a call and see if they can provide something.  If not, you can PM me your email address and I can email you the booklet I have (I scanned it) and you could show it to your PS and see if they would allow you do to them.  I don't want to recommend anything for anyone to do as I am not a PT or surgeon.  If your doc is cool with you doing them than it may help.  As far as getting back into exercise...my PS said lesiure walking was OK for the first month and no gym until 4 weeks post op.  I was not allowed to even drive for 3 weeks post op.  I started back at the gym on the elliptical with no arms at 4 weeks post op.  I have not done much upper body other than PT exercises as I got a port in my arm for chemo.  I got the port out last week so in the next week plan to do more upper body.  I am not sure how the docs would feel about getting back into yoga quickly as you do use a lot of upper body in yoga.  I bet my PS would have told me to avoid it for a while (he's super conservative).  I would ask and see what your doc says.  I would also ask to work with a physical therapist post OP if you can..a lot of us here did and it has helped a lot.  Feel free to ask questions...we are happy to help.  We have all been there.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2011 07:13PM mdg wrote: What a busy day!  This work thing is getting in my way of getting things done!  I worked most of the day and worked through lunch so I could get done and hit the gym.  I have gone twice this week in the late afternoon when the teenagers go....well that does wonders for your ego.  I can say that after I had jealous thoughts over their long/thick hair and perky/natural boobs, I then noticed some with a muffin top.  I don't have one of those so I felt OK with my cold cap chemo hair, coconut boobs and NO muffin top at age 45!  LOL!  I also am doing a challenge for the next few weeks.....I normally do the elliptical for an hour and then do weights and stretch.  I don't have that kind of time anymore because of work so I challenged myself to burn the same amount of calories in less time.  Today I did it in 51 minutes!  Boy did I push it!  I quickly stretched and was out of the gym in an hour.  So I was wondering if anyone else is up for a challenge on their workout?  Anyone up for taking it up a notch too?  I can only do this for the next few weeks before surgery.  Anyone??  Let me know.  Tomorrow my BFF is coming with her two boys for a weekend visit!  I am soooo excited!  It will be fun for sure. Red Sky:  I have a bikini from before that fits and covers most of my ugly coconuts/scars OK.  I took the padding out of it (lord I don't need that anymore with these coconuts!) and it works OK for now.  It has the triangle type top but not with thin string ties...it is thicker so the triangle ends tie behind my neck (the triangle part is all one piece that goes right into a thick strap that ties behind the head).  It also has a thicker strap (about 1 inch thick) that goes under the triangles and goes around the torso that ties in the back - again it is thicker instead of the bikini's with the thin string like ties.  Do you know what I mean?  I don't have a photo...it's an old bathing suit I got a long time ago from The Loft.  Annie;  I thought shingles were more like blisters...I will look into that in case.  I am desperate....trying everything right now to get rid of this shit!  I am sorry you have to go back to work too...it stinks!  It gets in the way of my workouts!!!! Glad you had good energy to workout and have a good day!  Let me know how the hair coloring went...I am dying to try it too but scared..... Melanie:  I was thinking you deserted us!  Glad you are back and got to head out of town for a few days.  That must have been nice despite the heat.  Sorry about your arm...I know how frustrating that is for you.  I am glad it went back down and I am really glad you are trying another PT.  Hopefully they can help you....and fix that arm! Suebee:  I think you should give us the hiring manager's address and we can all write and tell her how wonderful you are and she should hire you!!!! I hope so badly this works out.  Just getting your foot in the door will be a good start.  You never know what happens from there once you are in, right?  So you are showing off your "knockers" in your FB page?  Too funny!  I have not changed my FP pic in a while...it still has my old small boobs in the photo.  I think post OP we all need new FP pics with our new bodies.  You could add a thought down like "check out my new boobs"....LOL!  I am at my witts end with the dang rash....it was a bit better today on the steroids.  I will stay on them for a week because I just need relief............I think it's hilarious you asked your BFF to go with you to get a nipple.  If we move I may be asking someone to take me to get my nipples (if I have to fly back here to see my PS and need someone to go with me).  That may be an awkward phone call too "so I am coming in town, can I stay with you for a few days and can you take me to get some nipples?".  LOL!  My friend Deb would do it in a heartbeat and crack up out of control.   Too funny!  Oh and I have my pre-OP appt next week even though my surgery isn't for a few weeks. Renn: I did not start the T yet as my med onc office forgot to call in the Rx last week.  I just picked it up today. I was going to take it tonight but since I am on so much crap for the rash I am waiting until DH gets home tomorrow night to take it in case of any reaction to that.  DH is out of town tonight.  He has a job interview in Kansas City tomorrow.....yikes!  I can't imagine having my skin more dry with all of this going on.....now I am scared to take the T!!!  Thanks for the job sympathy.  It is overwhelming at this point because I just don't even care at all.....I feel like I am decieving my boss (I got a new boss when I was out...he's a dear friend of mine that I have worked with for over 4 years - a super nice guy that I respect) because I don't want to be here and don't plan to be here.....I have to do what is best for me and my family.  I know he will get that but I hate my attitude because I am a super hones person and feel like no one would want someone with this attitude working for them.  How is the incision today????  Need an update please! Supersally:  Well I think we will pass the "boob greed" crown to you girl!  Over 550 cc's???? Wow!  Good for you!  I guess if you are taller it would be less noticeable than on my 5 foot 2 1/2 inch tall body!  You do officially wear the crown in this group unless Renn pulls it out after the incision heals up!  Oh - Melanie is a double D....you may have a rival!  LOL!  I thought women only got cankles from being pregnant....what a bummer. I am thinking about one of us actually having ALL of the symptoms we have experienced at once....incision issue, lymphadema, no hair, rash, cankles/swelling, etc.....Ugh!  How awful would that be??? BC stinks for sure!  As far as swimming.....with my rash I am afraid to get near a pool. I promised I would take my son to the pool this weekend (it just opened last week) so now I am nervous my skin will go nuts.  As far as arms I am only doing the elliptical and some shoulder exercises with lighter weights.  My arms look a little better than a few months ago.  My PS would probably frown...he's super conservative!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2011 04:35AM mdg wrote: Renn- so no exercise is just fine.  YOu can continue helping your body be healthy with super good food, vitamins and lots of water.  You can also do some relaxation exercises or meditation....with all the crap we have had to deal with emotionally that may also really help (I should be doing that too I am sure!).  So don't feel bad about not doing strenuous stuff.....you have other things you can do that will help you stay healthy.   I am hoping that by the time you get that steri strip off it's all healed up!  I had my biopsy on Dece 8th and got my difinitive diagnosis the following week.  I knew from Dec 8th though...I just knew.   That is the day that changed everything for me.  I don't want to think about celebrating that at all next year.  I think Xmas will be hard and emotional for me next year as I had a lumpectomy on 12/23 and did not tell my family.  My family knew nothing of my dx until after the New Year.  Xmas was super hard for me keeping this to myself for over a month.  Next year it will bring up all those feelings again I am sure and we may not be living here by then so family may not be with us either.  Maybe we should just go out of town on a vacation at Xmas this year to not have me relive that again..... Resky: I obviously don't have those type of TE's.  One of mine migrated....I am lopsided....only for 2 more weeks though! Well, I am off to get on my teleconference for work and I do see my holistic MD today for a chemo follow up and complete blood panel I am sure (last time he drew 8 vials of blood!!!!) so I am worrying about my veins!  I wil see what he says I should be taking for vitamins/supplements.  I will teach my step class tonight after work - I miss working out in the mornings now that I am back to work (darn work getting in my way!).  Have a good day.  Be healthy!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2011 01:34PM mdg wrote: Renn: I am glad you were very light on the workout and have no issues.  I posted the tomato recipe with a bruschetta you will love......DH says it's his new favorite.  It is cold here too....rain came in.  The other day it was 96...now only 60 and rainy.  Strange weather. Shannon:  Workouts are good for the mind and body....hopefully it cleared your head.  It helps me with crankiness too!  Suebee:  Can't believe Monday is the day....you can help me know what to expect since I am the next week and getting anxious.  You and I will be on the no exercise, eat healthy and medidate or something plan for a month...boo!  I am glad you will be going through that with me.....I am going to go crazy with NO exercise for a month!  If we don't chat over the weekend.....a BIG hug and good luck girl!  I am sure everything will go perfect!  Can't wait to hear about your new "girl"!!! I did not workout today...work got in the way but I have a class to teach tomorrow so I will still get in my 5 days this week.  Then I have a BBQ at MIL's house....should I take xanax first?? LOL!  I figured sedation would help me cope with Dh's uncaring family.  We have agreed to drive separately so I can leave it I want (I am so happy DH said this...maybe he is starting to get it). The only good news is we have some really good friends that will also be there and I love hanging out with them.  If I can hang with them and MIL stays away it may be OK.  We shall see.  I am having a glass of wine with friends tonight......we are going to their house and the wine always flows freely there so I am having a glass.  A toast to Sue Bee!   May she have a beautiful foob on Monday!!  Cheers!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 01:15PM mdg wrote: Renn;  That's the best part about the wine...getting tipsy.  I hope Tammy doesn't take that from us too!  Lord that's the time I feel my best...tipsy!  Oh and a big "AMEN" on the xanax....it's my best friend!  Could not and would not sleep without it.  Even with it I am lucky to get 6 hours of sleep a night.  I often wonder how it's possible to sleep for only 5-6 hours a night for 6 months....I slept more when my son was a newborn....darn BC!  Taking my sleep too!  Boobs, hair, eyebrows, sleep, and now potentially my wine buzz....  I will let you know next month if your theory is true about tammy and wine. My PS made me put tammy away until after surgery.  I had only been on it a week or so.....will let you know after my surgery when I can start drinking again.  That would be wrong.....taking away the buzz.  WHat a "buzz-kill" literally!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2011 04:09AM mdg wrote: Red:  I am sorry about you and DH.  THe stress gets to them and men typically don't do a good job of expressing how they feel and how frustrated they are with things.  Try talking to him and at least express how you feel so you can get that out.  Maybe part of what you say will sink in.....  I feel like my DH doesn't get it sometimes and it makes me feel lonely...BC is a lonely disease.  I hope things turn around.  I am glad the PT was able to help you understand what is causing the pain and giving you some solutions.  Hugs!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 03:03PM mdg wrote: Suebee:  Love the pic...hilarious!  Heck with all the whipped cream I could easily cover my ugly coconuts and no one would know I don't have the real things yet!  Melanie;  That's so cool about the photo!  You will be an inspiration to so many woman facing this.  You are gorgeous with a great smile!  I am so glad you are doing something fun for your birthday.....enjoy!  So glad you got an appt.....did you have to make your inner Cancer Bitch come out or did you accomplish that without her showing what she's all about??? He he! I decided I am not cooking tonight....we are going to Chipotle..yes kind of fast foodish, but hormone free with organic ingredients......my new favorite place.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 06:36PM mdg wrote: I guess I freak out on the food so much because I too can't believe I got BC.  I have been into fitness since I went to college and gained the Freshman 15......before college I was an athlete (competitive figure skater).  I have taught aerobics since 1986 and have a degree in Health Education.  I guess I can blame it on birth control, wine, having my son late at almost 41, not breastfeeding....I don't know how the heck I got this.  All I know is I have NO control over any of this...the only things I can control are diet, exercise and taking tamoxifen.   I was never a bad eater...heck, my kid has never had fast food (like Mc Donalds, Burger King, etc...).  The other day I told someone that and they could not believe my son has not had it yet since he is almost 5.  I simply said "he doesn't have it because we just don't eat there".  I have always cooked fairly low fat (other than my traditional Italian cooking).  I hardly ever even kept desserts in the house other than when guests were coming over or having leftovers from entertaining.  DH had high cholesterol so we only ate very lean meats.....I will never know how the heck I got this stupid disease......that's why I freak out.   It's not like I was driving thru every day, drinking a fifth of vodka and smoking or something..... Suebee:  If you knock on your boob, does it knock back?  Ha ha!  I can compare notes on this next week and see if my boobs are hollow.  Have you tried to move them by contracting your pec's?  My friend that had a BLMX with reconstruction showed me how she makes hers move...it was hilarious!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2011 04:52AM mdg wrote: Shannon.....what are we going to do with you?  Were you really out partying all night and trying to cover it up????  I like the bike analogy.  Somehow now that you were talking about cake I have the image of the Katie Perry video for California Girls with the ginormous cupcake boobs....have you seen it?  Google it if not...you will laugh.  So I am off to the gym for my daily workout before work.  Glad it's Friday.  I have so much work to do today so I hope I am productive!  I am going to be home working in my office all day so I am going to make more of those slow roasted tomatoes...Renn, did you try them yet?  Oh I love them.  I am addicted to them.  Last night I made some Italian Chicken Tenders with tomato dipping sauce.  My son had three helpings.....I have hardly been cooking now that I am back to work....just don't have the energy when time is so limited.  DH had a good interview with Seattle last night...he's super excited about this job.  Lord help me....that is one heck of a move from Detroit to Seattle.  We will see what happens.  What are you all doing for Father's Day?  We are getting together with friends at their house for a BBQ.  They have a pool so DH will be swimming with DS while I hide inside or in the shade....boo!  I think I will get DS some good steak or seafood for grilling that day....something special.  I have to come up with a good salad to make.....maybe a spinach and sundried tomato salad with goat cheese and pine nuts...something super tasty.  Anyone cooking anything good these days?  I have to get some food ready as I have surgery next week and I don't want DH to not have easy food.  Plus I won't be able to drive to the grocery store for a few weeks and I won't be able to lift anything over 5 lbs for a month...ugh!  No exercise either....it's going to be a long 4 weeks.  I will be going crazy. Suebee:  You have still not heard on the job?  Poop!  They don't know what they are missing.  Oh and I decided that since we are not that far apart we need to get together sometime.  I would imagine that before I move I will probably try to head to Cincinnati to visit my BFF and I may have to meet up with you on the way!   Wouldn't that be cool?  You are in Dayton, right?  It's on my way from Detroit..... :) I so wish we were all not so spread out...it would be nice to have a good bottle of wine and healthy appetizers with you gals!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2011 06:56PM mdg wrote: OMG...I am laughing outloud and DH is wondering what the heck is so funny!  Shannon - you crack me up girl!   Yes..he must know SueBee's zumba guy.  I feel left out...no one has been checking out my rack...damn...my boobs must be too small!  Somebody better check my new one's out for sure!  LOL!  I guess I should get some shirts with tiny print on them so men will want to read my shirt... :)  Supersally:  Thank you for working out...now I am happy!  You will have to keep working out hard in the next 4 weeks as I will be cracking the whip as I can't workout so I will be on you gals and bugging you instead!  So you must give us an update on how long the hair is on your head.....we are all waiting with anticipation to find out!  While you are measuring the hair length, I am counting the hairs that fall out.  My shedding just lightened up a bit...I am also measuring the roots on my hair...I have almost 2 inches of roots that I can't color until this shedding stops......we all have strange things to occupy our time right now.....oh and the obsession with foobs too.....boy are we a barrel of fun.  Oh and as I mentioned on the chemo lounge thread, I shaved my legs this week...woo hoo!  That's a biggy....I can totally see SueBee pulling off the sexy librarian look....that's why she took that job now that she has her new boobs!!! LOL!  Well Shannon...I will be stuck in the house so we can chat back and forth all day. I will long for the day I can run errands again....and drive...sigh............  I went to the grocery store today and stocked up...you would think I have 12 kids with what I bought but I figured I can't drive for a few weeks and just wanted to save DH from tons of trips to the store.  Oh and I love the "no nipples" comment...you are too funny girl!  Renn: Thanks for the good thoughts.  I will post tomorrow..you know me...I can't stay away from you girls.  If my message is messed up you will know I am on pain meds...or typing on my phone instead of my laptop.  I have to see Bridesmaids.....maybe my other cousin will take me (DH will say "that's a chick flick".....) now that she is off from schools (she's a teacher...).  I am going to ask her :) Suebee:  I am here!  I have been busy today but I am here for my last messages to you gals!  Thanks for the cheer...now I am picturing you jumping up and down saying the cheer with your boobs shaking everywhere!  LOL!  Well I am ready for surgery.  We have to leave here at 5:15am (yikes) and be there at 6:30am.  My surgery is suppose to start at 8:30am and they said it would be a few hours long (I think including OR prep time and stuff...).  My PS does have to completely re-do the alloderm on my L side as it is an inch lower than righty....I hope it all gets corrected.  That is one of my fears...being this lopsided forever.  I am ready.  I am not as nervous as I was for BLMX at all...I just want this crap over with at this point.  I am going to stay up and watch TV and pop a xanax later.  I hope to rest tomorrow afternoon.  I guess I am as ready as it gets....I will try to post an update tomorrow.  Thanks for all the support ladies..... :)  I can feel the love.....
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2011 03:05PM mdg wrote: Suebee: I keep pacing around the kitchen while DH cooks. I feel helpless. ...I usually cook dinner. He is grilling chicken and aspargus and making a good salad. I could get spoiled too. Welcome back Red!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2011 09:53AM mdg wrote: Ok..am I 1000????  I didn't look to see how many we have....so cool.  I understand the whole friend thing...when people don't call it makes me feel like they don't think what I am going through is a big deal.  I guess it just makes what we are going through that much more lonely.   I completely understand SueBee.  My BFF has been great.  I do wish she would call a bit more, but she is a state away and she has 2 kids, works and they are totally rennovating a house right now (she is constantly shopping for items for the construction and working with the builder). So I get it....it doesn't bother me too much.  I got more ignored by my family.  Although, my brother called the day before surgery and the day after surgery...shocking.  My mom came over yesterday and brought me some beautiful flowers.  My sister called each day but she's super busy this week.  Anyone have a skin burn from the tape during surgery?  It looks like a sunburn in the shape of exactly where the tape was.  It is red and raised up a bit and it's super itchy and feels like a sunburn.  Ouch!  I don't know what  to put on it....ideas?  I just posted on another board hoping someone can tell me what to do before I can call the PS office tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2011 05:20AM mdg wrote: Good morning...I so wish I could do my normal day and just head to the gym but that ain't gonna happen.  You all better workout for me today!  I am rested...slept Ok without pain meds which was nice.  I did get back on my usual xanax routine.  DH and I made spaghetti pie for dinner last night and it was tasty.  I will post the recipe today since I have so much free time on my hands so check it out.  It's kid friendly too.  I usually make two and freeze one for another time..it freezes well.  So my son is at his day camp and my DH is at work.  I am just chillin.....I am super stressed again about the move thing.  DH got a call last night (yes last night) with a job offer in Chicago.  I am so sick of worrying about finances.....we want to go to 1 income and have me quit my job but the problem is he keeps getting job offers that are not right financially or in a higher COL area.  I just feel like I should just go back to work doing what I currently do once we move and DH says "no".  I can't make money fall from the sky......I hate worrying about money issues with all of this.  If I just work it solves the financial issue.  I finally told DH I could not talk about it anymore last night that I was just emotionally spent.  I hate all of the changes that come to your life because of BC.  I feel like it has changed everything!   I just want my life back!!!!  I also feel like I am ruining my whole family's life because of my BC. I keep finding myself saying to DH "you know, you don't have to stay with me and live this life...you have a choice".  That's horrible!  I just feel like I am ruining his life..and my son's life because I am sick.  I know we have to talk about this job thing this week but I just don't have answers.  I don't know what we should do.  I think we would have just taken the job in Kansas if they had made a good offer but I guess that would have been to easy.  OK - I am done venting right now....I keep saying "stay calm.....breath......relax.....".  I think I will go for a short, leisure type walk later today.  I am trying to keep stress at bay but it seems to be more like I am avoiding dealing with these difficult decisions we have to make. SueBee:  I am sorry your BFF is letting you down.  I have been let down so much by family that I understand.   I guess this is one more great little treat that comes along with the BC diagnosis that no one told us about.  As sad and hurt as I am, I am trying to let it go.  I have to.  I can will someone to change or act differently all I want, but that does not mean they will change or act differently and then all that come out of it is me being disappointed AGAIN.  It's the same horrible cycle over and over again.  I am beginning to feel like I am setting myself again by expecting something they are not capable of.  I guess the soon we can both expect nothing then the disappointment will go away.  I know how lonely BC can be so having people be "with us" in this means so much but some people just don't get it and never will.....We are all here though.  We always respond and always ask about your foobs!  I am done on my soapbox right now....So hamburger bun hu?  I have not experienced that yet......I can't tell what is going on with them.  I will let you know how things look in the next week or so.  DH is obsessed with drop and fluff...he got it all mixed up and told my sister yesterday they were going to fall and poof - LOL!  I think he thinks they are going to turn into DD's or something by his use of the word "poof"...he will be sadly disappointed.  I did let him touch them to see how soft they were....I am sure that will only get him chasing me more now that I did that....what was I thinking??? Renn:  There is a thread about tape and non allergic tapes.  I started to read it but I needed solutions, not tape suggestions.  It may be helpful to you though.  My BFF is a nurse for a breast surgeon and she told me to use triple antibiotic creme on it.  I put some on yesterday..I hope it helps.  I actually have some blisters too from the tape!  Gross!  It is supper itchy too....like I really want more itching after all my rash issues!  I too had the whole BC avoidance thing.  Don't they realize we can see the two ton PINK elephant in the room????  Good lord...people are so dumb at times.  Why can't they say things like "I have been thinking about you and don't really know what to say....I hope you are well".  That would be better than nothing at all!  I guess it just makes us feel like people don't care or don't understand the magnitude of what we have gone through and have to continue living with for the rest of our lives.......we all need some serious counseling about the people issues after all of this.......I am glad I am not alone with these feelings though, but am sorry you have to go through it.  Annie: I am glad you are taking time off..no need to have the added stress of work since we already have enough stress with all the BC crap.  It is the time to take care of yourself.......really!  You sound so busy.....I am tired listening to you girl! Melanie:  How was your weekend?  Sounds fun with all the visitors.  LOL at the wig thing!  I can see you getting some super fun wigs....maybe you should get a hot pink Lady GaGa wig to wear to church next week!  That would get people talking!  I hope you are well.  How is the skin with rads?  I heard it burns over time...I hope it doesn't hurt too much.  Hey Redsky:  Hope you are well.  How is the chest pain?  Better I hope.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 12:35PM mdg wrote: OK....Yes I am bored.  I rigged up the camera to take a not so flattering photo of myself with the new foobs and my hair in tact.  Here you go......  So this is me with no hair color job since February, no hair styling products really, frizzy/wavy hair instead of blow dried striaght and actually styled in some capacity.  The boobs are in view though.....no bra on either.  Now I need to figure out photos on the picture forum this week!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2011 04:25AM mdg wrote: Julie:  On the whole weeping thing...you are not alone girl.  I had another mini meltdown last night before bed.  Poor DH...he just wanted to go to sleep and I was all teary and upset.  I think everything feels very overwhelming right now...I feel like nothing is the same as it use to be - my body, my head, we are moving and leaving our home, all the fears in my head that will never go away...etc.....  I just feel at times that I need a vacation from my life!  I am sorry  to hear about your job situation and your DH.  I have been laid off before and it stinks!  That is why my DH is looking for a new job....we see the writing on the wall at his current job and think the axe will fall in the next year or less.  We are trying to be proactive and look now but it's still hard to leave the home we have so many memories in and our family/friends - especially after all this BC crap.  As far as the TE's...have you been doing any stretching?  I can't remember if you have worked with at PT at all either...?  Those things really helped me a lot.  When I was going through fills, my chest did hurt a lot too.  It did get better with stretching. OH and most of all..SO GLAD the scans were good!  Great news! Red:  Xanax is an anti anxiety med.  It does not really make you sleepy, but it relaxes you.  I found it worked better for me than ambien or ativan....I have unfortunately tried them all!  I know you are getting anxious about surgery..but don't worry.  It was easier than MX for sure.  No drains either!   I am sure you will look great once done with this.  I do get to go see the dermatologist at 10am this morning...I am desperate right now...itch itch itch!  UGH! I have nothing going on today except the derm appt....ohhhh.  Tomorrow I am going to spend the day with my sister and her kids and Jayden.  We may go to the zoo or something...not sure.  DH will be in Seattle until Saturday...anyone else hate when their DH travels??  I do.  I will sleep like crap the next two nights for sure.  I never sleep when he's gone.  Oh well....it's only two days.  I did go for a 15 min walk last night. I am going to go again tonight - maybe longer.

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2011 04:54AM mdg wrote: Renn:  Thinking of you! Sending hugs and prayers.  I am glad you are moving forward even if it's not how you planned it to be.  I am going to remain optimistic that your doc will be able to get this going again soon and you will heal well next time.  :) Annie:  A glass of wine sounds delightful.......I so wish wine was not bad for me.  I could use a few glasses this week for sure! Julie:  I was given the card after surgery...I didn't ask for it.  It looks just like a credit card...that is why I almost handed it to the check out guy at Costco.  I didn't get a card when I had my TE's but I did get a paper that had the information on it for the TE's.  I did get a booklet on my port when I had chemo too.  I guess I will have to start a whole file for all the paperwork from all the fake stuff in my body now..... Marie:  I have numbness on the back of my Left arm - the non-cancer side.  It seems like it is getting a bit better though now.....everything takes so much time and I know that is frustrating......we have all been there.  Things will get better.....Hugs! Shannon:  My son loves those meatballs...he asks for them a lot!  They would be good little appetizers too...now I want some!  Have fun on your trip.....I am sure it will be fun.  OK - off to start my crazy day.....have a good one ladies!  Gosh I can't wait to exercise again..I asked again at the PS office..they said "NO" until 4 weeks post OP.  I am going crazy with no exercise at this point.....
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2011 10:48AM mdg wrote: Annie:  I was really calm about it for the most part.....I guess between lumpectomy/SNB, BLMX, port placement and port out...I am use to it.  Scary hu that it doesn't phase me much anymore????  Don't worry....I was pretty sore the first few days.  I only took pain meds for 2-3 days then none.  I feel great now....so much so that I think I did too much yesterday and was a bit sore...I am trying to lay more low today.  It will be much easier after this surgery....really and you will have new boobies!  That will make you feel good...... Marie:  Maybe I should share some of your chocolate.....maybe that would take away tne whole moving stress....yikes!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2011 08:18PM mdg wrote: So much to catch up on with all of you gals.  Marie:  So glad path came back clear!  Something to celebrate for sure.  I am glad you are starting to feel better again....it's a process for sure.  It will get better though.  Oh and you can't come on here and confess to chocolate...it will make me crack the whip on you!  (LOL!!!)  Mel (I am shortening your name....)  I would be happy to have you visit me!   I love Chicago...I am in high planning mode to figure out where to live and when to move...joy!  Glad you are 1/3 done!  I can't wait to hear you say you are 1/2 done - which will be soon!   That stinks that the RO does not have more compassion for his patients!  I don't know why people that deal with cancer patients always act like what we are going through is "no big deal".  Well I guess it's no big deal when it ISN'T happeing to YOU!  Ugh!  I remember people saying "it's only hair".....I I wanted to respond with "well, it is down to the middle of my back and it would take 5 years to grow back and if it's only hair, why don't you shave yours off today".   They seriously need some sensitivity training!  I am glad you will see your extended family this weekend...that will be nice and they will be happy to see you looking so well I am sure.  Take care of yourself.....and rest.  I have heard rads can knock you out.  SueBee:  So glad you got to meet Firedancer....wish we all could meet sometime.  There is no ideal location for us is there???  I could see us all sitting around having a slumber party with wine and saying "here, look at my foob...is it too small???"  LOL!  I am sorry your wonderful trip is coming to an end.  Safe travels home! Renn:  Where do I begin...I was so sad reading your post.  I am sorry.  I don't even know what to say.  I do remember looking at my chest post OP for the first time and I only had 120 cc's in there.  It looked so odd....I was petrified to let my DH see me the first time when he had to clear my drains.  I cried when he saw me....I couldn't even look at him.  I know all of this is so emotional and I am sorry that you have to drag this out even longer.  I hope in a few days when you have all the anesthesia out of your system and are off the pain meds you will feel a bit better.  I am sure the stress plus all of that  has made things worse.  I had a meltdown on night two after my exchange....crying and just sick of all the shit that goes with BC.  You are entitled.  This is HARD.  No one else gets it except us going through it.  We have to live this every day and every moment - not like family and friends that just go on with their lives after they talk with us about this.  I so wish we were all closer....I would be over with chocolate, ice cream, People magazine and a chick flick for sure......Hang in there.  I hope you feel better tomorrow.  Supersally:  I can't imagine us actually graduating from BC.org and just doing FB.  That will take some time.  The planning is nuts...I had the contractor here today - we need to replace the kitchen floor before getting the house on the market. I also need them to paint the master bath.  Other than a few minor things we don't have to do anything to the house...it is in good shape (thank God) but then again we have already done so many improvements.  So glad we finally furnished and finshed the basement so someone else can enjoy it....I am sad to leave our home.  We bough this house when we first got married - it was our dream to build a life here.  Jayden was a baby here..he took his first steps here.  I will miss his room the most...I will think of memories sitting in his room holding him as a baby.  I will cry for sure....I love my house and am sad do leave.........  As far as a dog...we are going to rent for a while and then try to buy a fixer upper home so we can do everything the way WE want.  I never got my dream kitchen in this house (which is a sin considering how much DH and I LOVE to cook) because the home values dropped so much we could not justify putting the $$ into it.  My next house will have a kitchen I design....I am looking forward to that part.   I can't imagine having a dog in a rental unless it has a yard.  Right now we are considering a townhouse or an apartment so we can get a shorter term lease if we find a house to buy.  I had the other realtor here today....the house will be listed in the next week!  We will probably head to Chicago next weekend to check out housing.  Help!  I can't imagine discussing "thongs" with MIL.  I can't imagine how I will cope the first time she wants to come and visit us in Chicago....lord there won't be enough xanax for that.....can you imagine me hanging out with her while DH is at work????  That will stink for sure. How is your little Supersally?  I hope OK.  Aussies are adorable....smart like border collies too I bet.  Shannon:  Glad you are having fun.  I am feeling better that we know what is going on now but there is so much to do.  I am glad I am off from work right now.  I spend my days making phone calls to deal with all the relocation stuff.  I used some pillows but I found it was more comfortable for me to lay flat after the first night...it was more uncomfortable being propped up.

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2011 08:19PM - edited Jul 7, 2011 08:21PM by mdg Annie:  Glad you posted.  I hope your boobies are beautiful!  Sweet dreams!

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 01:10PM mdg wrote: Melanie  That stinks!  How frustrating...I would need more than a nap after that stupidity!  Have you searched on these message boards or posted a message?  These ladies know all....I am sure someone has dealt with this.  Try posting on the rads board and see what others with allergies have used.  I am glad you worked out!  OK but I have to say you said "flash" in the description of your workout/dance thing.  Please tell me you are not flashing any boob?  LOL!  That is where my mind goes these days.......foobs and boobs...oh and hair too! I feel like I need a nap today.....I did pick up my new car after working out.  It is super nice :)   I talked it over with DH and I think I am going to give notice at work before vacation and we can just take the new car on vacation with us.  It is causing me major stress because we move 2 days after getting back.  My boss would have to meet me to pick up stuff and and get my car....how do I explain why my house is empty and how I am moving that fast if I just found out we were moving?  I am going to just talk to him Monday and drop the bomb I think.   DH said he did not want me to be stressed out any more than I already am.....he is still trying to climb out of the dog house from the golf trip he took last week........ So on another note....we were taking cupcakes to DS's school this afternoon for his birthday party at preschool and DH was checking out my rack and staring at it.  I asked what he was looking at.....he said "just checkin' out your cupcakes".   Nice.........he is like a kid on xmas with the new foobs but he tells me I am selfish and keep them all to myself.   I am too stressed and exhausted to even think about any "action' these days....I guess he will be trying to add that to my master list of things to do..... I did workout today...felt good!  I hope I can go tomorrow early before all the party stuff starts.  I need it! Hope you are all well......
