Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2011 06:23PM mdg wrote: Hey Gals...I am finally sitting down.  Everything is packed.  DH still has a few more hours of driving home from Chicago so he won't be home til midnight I would bet.  I am officially ready for vacation.  I did get my pedi today and workout so there was some well needed "Me" time.  I will check in tomorrow from my phoe in the car since we will be driving for 10 hours. Julie:  HOpe your mom's Pet scan is ok.  I know the waiting sucks.  I had a bone scan yesterday and I get to wait for results.  My port incision was itchy for a while too...don't know why.  Foob incisions did not itch though. Sue:  Nix the old BFF...if you wait for her you will be waiting forever.  Just realize she will continue to let you down....sorry but it is the truth.  She operates on a different level than you and your expectations which stinks.  Also - my PS told me I need FG.  My righty looks hollow on top...Lefty looks good.  He said it was because they removed even more on the right side because it was the cancer side.  I wish I had time to post a photo...you can see it pretty clear when I lift my arms it gets worse.  Lefty looks real...no hollow area so FG may not be needed there. Melanie:  congrats on finishing rads and getting an ugly mug.  You can definately negotiate some time off..I have done that with every job.  I hope the interview goes well.  Oh and you wondered how I am doing it all with the move - simple answer.  It's like getting BC..you just do it whether you want to or not.  I am stressed completely.  Shannon:  Love the pizza dough story.  My son loves making pizza and thank god he is to young to compare the dough to boobs...... Red:  Hey girl!  HOpe you are feeling good. Ren:  Hope you had a good trip.

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2011 07:43PM mdg wrote: I have emerged from the boxes because they are all gone!  I got us completely moved in and there are no more boxes!  I feel so much better feeling settled.  We have been enjoying the pool the last few days....Jayden loves it.  Boy will he be bummed when it closes for the season.  I am going to hit the gym tomorrow....can't wait!  Then it's more school supply shopping.  Jayden has a meet and greet at his school so he can meet his kindergarten teacher and see his classroom.  He's so excited.  He starts school on Wednesday.  Julie..I have always wanted to make that lasagna with eggplant...now you have me inspired!  I have barely cooked in weeks with vacation and the move.  I can't wait to start cooking again.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2011 02:53PM mdg wrote: Julie, I am glad to hear you are done....that is great news!  The 1/2  triatholon next year would be amazing.  I always wished I could run but I always get injuries these days when I try so I gave up.  I always wanted to run a marathon.  Oh well....you can't do everything.  The burns from rads sound painful.  I hope they heal quickly.  I am sure it is a pain in the butt! I auditioned today at a hospital based fitness center to teach classes.  She wanted to meet with me and audition me because of my extensive experience but she has no open classes right now for me to teach.  I am bummed.  It looks like I won't be teaching for some time.  The other place I called over a week ago didn't even return my call so I guess they are not looking for instructors either.  I am bummed!  I miss my class and miss teaching....I am going to try the community center next and see if they have any need.  I was really hoping to start teaching right away so this is disappointing. Anyway - we are celebrating DH's birthday tonight so I have some black bean brownies in the oven..they smell good!  I am going to top that with Oberwies hormone free ice cream.  Gotta live on the edge a little, right?  I also got some grass fed rib eye steaks for grilling tonight.  Should be a good dinner....not neccessarily super healthy but good none the less :)

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 10:05AM mdg wrote: Jill...so glad you are on board!  I am glad you are doing well.  I am in regular clothes these days too eventhough it's a bit of a strange process to get them on over my head!  It does feel good to wear my regular stuff though.  You bring up a good point about regular stretching.  I too have started to stretch my lower body because of the amount of time I have spent sitting and laying down in the past few weeks is taking it's toll! THe muscles on the front of your hips will be tight and the other muscles on the back side can be a little overstretched from so much sitting.  It is a good idea to loosen those things up. If your docs are OK with it, some lower body stretching can also help work out some of the aches!  Jill - you will be looking fab by spring!  Have fun shopping.  Buy something cute!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 01:33PM - edited Feb 8, 2011 04:22PM by mdg I am glad we are getting a group of exercise gals.  My doc said no treadmill because he says when people get tired they hold on or use their arms on the handles....blah, blah, blah.  I think I know better but oh well....I am heading to the mall for indoor walking which is fine for now.  As far as the exercises, I got the booklet at my Breast Cancer Center.  I have been searching today and can't find anything on line that is similar with photos or anything.  Some of the exercises are easy. Before drains come out they had me doing: Chin Tucks, shoulder shrugs, squeeze shoulder blades together and shoulder rolls. After drains came out they have me doing other exercises.  Things to help stretch chest out a bit and contract upper back muscles.  They also have me doing things that work on being able to straighten arms out and raise them overhead while getting them closer to my ears when in overhead position with arms striaght.  Some of the others have me pushing away from the wall with my arms a little and pushing  the palms of my hands together.  They do also have 2 exercises that have 2 lb dumbells that work on the tricep/rear shoulder area as well as the overhead press with a 2 lb dumbell.   Maybe I should scan some things.....hmmm.  That may work but I don't want anyone doing anything their doc has not approved.  I also want people to remember that some of us had different types of surgery so the recommendations may not be the same.  If you were treated at a cancer center, can you ask if they have an exercise handout?  I will work on scanning things tomorrow and then maybe I can email what I have out.  I am shocked that more docs have not given something proactively as rehabilitation early on is usually a good thing (I had my knee put back together once and rehab got me back to normal in a few months so I know from experience...I also worked with athletes on post injury rehabilitation for sports teams in the past).  So I will work on getting things scanned.  If you want the information I have, send me a PM with your email address.  I will work on scanning things tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 07:15PM mdg wrote: Annie:  My Onc did not offer too much.  I had met with the nutritionist from The American Cancer Society and then did some additional reading of my own.  The ACS offers free nutrition consultations for cancer patients.  It may be worth scheduling one.  They said since studies were inconclusive on soy and it is not for sure proven to be good or bad, avoid it.  The asian studies also had patients that had been eating diets rich in soy for their whole life.  That is different than our lifestyle.  Some suggest that there is benefit in eating soy earlier in life (before teen years).  Since it is uncertain, I am avoiding it for now.   I know what you mean about the cookies and goodies people have dropped off.  I had to get rid of the rest of it!  It's out of the house because it's not good for me.  Freeze some cookies...you can pull out one here and there and you won't be tempted to eat them since they are sitting right there.  Just an idea.  I opt for hard candy when I crave sweets...they take longer to eat so one is enough.  That's great that you got on the elliptical!  Good job for today!

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2011 06:30PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies!  It looks like all of you are getting moving - that's great.  I was short on exercise today due to the evil chemo (boo!), but I can say chemo went great.  I did the cold caps to save my hair and I was more worried about tolerating that then the actual chemo.  The cold caps went way better than I expected!  It was not bad really at all....just a little for the first 1 1/2 hours.  THen it was totally easy.  I can do that 3 more times easily.  Since I was at the infusion for 8 hours due to the cold caps, no time to hit the gym.  I am doing my rehab exercises tonight and heading to the gym first thing in the morning!  Have a great evening!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2011 06:17PM mdg wrote: I am LMAO at you gals and your Zumba talk.  Now, go nice on the aerobics...I teach an advanced step class with all the crazy choreography and I could not get into Zumba at all. I tried a class and really didn't like it.  Oh and to make you all feel better, I must be the old one in the group...I am 45!!!! I have decided this year to be FABULOUS and 45 though.  So, it's only a number...really.   People always think I am in my late 30's so I must be doing something right.  I am going bikini shopping in a few weeks...they are all over the stores now!  Maybe my new breasts will distract anyone from noticing anything sagging in the thigh area - LOL! So I survived chemo yesterday and felt great today.  I did the elliptical for 40 minutes and my stretches.  I did PT today and she is doing more weight training with me - light weights, but none the less it feels good!  She re-evaluated my range of motion on both sides.  The Left side improved significantly, but the right side was 10 degrees less.  So I have decided to do all unilateral stretches so that I can stretch each side separately so maybe I can get the R side up to par.  It still improved but I was disappointed it was less than the other side.  I am hoping to workout through all this chemo crap.....I am gonna try my best to hit the gym 5 days per week!  I plan to teach a few classes in April.  I am setting some goals.....I have not tried aerobics yet at all....my PS is so strict!   I will give it some time and try in a week or so at home on my own.  Any other exercise updates?  Anyone noticing one side doing better than the other?  It's funny because my L side was way more sore due to SNB and I think I over compensated on that side and pushed harder...funny that's the better side now.  I also notice that my TE on the R is placed higher and hurts more than the one on the left in the pecs.  Is anyone else lop-sided like me? What other health topics would be helpful?  Are you chugging water daily?  I drank 20 glasses yesterday to flush the chemo.  Still trying to force down more tonight to get 20 glasses in....gotta hit the ladies room - again.  Go figure! I hope you are all doing well!  Post those updates daily....no slacking you young little ladies!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2011 12:13PM mdg wrote: Yes, I have a 4 year old.  He was almost 10 lbs (yes, I had a c-section...thank god!) so there is a little bit of skin but not bad.  I have that great olive, Italian skin and got no stretch marks so my belly isn't too bad.  My belly is flat pretty much.  I did not take it personal about the aerobics...just wanted to poke at you a little! :)  I did get up and workout this morning and go to the gym.  I did my circuit workout for the first time since my surgery.  I did it a little lighter obviously and a bit easier, but I did a lot of my old normal stuff.  My legs are gonna be sore!  Despite Wednesday's chemo, I feel good today too.  Nothing unusual yet.  I got another fill.  I am up to 410cc's.  Yikes!  I am hoping not to be too sore like my last fill. I did do lots of stretching this morning and plan to do it two more times today so my chest and back don't tighten up. How did you all do on exercise today????  I am 12 glasses of water in for the day so far - due to chemo I am drinking water like a fish and peeing a ton!  If you are starting chemo.....double up on the water. Let me know the daily check in!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 07:12PM mdg wrote: Supersally:  I will keep pushin ya girl...think summer and bathing suits with your new body!  The girls will look very nice in a new bathing suit!  I don't know what jaggery is...didn't notice it so I googled: Jaggery (also transliterated as jaggeree) is a traditional unrefined non-centrifugal whole cane sugar consumed in Asia, Africa, Latin America, and the Caribbean.[1] It is a concentrated product of cane juice without separation of the molasses and crystals, and can vary from golden brown to dark brown in color.[1] It contains up to 50% sucrose, up to 20% invert sugars, moisture content of up to 20%, and the remainder made up of other insoluble matter such as wood ash, proteins and bagasse fibers I think due to the sugar, I would skip the Jaggery and find something else!  Who knew???  As far as giving up beef...the only thing I plan on splurging for is when I cook Italian.  Heck, I can't skip my Italian meatballs!  I will make them with organic beef though.  Let's see how long my hubby lasts without me cooking any beef any more.....we do a lot of organic ground turkey and that's ok for my diet.  Annielynn:  It's good to listen to your body and rest when you need to.  Good job on the gym today!

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 06:54PM mdg wrote: Today I am offically half way done with chemo!  Only two more nasty sessions to go.  It went well....I am home and have thawed out from the cold caps.  It really wasn't bad at all....I guess I am use to them.  Day 21 after first chemo and day of my second chemo and I still have all of my hair.  It's a miracle!  I hope it stays this way....I am sure something will start shedding at some point.  No exercise for me today since it was chemo day, but I am hitting the gym tomorrow first thing!  I need it.  I snacked all day during chemo.....I am hooked on pumpkin spice muffins now.   I need to stop baking or something.  Did you all exercise for me today??? I hope so!  Come on gals - let's get movin!  Melanie:  I found this recipe online...can't remember where though so I can't give proper credit! Brownies: Olive Oil Spray (I use the misto can as the regular oil sprays contain harmful ingredients) 2/3 cup honey 1/3 cup unsweetened natural cocoa powder 1/2 cup whole wheat flour 1/4 tsp of each - baking powder, baking soda, sald 1/2 cup apple sauce - unsweetened 2T olive oil 1 large egg at room temperature 3/4 tsp vanilla Spray 8x8 pan.  Heat honey in microwave til just bubling (about 40-60 seconds) then add in cocoa and stir well to combine.  Let cool to room temp.  In small bowl mix flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. In large bowl mix apple sauce, oil, egg, vanilla and honey.  Mix well and then add in flour mixture.  Bake at 350 degrees for about 25 minutes until dry around edges and tooth pick comes out clear.  16 servings.  86.2 calories; 2.2 gm fat, 1.3gm protein, 16 gm carbs; 63.3 sodium.  Let me know what you think.  Better than doding all of the good stuff...it's nice to have something to eat when you have a craving!  You could also sub the honey for agave which has a lower glycemic index.  I am going to try that this week to lower the sugar in it.

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 04:58AM mdg wrote: Since the day after chemo is no big deal to me, I am off to the gym.  Hopefully all will go well.  Last time I had chemo on Wed I felt great on Thur and Fri probably from the steroids.  Oh well, I will take a good day.  It is going to be freezing here today!! (only 20 degrees - brrrr!).  I don't want to be out much at all in this freezing weather.  Who's working out today?  Come on gals...get moving!  I was also going to ask who was taking any vitamins/supplements during this process?  What are you taking? I am just curious if your doctors have talked to you about this or if you have taken some things on your own.  For me personally, I also see a wholistic MD (I have been seeing him since before BC) and I am on vitamin D, Multi Vitamins, Magnesium, B Complex and pro biotics.  He had me on a few more things but my onc wanted me off that stuff for now.  He also asked me to start some Floresence Tea and a pectin that is full of fiber to detox.  My med onc wants me to wait til after chemo to try that stuff too.  I wish there was more agreement on this, but you know how it goes.  I am just curious how you all are managing vitamins and supplements.    Silia:  Thanks for the encouragement.  I am going to hit the gym, go get my shot for neulasta (boo!) and then come home for a shower.  After my PT appt I am going to the mall to shop!  I also got an Aveda gift card from a friend so I am getting some more make up (I switched to all natural and mostly organic make up and am still building up my supply).  I am also going to get my sister a ring too since she helped me all day - as a thank you for taking the day off and supporting me.  So glad you got your workout in...20 minutes is great and your personal trainer will really keep you motivated.  What kind of stuff did your PT have you do?  Don't forget some weights....as we get older we lose lots of muscle mass.  Keep me posted.  Your chemo time will fly by even though it is more than mine...hang in there! SueBee:  We will see how it goes and when the chemo "hangover" hits.  I am excited though because I already pooped today (yes use BC patients get excited of such gross, little things....).  Last time I had issues so I have been taking meds since yesterday to move things along as a precaution.  I am so glad it is working.  I want to avoid the horrible constipation I had for days last time.  Keep your fingers crossed and throw in a "poop prayer" for me if possible!  :)

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2011 01:36PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...I would love to share some healthy recipes!  You know me..always cooking something!  I have not begun to think about next week's menu yet...hmmmm.  I picked up 3 new light cooking magazines so I am sure to find some good ideas.  As far as Organic...yes, it is very pricey.  I have been doing a comparison of the different stores that carry organic and certain things are way cheaper at some stores.  I can tell you if you buy organic meat, Costco has the best price on boneless chicken and they do also carry organic ground beef (I don't eat beef really anymore).  They do also have a big selection of Kosher meats (steaks, briskets, etc..) which is not organic but another option.  The other best priced organic things I buy there are Milk (3 pack of 1% for $8.99), eggs, organic cheddar (by the brick - I don't remember the brand), organic apples ($4.99/dozen large apples), spinach ($3.99 which is a steal!) and organic wheat bread (it still contains soybean oil but I get it for my family).  They also have some imported cheeses that do not contain hormones  - Finlandia - you can read here:   I did also find good deals on organic honey (I use that for baking instead of sugar...better for you) in a 3 pack and organic Blue Agave (I also use for baking...even lower glycemic index than sugar or honey) in a 2 pack at Costco.  http://www.finlandiacheese.com/healthy1.htm.  I do get that because I can't find organic low fat cheese and this is hormone free and low fat.  They do also carry TIllamook which I do believe is another good choice if you can't find organic.  For that they have more varieties.  You can read about Tillamook here:  http://www.tillamook.com.  I also shop Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Meijer and Kroger.  I rotate around based on what I need and who carries it.  I did try to start stocking up for a month on things that will keep from the store that has the best deals on whatever I need so if I don't get back there for a few weeks we are set.  Just an FYI on cheese...if it is from Europe it will NOT have hormones - it is banned over there.  If you can't find organic, at least buy european....just a tip.  I have started baking organic.  The granola I did came out pretty good for being low fat, low sugar and organic.  I have also been doing muffins.  I want to try bread next...need to invest in a bread maker though!  I tried baking crackers and they were awful!  Threw them all out...I will keep working on that as all regular crackers contain the bad oils (safflower, sunflower, soybean oil) and I love good whole grain crackers for a snack.  I am also doing pancakes this weekend...organic and freezing them.  This way I can use canola oil and organic ingredients...whole grain stuff - buck wheat flour too.  They will be way healthier than what you can buy and should freeze nicely.  I have a few recipe ideas on that.  Does anyone have a good recipe to share?  I don't have time now, but I have a good recipe I created for artichoke and tomato bruschetta chicken.......my DH LOVES it....eats seconds (which he never does!).  I will try to post it this weekend if you gals are interested.  So, I am off to a friend's for dinner tonight.  I have to go make a large, organic salad now!  I am also bringing organic apple slices for a healthy dessert......trying to be good!!!

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2011 04:58AM mdg wrote: Good morning...it's a beautiful sunny day here in Detroit!  Yea!  I am off to the PS office for my last fill (which is good because my boobs are huge!).  I am at 470cc's and my surgeon needs me over 500cc's for the excange to a smaller implant.  I keep bumping things with them...I was an A gal before surgery so I don't know what to do with these things!  My husband is a fan of them though(go figure....he's a man).  My workout will have to wait until this afternoon after PT as I have a busy day.  I hope to get outside and walk later too since it's so nice. Melanie:  In the days following chemo I noticed pressure and a lump like feeling in my esophagus after eating.  It was pretty uncomfortable. I talked to my sister about it as she is a chemo infusion nurse.  She said the chemo dries out your GI tract and esophagus.  I started drinking more water and that helped.   I also had some burning in my stomach so I took Prilosec and that cleared it all up.  I don't know if this helps you or not.  Sorry you are feeling crappy.  I hope you wake up and feel better today.  You will get better and get back to working out when you feel up to it.  Chemo will knock you down a few days...it's OK to be lazy on those days.  I do hope you can muster up even a small walk though..you will probably feel better after.  Rennasus:  Your stroll sounds so nice...we have no citrus farms here in Detroit.  If I walk it's in suburbia but we do have protected wetlands behind oursubdivision and have lots of wildlife.  It is really pretty back there but I have waited to go back there figuring it is really muddy since we have been thawing out.  I am going to check it out this weekend though.  Considering we live in a suburban area right near I-75 it's nice to go back there and see beavers, cranes, deer, ducks and lots of birds....makes me feel like I am somewhere nicer.  I LOVE soup too.  I have been making it lately with roasted veggies.  Cut up all the veggies, toss them in olive oil and some seasonings.  Roast them in the oven for aboug 45 minutes.  Then throw them in a large pot with broth of your choice and some more spices and let it cook down.  SO good.  I have done minastrone, southwest veggie and chicken and veggie this way.  I usually make a HUGE pot and freeze it in small portions so I can just pull a small amount from the freezer for lunch when I want it.  So yummy!  Annie: Don't you just love the hair wash days?  It's a big deal around here for me....I am on a chemo week so my hair will be disgusting this week.  Washed it on Sat and can't wash again til Sat.  I have chemo tomorrow....blech!  I hope you are all feeling healthy today and full of energy for the workouts!'

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2011 04:41AM mdg wrote: hi Melmes!  I too was way more athletic before my surgeries so it's hard when the doc's treat you like you are out of shape and won't be able to do much.  I can't give specific recommendations as I am not your doctor, but I can tell you that I had a lumpectomy in December before I had a BLMX in Jan.  After my lumpectomy I did get back to doing cardio about 5 days post OP.   I was back to teaching my step aerobics class about 10-11 days post surgery.  As far as doing weights/upper body exercises...I eased into that and really listened to my body.  By the time I was ready for my BLMX (1 month post lumpectomy) I was doing all of my normal things again.  I found that I had some tightness and light stretching after doing cardio was helpful.  When I started back on weights, they were lighter and gradually I worked back up to something more challenging.  Good luck!  I am sure you will be back in full force soon!  Oh - and I was not given any exercises to do after lumpectomy.  After my BLMX I was given a book of streches/exercises and worked with a physical therapist too.

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Posts.Content: May 6, 2011 05:14AM mdg wrote: Hey my dear friends!  I feel like I  have been MIA in the last few days.  Now I need to catch up with all of you!  My BFF has been here with me...she is going home this morning (boo hoo!) so I will be mopey all day with her gone.  We have had so much fun though.  We spent the whole day together yesterday - shopping, lunch, errands oh and I dragged her sorry butt to the gym and she said I tortured her.  She asked "how can cancer bitch kick my ass like that??".  She told me she would be cursing me in the coming days as she gets more sore......ooops!  Oh well.  I told her it was good for her.  The good nes is she is also reading Anti Cancer and making lifestyle changes.  We had so much fun sharing ideas for healthy food and cooking.  We made a nice healthy dinner last night too.  I am ready to hit the gym later today and keep moving then I am having lunch at my son's school for a special Mother's Day thing...they are singing us songs.  I can't wait!  So far I am still feeling good from Wednesday's chemo finale.  I hope it stays this way.  I still can't believe I am done!  Melanie:  I am glad you liked the broccoli pasta.  We had something similar in Italy on our last trip there and loved it so I had to come up with a similar version especially since my son will eat broccoli (one of the few veggies he does like so I have to take advantage of it!).  So did you do 20 min or 20 miles...?? I hope that arm is doing better.  You sound so much more upbeat so I am sure it is!  I can't wait til you get over this hump with the arm and feel better.  I can only imagine how difficult it is for you....you are doing good!  Keep it up girl! Supersally:  Let me know how the meditation app is.  I should do some more relaxing things like that.  Iooked into BC yoga and they have it during the day at my cancer center.  I had planned to try it but with the port in my arm I waiting as it was pulling.  It now feels fine but since I get it out in another week or two I will just wait. By then I will be going back to work so I won't do the BC class but I have 2 yoga DVD's I have tried a few times in the past. I am going to try to get those going again after my port stuff heals.  I am doing about 10 minutes of stretching every time I workout and that feels sooooo good.  I always felt much looser when I did the yoga DVD's.  I would do them in the morning before work and I felt so different all day.  I hope to do Yoga once or twice a week.  Yes I get short and snippy with my DH for no reason sometimes and I just can't help myself.  I hate that I do that but know it has to be the chemo, hormones and stress.  I do try to apologize to DH after....it makes me feel bad but I just get this way at times.  I am going through a lot and it is what it is..... Sue Bee:  No job news yet?  Get that DH doing home projects while he's home.  Beef up that "honey-do" list and get him moving!  That's what I would do!  I hope something happens on the job front.  Job searching is horrible here so I know how frustrating it can be. Unemployment is horrific in Detroit.  Oh - black bean and corn salsa sounds good.   We had mexican this week too but I did it before my chemo so I could enjoy it just in case!  We did turkey taco's.  Redsky:  So glad you got to the gym!  I am sure that was such a great feeling to sweat and move again!  Good for you. I too started on the elliptical with no arms for a long time.  You can really get a great cardio workout and work those legs...worry about the arms later.  How has the tightness from the fills been?  Is it better?  You probably have another fill next week - right?  The massage sounds divine!  I have 2 gift cards for massages but couldn't do them because of chemo and surgery.  I am lining them up as soon as I get the OK!  Can't wait to use them!  I am also going to treat myself to a salon pedicure in a few weeks now that chemo is done (that's a no no during chemo).  I will feel like a whole new woman...Oh and I can color my hair again hopefully in a month!  Yippy! Rennasus:  So glad your sis has been there.  Having my BFF here has done wonders for me!  It's so nice to have that good, quality time with those you love especially now.  I am sorry your energy level is down.  When did you start tamoxifen?  I start in a few weeks....happy happy joy joy (said sarcastically of course).  I keep telling myself I am going to be optimistic that being on it won't be a big deal and I will have no side effects.....we shall see.  So are things healing up - finally???  Gosh I hope so!  You need a pick me up with that.  Let us know the latest!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 10:52AM mdg wrote: Hey gals...I am not as tired today, yea!  I did a more normal level workout this morning which felt good.  My legs are gonna hurt tomorrow for sure!  So remember a few weeks ago I had that rash from the water park I took my son to?  Well - it's back...all over my legs and arms so I am off to my GP this afternoon to figure out what we do about it.  I feel more steroids coming on.....what's one more week of steroids, eating everything and not sleeping after just finishing chemo?   Ugh!  I saw the PA at the med onc office yesterday and she blew me off and told me to go see my GP or a dermatologist....nice.   Just what I wanted...one more dr appt.  Oh well at least I got an appt this afternoon.  I was up itching for 2 hours in the middle of the night last night....joy joy! Sue Bee:  Will keep you posted on the overseas thing...you will be a huge resource for sure!  He has a phone interview with them next week.  He has an in person interview scheduled in KC on 5/26.  Lord...this may move fast - it can't move too fast as I have exchange surgery 6/23 and that is not going to change!!!! (unless he wants me to go completely mad!).  Oh and look at you "Little Miss C Cup"!!!!   I can't wait to say that in June. I can't wear any bras...my TE's are in my arm pits and 1 is an inch higher than another......(paints a nice picture hu?) Redsky:  Oh how I wish I only worked 10-15 hours a week...mine is a monster job - over 40 hours for sure and some mornings I am up at 4:30am to be in the operating room at 6am.  Not looking forward to that at all.....I am certainly not interested in seeing any mastectomy surgeries so I am going to stand clear of the plastic surgeons for a while!  Glad you are handling the fills......just think you won't have too many.  Once you stop filling you will loosen up even more (I did and am not tight at all in the chest anymore).  You are doing everything you can......hang in there girl! Happy Anniversary! Renn:  So glad you are doing better - that's GREAT news!  I hope it continues and you can just get those fills going with no issues.  That sounds so much better than sugery to remove things and start over.....I am saying more prayers in your honor girl!  The walk with your friends sounds sooooo nice.  None of my friends have time for anything...they all have young kids and work full time.  I hardly see them......Enjoy the day with your girls!  Where are you going in May for a getaway?  We are doing Chicago for Memorial Day weekend!  I can't wait! Melanie: That's so cool that your parents are doing this with you!  I just make my family eat what I eat....it's not exactly the same as having them "on board"!  Oh well....at least they are eating what I eat for the most part so I don't have to cook 2 dinners each night.  I am glad you were able to walk and your arm is responding well.  I too would look for a new PT if you don't find one aggressive enough...you have a lot to lose here so I would be aggressive.  I think it's amazing that you are working through chemo.  I just could not do it and I have a great STD plan so I decided to take advantage of it.  I am completely scatter-brained so I don't know how you do it!  I am glad you will be closer for radiation treatment....that will save so much time in the car and give you more time to rest or do other things.  When do you start that?  Are you staying with a friend during rads?  Oh and I was one of those jealous gals....I was an A+/small B before surgery....can't wait to be a C!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 16, 2011 08:49AM mdg wrote: Happy Monday!  OK I don't know what to do with myself this morning because I teach aerobics at night and lately I am so use to getting up and going to the gym in the morning but didn't since I have to teach.  I hit Trader Joe's and got some good food for the week.  I am trying to figure out what I should make this week...thinking about the Tomato/Artichoke Bruschetta chicken for DH (he was out of town all last week and he loves that) and maybe some chicken/brown rice/broccoli and chicken type casserole....I have some good organic cheddar and broccoli slaw.  Time to get creative.....I want to make more bagels too.  I am so happy to have bagels again!  Redsky:  I didn't have much issue with bouncing/movement hurting my TE's.  They don't move and don't really hurt.  Everyone is different though so work around it as best as you can and do what you can do.  I did not use my arms on the elliptical for a long time - I held on to the stationary handles.  Recently I started using the handles and funny enough it made my port in my arm hurt less - maybe because I was finally doing something with my arms.  I hardly feel the port anymore (now that it's coming out next week!).  So nice that you and DH had a date night to celebrate.  Those events mean even more now after going through all of this I am sure.  I did not sleep in a recliner but during fills I would go back to the wedge pillow and sleep on that for several nights until the pressure from the fill would go away.  Like you I would wake up after a few hours and feel discomfort in my chest.  Once I got done with fills and started doing some of those new stretches in the supine (laying on the back) position, all tightness went away completely.  Hang in there...you are almost there!  It will get better.  I am teaching some of my regular classes.  She is kind of alternating me a bit.  Since I go out for exchange surgery next month I am not going to worry about it even though I am not happy about it, but after that if we have not moved out of state I will probably look to teach somewhere else.  For now it's on hold though.  Life is nuts here!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 10, 2011 06:27PM mdg wrote: I am not in the forgive and forget club but I am going to act differently towards those people that were not there for me. I will spend less time and energy on them because I am hurt and have realized that when I needed them they were not there for me.  That means that is how they are - even as bad as that hurts my feelings.  I have come to not ask for anything from them or expect anything from them moving forward.  I am not even mentioning my exchange surgery date again (I already told them the date) unless they call and ask.  I will not ask for meals, help with my son or anything from them.  I have plenty of friends that have offered to help and have helped.  Those are the people I CAN count on.  So I guess moving forward, I expect nothing so I won't be let down.  When I get nothing it will be just what I expect......sad, I know but true.  I really thought my family would have done more but then again they were the same useless way when I went through a horrible divorce years ago when I was young and out of state alone.  They never once even came to see me or help me move or anything......I don't know why I was so shocked/sad they didn't do anything for my BC........I should have known better from history I guess.
Posts.Title: Some family has not even asked how mastectomy went! Fearless_One PaulaLS

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2011 10:00AM mdg wrote: I would like to send my "little girl" away for a while too.....that would be a mental break for me.  I am not good at "mothering me".  I always seem to put everyone else first........I know I have to change that and make me a priority too.  I will work on that.  SueBee:  That guy is a pig...may as well call him "Weiner" (LOL if you listen to the news much you know what I am talking about.....).  Can't believe his wife is in the class....what a pig - but he has very good taste I must say!!!!  Shannon:  I would love some protein shakes without soy too....I hope someone knows what we can have.  I did stretch after fills....that did help me but it was tight.  I did workout through fills but did the elliptical without using my arms on some days to minimize the arm movement.  Listen to your body though...sometimes stretching after a warm shower is easier because muscles are warmer and not so tight.  I hope you feel better tomorrow.  Oh and it does get creative trying to hide these things....my DH told me they were huge again yesterday.  I said "they aren't huge....".  He just stared at me and said "the are very large". I said "I didn't think so....I guess I have been looking at them too long.".  Too funny........
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 06:27AM mdg wrote: SueBee:  Love the Annie Song!!! Perfect..   I do know what you mean about people forgetting about what you are going through.  It's odd how they just move on with their life....no one helped or gave a crap when I went through 9 weeks of chemo....that was a bit hurtful.  I guess since that happened 2 months after my surgery by then everyone was "over it"....too bad I wasn't (and am still not over it).  I just wanted to wish you good luck tomorrow...I will be praying for you.  I know everything will go perfectly!  Annie:  I too wonder if it will ever get easier.....if so when.  I think the mind takes longer to heal than the body.  I don't think you can ever really get over the fear associated with this.  It permanently alters your mind.  It's like a tattoo or something...no matter what you do it is still there as a reminder.  I hope that in time we can find a way to have peace in our mind at least 95% of the time.  I wish for 100% of the time but we all know that would never happen.  The chemo did stink Annie, but think of it doing it's job.....makes me feel better knowing it was trying to kill off anything lingering around.  Shannon:  The BC does feel a little isolating....and lonely.  It is hard to realize everyone is "over" my diagnosis and just moves on with their life.  I wish I could "just move on with my life".  It's like they think this is all over or something...I wish it was all over!  No one gets it...that's the lonely part.  I wish someone would just send a card to say "how are you today?  I am thinking of you" at this point.....It is hard to do this with kids.  They add more stress as they don't get it either and misbave and it adds so much stress at times.  Sometimes I just had to excuse myself and go up stairs when my 4 year old was unmanageable - I would just say to my DH  "I don't have the energy to deal with this right now".  That is hard to feel like you can't even parent....makes me feel like a failure at times but it was all I was capbable of during chemo at times.  I hope you survive the trip.  When is your exchange date?   I go in 10 days......I want it over with. My TE's don't bother me much, but I can't wait til they are gone! So you all want the BBQ update hu?  Well it was torture for me for the first several hours.  I got there and DH's SIL and neice didn't even say Hi to me when I got there (they have never called, emailed, sent a card or aknowldedged my BC since my DX and they live 35 min from us).  MIL of course acts like we are best friends...hugs and kisses as soon as we got there (blech!).  So about an hour into the party DH's SIL comes over.."Hi Maria, how ARE you?"  A few exchanges of doing ok etc...there were several awkward silences (because I think she is an a-hole for not even sending a card)..and she says "well you look good".  That was it...nice.  I am so DONE with them.  We were there all day and her daughter never even said hello to me (she is 9).  Nice hu?  Would you allow your kids that behavior?  My son is alwasys instructed to go say "hi" to aunts, uncles, friends, etc...when we arrive somewhere.  He is always told to give a proper goodbye before we leave with hugs too.  Her daugher never even said goodbye...my SIL kind of waived and say "by Maria" when I left.  I am glad we will move away from his family - then we won't have to deal with them.  I brought all my own food - snack, appetizer and black bean brownies for dessert.  I popped a huge bowl of popcorn to bring so I also snacked on that.  We had some really good friends of ours there so I hung out with them.  I avoided MIL and SIL for the rest of the party.  They never really talked to me (which was fine with me really).  I did teach my class yesterday...that was fun.  Today we may head to the pool for a while (I will hide in the shade of course - no pool for me just in case the rash wants to make a return). THe rash has been gone (knock on wood - please!).  I hope it stays away so surgery can go off as scheduled.  That's all for me ladies.....nothing else going on.  I hope you are all having a good weekend.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 05:37PM mdg wrote: Suebee:  Good luck tomorrow. Annie:  At least your family finally acknowledged something occurred with you.  I will be forever waiting.  I told DH his SIL was a "witch" today.  He asked what she said...I didn't even answer.  What's the point.  I guess I am holding a grudge..I have to let that go.  I guess it will be easier when we move away.  I will never have to see them but once a year when we come home for a visit.  Perhaps I can get out of that and just spend the day with my family instead.  Heck, they could care less if they see me (I think that has been proven) so why would it matter?  I guess I will add this topic to my list of things to talk to a counselor about.....Ativan made me wake up in the middle of the night too...I prefer xanax...sleep all night!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 07:52PM mdg wrote: Redsky:   I am so glad I read your post.  DH and I were talking today about my exchange too.  I expressed my concern that I would not be happy with them and that my expectations were too high.  I have read so many women's posts about being unhappy with final results...I am just nervous I will be too and I don't want to be disappointed...let's face it, I have had too many disappointments in the last 6 months.  I don't know what I think in my head they will look like..I guess we all want them to look real and not like we had BC at all, but that's not possible.  I don't even know what I picture them to look like or feel like......He said "they will be fine but not real"...he wants me to get the crazy expectations out of my head I suspect and he's right.....I guess I have to realize that they will probably not look good without clothes on and get use to that.  I don't know that I will ever get use to that...I still get surprised with I look in the mirror without my clothes on and see my c-section scar and my son is almost 5!  It's almost like "who's body is that???".  Do you know what I mean?  Gosh BC requires so much emotional energy...sucks it right out of me!!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 07:44AM mdg wrote: Happy Birthday Melanie!!!!! Oh and I would throw a huge party for you and cook a ton of food (even have things you could actually eat guilt free!) I wish I were closer because I would do that for you girl!  If you really didn't feel up for that, I would take you out for cocktails and a chick flick!!!  Hugs!  I know what you mean about people disappearing or not being "there" for you.....I have struggled a lot with that.  It's like they "got over" my diagnosis and it doesn't exist anymore while I still have to deal with it every day....I "get it" Melanie...hugs!!!!!!  Annie:  Being at work it icky...at least I am still working from home until after I go back to work after my exchange surgery.  The thought of driving around, seeing customers and schlepping my sales bag all over nauseates me..........worse than chemo ever did.   I guess I should start playing the Power Ball or Mega Millions or something.....a girl can dream, right?? I love the "BC Free Zone"....I am going to have to use that line when someone starts with BC stories......I like it! Renn:  I have read your blog before and loved the post about us gals....we knew who you meant!!!  I hope you heal up.....you just have to!!!!!  I am "willing" it to happen for you.....  I know this must be hard for you :(  We all are still very hopeful it will heal and be OK. Supersally:  My DH is a "problem solver" too.  It drives me nuts.  I will vent about my feelings or something and then he will say nothing. Then I get mad/hurt that he says nothing and  say "don't you have anything to say????".  Then he says he doesn't know how to "fix it".  I sometimes just want him to listen and be in the moment with me or hug me and say "I know honey....it will be OK" or "I understand" with a hug...It would be nice if he could make my problems/feelings go away, but I don't expect that.....  Let me know how the aqua class was and if you try the yoga.  Once I heal from exchange I plan to start yoga...I wanted to after my surgery but I had the chemo port in my arm and it was a little uncomfortable at times so I decided to wait til it was gone..now it's gone and I have surgery again next week.  I too feel I need some relaxation or meditation.  YOu should have not even planted the seed about writing letters to toxic people that you never send.......that could be ugly with MIL and SIL>....he he!  Work does get in the way of me taking care of myself....I can't wait til we move to quit this job and not have to deal with it anymore!!!  I hope you are all having a good day.  I hit the gym before work at 7am......but I did it.  It's gorgeous here today....wish I could be out doing something fun but I am working :(    Now I am starting to tackle our real estate issues....huge loss on our house and trying to figure out what we do with that when we move...it just keeps getting better.  Thank God my cousin is in real estate...she is helping try to find a way out.  THe housing market in Detroit is one of the worst in the nation......blech!  This isn't going to be easy to solve.......oh joy!  Kansas City called....offer coming this week for sure.......we have so many decisions to make.

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 01:09PM mdg wrote: Supersally:  I can relate to having people over...last time DH tried to do that I said "I don't feel like cooking dinner and cleaning everything up for everyone...I am tired so NO".   I guess my inner CB has no trouble coming out these days.  DH was cool and picked up carry out.   I too have issues with eating out....I just want to eat my food that I know is healthy and not full of pestisides and hormones.  I find myself avoiding eating out with friends.  My one friend had us over for dinner Fri night and God bless her...she cooked all organic for ME!  I almost cried.....teared up as I hugged her and thanked her.  I hope your swelling goes down....I wonder what is causing that?  So odd at this point...... Renn:  I do thing SueBee should jump out of the cake....fabulous idea to show off the new twins and have them make their debut. Yes Melanie...How many candles???  I bet you are the baby in the group....you look so young and beautiful in your avatar.  Shannon:  Let us know if your pain goes away.....I hope the meds clear that up quick!!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2011 08:20AM mdg wrote: Sue:  I guess he can stay at home...I just wasn't sure I would have enough energy to do stuff with him and I don't want to put him in front of the TV all day.  I will have to see what I can do.  Friday DH can take him to school...Monday DH will be out of town in Seattle.  I guess I will figure something out.  I am going to try to do some cooking on Wed this week so we have food to eat for a week or so.  I am so DONE coordinating for surgeries and chemo.......mentally exhausted with DH's job search and the potential move crap.......I need a vacation from my life right now...just a short vacation.  I do know things could be worse....it has just been a super long 7 months........after a while of this crap you just say "I'm done!"  I will feel better after I workout later today....it will clear my head. Oh and FYI...I have been checking out my TE's and I am afraid that my boobs won't be big enough.  I think I have some last minute boob greed again........it's too late to do anything about it now though.  I guess I have looked at them so long they no longer look big.....make sense???

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2011 01:45PM mdg wrote: Julie:  That's terrible!  I am glad you are OK.  What an ordeal!  Don't you go worrying us out here..... As far as the fills...I was getting them weekly and then I got one that was so painful I threw my upper back out and was in so much pain.  I stopped filling for 2-3 weeks and then went back and had a few more fills and I did much better.  The last two did not hurt at all.  Maybe you just need a break, but if you are happy with your size, just stop there. Don't let our boob greed talks pressure you!  Shannon:  I was checking back again today to see if you posted....so glad all is OK.  YOu had us worried.....I too like to take off my shirt at any medical office.......I am so use to it I just feel the need.  I have a dental appt coming up and I will have to keep repeating "don't take your shirt off, don't take your shirt off......." just in case that morning :)
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 05:15AM mdg wrote: Good morning ladies...Renn I think it is a good idea to wish for the mojo fairy too! My DH is praying I am sure...... So last night I was hurting...I realized that 1 vicodin was not going to cut it. Once I took 2 every 4 hours I felt better. I can not sleep on vicodin...just like my last surgery. I can never nap either...oh and I have still not has a visit from the poop fairy...you all know I had bad issues with this before.....I am praying for poop and mojo these days...oh and I am just putting that out there on the internet...nice hu? I know you get it and don't think I am strange....

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2011 05:21PM mdg wrote: I agree with Renn about the cozy cottage...there could be scarier things lerking in there!  Things are never what they appear to be..... I am going to have to think of something to do for the sundried tomato recipe....I have not been in the mood to cook much lately...I have not been in the mood to do much of anything lately......ugh!  I start taking tammy again tonight....here comes the Devil in a fat dress.........lord, that should send me over the edge for sure!  Shannon:  Sorry you are having a down day.  It's allowed.  I will hope tomorrow gives you a better mood.  I think it's great you walked by the hospital!  Good for you!  As far as mojo...I am the last one to offer advice..did you check out the mojo thread?  I feel like Frankenstein these days...not a sexy kitten.  I keep thinking I am connecting the dots on my eyebrows, my hair has 2 inches of roots, it's thinning a bit, I can't wash my hair more than once every 5 days (due to cold caps), I have a port scar in my R arm with a stitch hanging out, I have hot flashes and sweat like a pig, and I have steristrips and huge scars accross each breast....no wonder why mojo took off!  I would too!  I can't even imagine DH being interested in any of this...but alas, he is.  Men are funny...if it's a boob - they like it.  Doesn't matter what size, shape or nippless......it's a boob.  I did buy a sexy tank type camisole for Valentine's Day that covered my ugly chest.....I felt better keeping things covered up.  Maybe buy something that makes you feel good in and it may help you feel more comfortable.....and relaxed.  I am not sure you should be taking any mojo advice from me though...... Redsky:  Glad your mom is doing OK.  That is good to hear.   I know it must be hard for you not being with her.... Melanie:  Glad to hear PT went well.  Do you think it will help?  Is the PT confident she can help you?  Gosh I hope so....you deserve relief so you can get your life back girl.

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 12:39PM mdg wrote: Sally: Boy I am glad you kept your shirt on...LOL!  Nice of you to go with your friend and take notes.....I too tried on one sundress with the TE's and it was not a pretty look....popping out everywhere!  My friend's daughter is 16 and has lost a ton of weight and is now a size 2.....I am giving her all my cute clothes.  She can fit in them and I can't.  I guess I will have to start cleaning my closets out soon enough once they drop and fluff. My husband now seems to think drop and fluff is going to be a "ka-bam".  I should have never explained this phenomenon to him...he's obsessed with asking when it will happen and forever coming up with his own name for it....shift and poof, Ka bam, and a big "HEEEELLLOO" too.  Lord..I hope they "ka-bam" soon or he is going to drive me crazy.  It is not helping me with mojo either...LOL!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2011 04:49AM mdg wrote: Good morning gals.  I am up and ready for another boring day.  I have absolutely nothing on my agenda today other than calling the relocation expert for the job offer in Chicago.  Oh and an update...we decided against Kansas City.  So now it's Chicago and DH is still flying to Seattle Thursday for a Friday interview.  We have to decide on Chicago pretty quick I think....yikes!  So I have another whole day of sitting here, watching TV......blech! Suebee - how are you doing this?  I feel completely fine...I can't stand not working out or doing anything....I am so bored!  I know what you mean about shopping for work clothes. I did before I went back to work last month.  I went to Loehman's...do you have that store?  I got a few summer weight sweater sets, black pants, gray pants and two cute dresses.  A black A-line skirt can go far with your wardrobe too.  It was not that expensive.  Another place that has good sales and nice business clothes is The Loft.  I shop there a lot.  If you hit the clearance rack you can find lots of cute stuff...they always have lots in small sizes too but I am not sure those will house your new ta-ta's!  If I tell my DH there won't be a "ka-bam" he will be so bummed out.  I will wait to tell him.. Thanks for understanding how I feel.  You are so lucky you did not have to do chemo...I know that's why I look like crap. Renn:  LOL at the mojo comment.  Certainly mojo is still on hiatus......can't find mojo anywhere.  I know I have to look harder for poor DH.  I cannot imagine DH taking tammy....men are babies anyway....can you imagine?  I am glad you have surgery scheduled...oh and don't need a colonoscopy!  How long will you have to wait for your dr to try the TE again?  Are you a candidate for any other types of reconstruction?  Just curious.....  Oh and I am trying to embrace dear old tammy.....this is day 3.  Yippee...... Redsky:  If I remember correctly we had similar measurements, right?  (I am 5' 3", 31 inch ribcage, weigh about 122 lbs now).  I don't feel like my implants are too wide though they are larger on the side than my pre-BC breasts.  But then again, they are bigger all over.  I was worried about them being too wide and discussed this with the PS before surgery and he assured me he would use the largest size he could that were still in correct proportion to my body.  My PS filled me to 510cc's with TE's and then downsized me to a 450cc implant.  I did get the high profile smooth type implants...FYI.   I did hold up just one of the cups on my size B bra from before surgery....I am not sure it wil fully house my new foob.  I think I may be a C after this.  It seems like the whole breast may not fit within the wire area.  I can't tell though and my PS sad NO bras for a month...not even jog bras.   I would say I don't have a lot of cleavage without a bra on but when I lay down on my side they push together more (they actually move - unlike the TE's!) and I can see that once I put a bra on it will give some cleavage.  I do wish I was a bit bigger but I am OK with what I have.  I would be curious what your PS says.....let me know how the pre-OP goes. Melanie:  OK just because he is married with kids it does not mean anything...some men are just like that!  I think he has a little crush on you! :)   When do you do your modeling photo shoot?  I am dying to see it...you have to get the photos so we can see them..... Oh and thanks for saying he's "not old".....as I am in my mid 40's too!  LOL!  Oh and I needed to update you all...my itching subsided and a few days before surgery my skin actually felt completely normal again.  Well...the itching is back....ugh!  I woke up at 5:30am with ny arms, neck, chest all itchy....by 6am I was in the shower seeking relief.  I am so frustrated....no doc's have taken me seriously and solved the problem.  This has been going on since Easter...UGH!!!!!  I am trying a new lotion my sister brought over the other day.....maybe this will help.  I am not optimistic as I have googled and found a whole bunch of people online that have the same unsolved problem due to chemo......no one told me about this.  They all act like it's not a big deal too....you try itching for 2 months!!!  My skin is super sensitive to anything that touches it too......this ain't any fun! What should I make for dinner tonight?  I am thinking a chicken piccata (lemon, caper sauce) and adding in some portabella mushrooms I need to use up.....sound good?  I have had no motivation to cook lately...what's wrong with me?
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2011 12:42PM mdg wrote: Shannon:  Glad you felt "normal" and got a vacay away from BC!  We all need that sometimes.  Sometimes just a change in surroundings does wonders...... Renn:  Yea.my doc suggested I take xanax by day when I go back to work since I am stressing about it.  I think once I start walking again more (next week) it will help clear my head.  I do think the added stress of my DH's job situation is putting me over the edge.....we will hopefully have it figured out next week so that should help.  Sally:  The derm still thinks it is due to the taxotere......arghhhh!  They gave me a new oral antihistamine to try tonight in addition to 3 different topical things.  They also wanted me to stop taking the Bactrum antibiotic I am on post surgery.  I called the PS and he agreed to take me off of it as people often have allergic reactions to it and right now my body is super sensitive.  Who knows what will happen.  The steroids solve the issue temporarily but the PS won't let me do steroids as it slows healing......joy!  I am still itching.....my chest around my neck/collar bone is flaming and red.....gross. The one cream seemed to help for a while this afternoon. I will check in tonight...I am going to pick my son up at school.....shhhhh!  Yes, I drove today.  I had to get to the derm and then made a Target run to pick up DS's birthday invitations I had printed....I can drive fine.  I am not waiting 2 more weeks! Chat later..
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2011 09:30AM mdg wrote: Suebee: righty was always a problem after surgery.  I will have to post photos so you can see what I mean.  I started to post photos but then I didn't have them labelled right...had some trouble figuring it all out so I will have to go back and try again.  I also have not taken any post exchange photos yet.  I go to the PS today and get steri strips off....I will try to take photos this week.  I have so much to do right now...super busy!  Glad vacay is going well!  Annie:  Good luck this week!  You will be glad to be done.  It's not that bad and you will feel so much better when you don't have those turtle shells in your chest any more!  As far as size, I don't think 475 would be too much.  I am only 5' 2 1/2" tall and have about 31" rib cage.  I have 450 ccs.  I wish they were bigger....they are not that big really.  I would not want them wider, but I want them to project more and have more cleavage.  I am hoping once I can wear a bra they willl look more like what I though.  I wish I had gone a bit bigger, but only if they were not wider..... Red:  See you on FB! Hey Melanie....glad you are back!  You will be 1/3 done with rads today!  That's great news!!! I went to costco today. I figured that would be easy since you don't get a shopping bag for your food and I could easily put each single item in the cart one at a time.....mission successful.  OK so I had a "you know when you are a BC patient when" you almost give the man at the check out our Mentor Implant Card instead of your costco card...LOL!  Thank god I noticed it before I handed it to him!  Can you imagine?  "what's this??", and I would say "Oh, that's just my boob card for my implants...."  Nice....

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 06:56PM mdg wrote: I too am obsessed with hair and boobs....when I am at the gym and am on the elliptical for an hour I check out every gals hair the whole time.  I also check out boobs.....BC really changes a person.  Never did that before all of this.....
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2011 12:35PM mdg wrote: Hey gals...time for my quick check in.  I did not sleep on pillows after I stopped filling my TE's.  I did sleep on an extra pillow for 1 night after my exchange but I am pillow free since then!  As far as this thread being about healing and exercise...we left that a long time ago!  LOL!   It is 97 degrees here today and will be 99 tomorrow....doesn't that sound nice?  It sounds like a cold front to Barbara I am sure!  SueBee - love Kings Island....but not in this heat.  Have fun with that and bring a bathing suit so you can cool off and show off your D's!  The whole port becoming "part of you"....blech!  The day I was done with chemo I asked when I could get that sucka out!  Within 2 weeks it was gone!  I hated that big huge thing.  The scar is still very noticable.....I have stitches coming of out of it too and I don't know what to do as they never gave me anyone to follow up with.  I see my PS next week so I am going to have him look at the stitches and see if he can cut them.....It looks like Frankenstein but thank God it's on the underside of my arm.  I am off to look at more house crap online....I miss chatting with you gals. OH -I will make this about exercise...I did 60 min on the elliptical at level 14.  Who is exercising with me today????? Come on...get off your butts and get movin' gals!  :)
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2011 01:00PM mdg wrote: Hey gals..I also wanted to follow up on a chat we had a while back about BPA free canned foods.  Most canned products contain BPA and I don't eat a lot of them but I do like beans, refried beans and especially tomatos.  I did some digging to see what I could find for BPA free canned food choices.  Here is one link: http://guide.thesoftlanding.com/2010/03/15/bpa-free-canned-food-options/ I started buying Pomi tomatoes a while back.  I got them at Whole Foods and Meijer - FYI.  WHole foods also contains Eden Organics products...my Kroger also carries some Eden products like beans.  Another link: http://www.treehugger.com/files/2010/03/7-bpa-free-canned-foods.php http://www.re-nest.com/re-nest/food-and-cooking/product-guide-bpafree-canned-foods-107985 http://www.healthiertalk.com/desperately-seeking-bpa-free-canned-foods-2948 Most of these links say the same thing,but I wanted to share.  If you are ER/PR positive...avoid the BPA!  Also remember that it is present in plastic containers too....like juices, peanutbutter, etc....  I am avoiding all foods not in glass jars.  If you buy food in glass jars, the lids usually have BPA in them too (like spaghetti sauce for example).  What a pain.....  FYI.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2011 08:53PM mdg wrote: I am now just checking in at 11:47pm.  I have been busy all day!  Lord....I don't know how I will get everything done I need to do.  I did have dinner with a girlfriend tonight...that was nice.  I know we won't get to do it again before we move :(  I went car shopping today....I have not had to look for a car in 15 years.....so that was fun.  All I can say is "ka-ching!".  I did not decide on one yet...I have got to analyze it all.  I drove 5 different cars.....some better than others.  I did my workout this morning.  I am so glad some of you worked out today!  That's great.  I am jealous of anyone with "guns" Supersally...my arms feel so flabby from a month off.  My legs too!  Oh well...now is the time to get things going again for me.  As far as the move...I don't know what we are doing.....still negotiating on our house sale so that is not a done deal.  I am not making any decisions about work until I know when we are moving for sure.  We may head back to Chicago on Monday to look around more and confirm a rental property.  Tomorrow I am hitting the gym and then running errands for my son's birthday party for next weekend....I have not done anything but order the cake!  I have to get it done tomorrow.  We have a busy weekend..plans with mom/sis tomorrow night, 2 birthday parties on Saturday and a birthday dinner for my mom on Sunday.  Mom is going to be 80!  I am giving her money for a train ticket to Chicago for her birthday so she can come and visit us soon.  OK...I have to go look at more car stuff now....I am tired but I have stuff to do.
