Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 10:01AM mdg wrote: I also wanted to add one more thing you can add into your routine to help with mental health and relaxation.  I picked up two great music CDs from Target prior to surgery that I have been using for calming effects and relaxation when I get completely stressed about what I am dealing with.  The first CD is called Harmony from Lifescapes music (their website is on the CD:  www.lifescapesmusic.com)  I listened to this all day before my surgery and in the hospital post OP.  It has a wonderful, calming effect.  It kept me from getting hysterical and crying the whole time....really!  I put it on when I can't sleep too.  The other CD is Faith by Jim Brickman.  I have always been a fan of him and thought this CD sounded perfect right now!  He is an amazing pianist and this is a collection of hymns and inspiring original songs.  It has a peaceful quality.  If you can't get out and walk or exercise, nurture your soul and do some relaxation.  That is part of your overall health - it's body, mind and spirit ladies.  FYI  :)
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 11:28AM mdg wrote: Here are the books I have been reading on Cancer and nutrition in case anyone is interested:  What to Eat if You Have Cancer Anti Cancer - A New Way of Life Foods To Fight Cancer
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 05:42AM mdg wrote: Sue Bee;  We are on our last night of meal delivery so I am actally making a grocery list and going shopping tomorrow so I can plan our menu for next week.  I love cooking and can't wait to get back to it...I have been reading what I should/shouldn't eat so I am trying to get a grip on that.  As far as the candie...I do the hard candies because they take so much longer to eat than a chocolate.  I would have eaten that whole bag of Reese's!  I love them.  I did my exercises last night and they are always tighter and harder at night.  I did notice though that I did them before bed and I was more comfortable laying down and moving around in the bed last night.  Maybe it's because I was not as tight by doing the exercises before bed.  Who knows.  Today I have my first TE fill....hope it doesn't hurt!  One more "healthy" thing I thought I would share.  I am going to be switching my health care products and make up products to go chemical free and organic.  I found a good website for body creams, deodorants, lip balm and more called Bubble & Bee.  It's all organic.  They have an interesting article on parabens which is worth checking out:  http://chemicaloftheday.squarespace.com/todays-chemical/2011/1/9/parabens.html If you have not thought about going paraben free, you may want to check out the article.  Just interesting.  It's a personal choice.  Post your daily exercise progress......are you getting more range of motion?  Quote for today:  "You never know how far you can go until you envision a distant destination and take the first steps" Envision yourself doing everything physical you want to do - aerobics, running, tennis, golf...whatever.  You can get your movement back if you keep doing those exercises.  Spring is around the corner and we WILL be doing those thing!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2011 06:41PM mdg wrote: Annie - good for you working out!  I had family over today and we cooked low fat veggie pizza and a large salad so I ate instead today :)  I did get in my 5 fruits/veggies today though!  Hillck and Gummy - I also find wearing a fitted tank top under my clothes helps.  It does not move around and brush against my chest when I move like looser clothes do.  It is getting more intense though.  I know - it's part of the process.  Let's add the washcloth thing to our re-hab exercises twice a day....what do you think?  That way we will have to do it! I did my rehab exercises this morning and they felt better than yesterday.  I think Friday's fill tightened me up a lot.  I was glad it was easier today.  I was worried I was moving backward in my progress yesterday.  So did you all do the exercises twice a day?  I have one more round to do...I am doing them before bed so I am all loose and relaxed so moving around doesn't hurt as much before I fall asleep.  I am going walking at the mall tomorrow!  My first big walk.  I can't wait to get moving!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 10:15AM mdg wrote: Hey ladies....doing the daily check in. I did my 35 minute mall walk today and that felt good.  I am going to do my rehab exercises now and again before bed.  They feel a little easier each day which is good news.  I got my first chemo scheduled for March 2nd.  I am freaking out on that.  It scares me a lot.  Anyone else doing chemo in March?  I am doing taxotere and cytoxan for 4 cycles.  Let me know if I will have any chemo buddies.  Say a prayer I keep my hair...I am doing the cold caps and hoping for a pretty full head of hair after all of this. Sue bee - that's a big bummer.  I would definately ask if the PS wants you to keep doing the stretches at all because maybe that is putting stress on the incisions.  Let us know what happens.  I hope that stops so you can keep doing the rehab with no issues.  Maybe you feel lazy, but resting is healing you.  Also work on getting those fruits and veggies in your body and healthy foods....that is all part of the process.  All of these things are important, so just do what you can do.   Hang in there girlfriend! Annie - I looked at the coobies online last night.  I think I may need to do some shopping online today!  They look good.  Weight watchers is a great program to help keep you in check.  We will have to share some healthy recipes too!  The refined things are hard to avoid...I am trying too. I cleaned out my cabinets and pantry yesterday and got rid of all white rice, pasta, bad oils that I can't have and such.  I replaced all of those things with good, healthy, organic alternatives.  I feel good now that most of the junk is out of the house!  Good job on the elliptical!  Keep it up!

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2011 11:36AM - edited Feb 25, 2011 11:43AM by mdg Annielynn:  Glad you are focusing on posture it is so easy to let that go and then all of a sudden you are all hunched over.  It seems to sneek up those first days or two after a fill for me...I had a fill today and feel like I am hunched over!  Sorry about your fill pain....I feel your pain today too.  I am taking tylenol and making sure to do the exercises for sure today to loosen things up!  I know I will be back propped up on pillows in bed again tonight.  Oh well..... Cindy - that's great you are getting those exercises in.  I am also so glad you are seeing a PT.  I noticed a difference on the first visit!  I am using that pully thing in my PT sessions.  It does help stretch things for me.  So nice people can actually buy one if needed.  Thanks for the link!  I totally agree on the strength vs endurance thing.  I have just been cleared to go to the gym!  (yea!).  I plan on starting with very light weights and doing sets of 20 reps of things to work the shoulders, chest and upper back.  I am also focusing on rotator cuff as those muscles are easily weakend and I was injured during my first surgery (lumpectomy and SNB) in December and have had rotator cuff pain since.  I can't wait to do something for my legs and butt again too!  My first gym visit will be Monday.  Will let you know how it goes!  That's great on the exchange!  I am hopefully doing mine at the beginning of June (my chemo is delaying mine - boo!) Anniemomof3:  Sorry you are feeling fatigued....if you can get in a little exercise - do it for less time and a little less intensity.  Everyone says if you keep moving you feel better.  Have you been drinking your water? You need it so much around those chemo days.....drink a lot to flush that chemo out of your body!  As far as exercises - my PS nurse cleared me to do what I want as long as I use good judgement and listen to my body and start off very light and progress slowly.  THe main thing is stretching so none of the muscles tighten up (which they will after surgery).  I don't remember, but do you have TE's?  THe main muscles effected by our surgery would most likely be the shoulders, chest and upper back.  I also think it is important to continue to include the abs/core strength as your body is weakened in some areas and if your body is weak you may need your abs and lower back for more support in doing things and moving around. I also wanted to share some information on magnesium.  It is also important to make sure you are getting good amounts of that in your diet daily.  The daily recommended amount is 310mg for adult women.   It works in production and transport of energy within the body. It is also important for the contraction and relaxation of muscles. Magnesium is involved in the synthesis of protein, and it assists in the functioning of certain enzymes in the body.  Black beans - 1 cup - 120mg Broccoli - 1 cup - 22mg Halibut - 1/2 fillet - 170mg Peanuts - 1 oz - 64mg Frozen okra - 1 cup - 94mg Oysters - 3 oz - 49 Plantain raw - 1 medium - 66mg Rockfish - 1 medium - 51mg scallops - six - 55mg squash/pumpkin seeds - 1 oz - 155mg soy milk - 1 cup - 47mg (not best for ER/PR+ gals!) Spinach - 1 cup cooked - 157mg Whole grain cereal ready to eat - 3/4 cup - 22mg Whole grain cereal cooked - 1 cup - 56mg Whole wheat bread - 1 slice - 24mg USDA Nutrient Database for Standard References, Release 15 for Magnesium, Mg (mg) Just thought this may be helpful. So today I got up and did my 40 min walk.  I was tired and had a headache, but I went anyway.  I also did my exercises this morning before I went to get my fill.  I am now at 360cc's!  I am feeling tight now and having some pain so I am going to take my tylenol and do another hot shower before stretching and rehab exercises.  I know I won't be sleeping well tonight...oh well! So, no one has suggestions of how I should cook that awful cauliflower?  Ick.  I need to find a way to enjoy it so I can benefit from it - right?  I doubled up on broccoli today at lunch so I am one up on my veggies.....so I could avoid the leftover cauliflower..... :) Get those exercises is gals...you are on your way to a new you by spring!!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2011 06:53AM mdg wrote: Hillck: I wished I like Indian food...but curry is not my thing.  It's funny because where I live there is a big Indian population so good Indian food restaurants are everywhere.  I wish I liked it....my hubby does.  I will keep searching for a way to enjoy the cauliflower..... So last night was a long night.  My back was so tight.  The tylenol and xanax helped me get about 5 hours of sleep.  I was hurting this morning too, but I did already do my exercises.  I do know that it really helps even if they hurt.  Keep doing them ladies.  I am doing them 3x today since I am so sore from my fill yesterday.  Last night I made stuffed peppers...yummy!  This is a great, healthy option.  I like to saute garlic, onion, mushrooms (chopped fine), diced tomatoes, hormone free ground turkey and some fresh herbs in olive oil.  Mix in some raw parmesan cheese and cooked brown long grain rice.  Blanch the red or green pepper for 5 min in boiling water.  Fill them with the mixture.  Put some of your favorite spaghetti sauce on the bottom of a casserole dish...put the peppers in and top them with more sauce.  Cover and bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.  I served with a spinach salad with lots of fresh veggies...I also like to double the stuffing recipe and freeze the rest for use at a later date.  When peppers are on sale, I pick up a few and thaw the mixture and dinner is ready quick!  Just wanted to share something healthy and fairly easy.  If you have little one's like me, just take the stuffing out of the pepper.  My son will eat the stuffing...we are working on the pepper part!  Let me know what your exercise plans are for the day.  Normally every Saturday morning I am teaching my aerobics class at 9am....I miss my real class but am so happy to have you all in my virtual class here :)   Be healthy today!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2011 12:46PM mdg wrote: Happy Monday my fit gals!  Ok - I got up and moving and had my first day back at the gym!  I did 40 min on the elliptical without the arms (letting my arm rest a bit since I got the arm port last week).  It felt good! I did all my exercises and stretches for rehab right at the gym.  I feel so nice and loose today after all that.  I can tell you that my range of motion has increased so much since 2 weeks ago even with getting weekly fills.  This just reminds me to tell you all how impotant it is to do those stretches EVERY day!! It does make a difference!  Really!   Not too much on the agenda today.  I did my grocery shopping at Meijer - I went to check out what they offer organic.  I got almost everything I needed so if you havea Meijer near you and are looking for organic foods, they have a good amount of choices.  It was limited for produce but I was able to find enough.  They don't offer hormone free meat though...making a separate trip somewhere else for that.  Costco does have organic chicken - FYI in case you are looking for some.  My bill was way less than shopping at Whole Foods (which I love, but is so expensive!!!). So what exercise are you all doing today?  Anyone started any light weight training or yoga?  Let me know!  Supersally:  What kind of puppies do you have?  I had two border collies but sadly lost them both in the past few years.  I miss having a dog but am not ready now to adopt one just yet.  What a great way to get motivated to exercise!  I am glad you have a support group there - that's awesome!  It must be a tremendous help to have friends to talk to that understand!!! Keep up your good exercise!  I am going to keep trying all through chemo to do my exercise.

I too miss my BFF.  She was on vacation last week for her anniversary on a cruise.  I have not talked to her since chemo other than for a minute.  She is a state away.  She did say she wants to try to come for my last chemo session.  That would be awesome!  She came after my surgery and stayed with me for 3 days.  I miss her a ton. Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 01:12PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies.....you all sound so good!  I am only married 7 years and my hubby keeps it all inside.  He doesn't ever tell me he's scared or anything.  I can tell he is stressed at times and I just wish he would talk to me.  When I ask he just says "I am staying focused on doing everything we can do to get you better".  It's hard because as a woman I am more of a talker and more emotional..he keeps it all under wraps.  I did plan a fun night for him though as a stress reliever.  On Valentine's Day I got him tickets to a Red Wings hockey game.  My brother is taking him out to the game tonight.  I also got my brother a ticket because he took me to get my port put in at the hospital when my hubby was out of town.  So tonight is a guys night for him....they are going out for dinner, a few beers and the hockey game.  I hope he has fun....he has been a trooper. So today is going better....I slept better last night and feel like a new woman today.  I did my 30 min on the elliptical and a few weights but my chest is feeling tight so I backed off a bit.  I went and got my blood drawn to check blood counts and they were normal.  It's officially 1 week after my first chemo.  Let's hope it goes just like this for the next 8 weeks.  Did you all excercise today?  What's everyone cooking for dinner tonight?  Last night I made ravioli and used the wonton wrappers as the noodles.  They came out good.  Stuffed them with a mixture of organic ground turkey, spinach, garlic, onion, herbs, parmesan cheese, egg and some tomato paste.  My 4 year old even loved them.  Tonight is taco turkey burgers.....yep.  Mixing up some diced small veggies with organic turkey meat, egg, wheat bread crumbs and taco spices.  I am going to serve it up with a little organic pepper jack cheese, salsa and sauted poblano peppers/onions.  I need some more cooking ideas....ladies, what are you making that's healthy?  I am always looking for ideas....I love cooking!  Tonight I have to bake more banana muffins.  I made them for me on Sunday.  I make them with honey to avoid refined sugar, egg whites (no fat), and wheat flour.  My hubby and son love them...they ate them all!  I am glad I found something healthy I like, but they ate my stash!  My 4 year old had a melt down this morning because there was only 1 muffin left and he wanted two!  He was mad that daddy ate the other one....I didn't even get one!  LOL!  Oh well...I am happy they like my healthy stuff.  I can't decide whether to start a BC cooking blog or just do a cookbook for BC ladies.  Since I am hormone receptor positive, it's hard to know what is good to eat and I am doing a lot of creating my own recipes so my family can eat what I eat.   I need some cooking inspiration for next week....as I have my menu planned for this week already. Redsky:  I was just thinking about you last night and wondering when the  big day was.  I am so glad you are almost there!!! You will get through this OK.  Please continue to pop in and hang with us!  We will get you back in shape in no time!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2011 10:47AM mdg wrote: Happy Friday my fit gals!  Did everyone exercise?  I did my 45 min on the elliptical and some stretching.  My upper back is still hurting too bad from last week's fill so I laid off the upper body work and just did rehab stretches.  I am afraid to do any more upper body as it really hurt the last time I did so I will just skip it for a week and see how I do.  I don't know what my problem is but today I just want choclate!  I had two small chocolate candies and then I made myself go upstairs to stay away from the kitchen!  If I got near that box again I would be in a chocolate coma for sure which is not good for me!  So what's up for the weekend?  Anything fun?  I am back to baking - my son loves my lowfat muffins and brownies...can't keep them in the house.  We don't have much for plans other than a birthday party so it's just family time which is nice!  Maybe we will watch a movie up in our bed...all 3 of us.  We did that last weekend and it was nice.  I hope you all have a healthy weekend!    Annielynn:  The men are all about the boobs you know.   Just tell him whatever size they are they will be perky even when you are old and that's a bonus regardless of size!   My hubby is obsessed with mine...I am 410cc's and I am small framed (size A+/barely B before surgery).  I swear he is checking them out all the time....I better not go any bigger or he will never leave me alone!  I guess there are worse problems to have...right?  I have friends that have husbands with no interest in them and they have not gone through BLMX so I am lucky, right?  I also want to be a full B or small C and my doc likes to fill larger than what you are going to be.  Yowsa!  I am scared to keep filling.  Hopefully I won't have to.  Anniemomof3:  I too look like coconuts but I think mine are drunk...the R one is sitting higher than than the L one....they are lopsided!  At least you can't tell in clothes.  I have proof....I was at the gym and ran into a friend I have not seen in a long time -she does not know I have BC at all.  I was in a tank top and yoga pants and she never noticed anything...not even the port in my under arm.  I am so glad I am doing cold caps too...no one will ever know unless I choose to tell them.  I am jealous you have an exchange date!  I hope to have my exchange in early June too but I don't finish chemo until the first week of May so who knows when I will get the OK.  Just curious, what did you PS say the 425cc's will yeild cup wise for the exchange?  I am 410cc's and don't see my PS for a few weeks to find this out....Oh and I too love the "hair washing days".  Saturday is a wash day for me...I am so excited to get up and wash my hair tomorrow morning!  I use to dread washing/styling SueBee:  Sorry they couldn't fill...don't worry you will catch up to us "coconut" girls!  It only takes a few fills.....really!  I am glad you are healing and can exercise!  That's great news.....don't you go nuts in zumba or anything...be good!

Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 01:11PM mdg wrote: Happy Hump Day my Fit Girls!  How are you today?  I hope everyone is well.  Today the sun is shining in Detroit and it's warmer!  I wore a jean jacket out today with no winter coat - woo hoo!  Feels like spring to me!  I did my 45 minutes on the elliptical and my PT exercises and some good stretching.  Don't underestimate the stretching ladies...I did 15 minutes today and it really feels good.  Make sure you stretch as our bodies have gotten so tight from a few weeks in bed and all the surgery.  Also I was going to mention you should check your workout shoes and make sure they are still good.  As someone that works out 5 days a week I buy new shoes every few months.  The shoes break down in time and especially if you exercise several times a week you will need new shoes every few months.  I can tell you body parts start hurting when the shoes start to go....when did you all last get new shoes????    SueBee:  I know...the pets just "know" something is going on.  I lost my beloved Sadie (border collie) about 2 years ago but when I was pregnant she slept next to my bed not even in her doggie bed every night!  She was following me everywhere even before I knew I was pregnant.  I had insomnia while I was pregnant and she did too..she would wake up in the middle of the night a lot.  It was strange.  After my son was born, all was normal but she was protective of the baby for sure. Oh how she would have been such a comfort to me through all of this......I miss her.  Hug your pup for me today!  I too have been having all kinds of odd pains in my upper back and sometimes my arm since all the surgery....I don't kwow what it is from.  Glad I am not alone!  Maybe it's age! Annieof3:  It is strangly deceptive..good description.  It makes me feel like I am lying or something...oh well.  Whatever.  I am over it now. Hillck:  those fills are getting me sore too!  I get my fills on Fridays and then I don't exercise on the weekends much (I just to do the rehab stuff) so by Monday I can workout again.  So take a day off if you need to.  The fills are not comfortable and things do get tight.  Try to continue to stretch though if you can.  It always is easiest after a warm shower.  I also liked to do it before bed so I would be less tight and could be more relaxed to fall asleep.  Supersally:  That's a good book.  There's some deep stuff in there about how the body works.....crazy.  I too am doing all the same healthy stuff.  You may want to read my blog later (when I get done).  I am talking about hormones and dairy products and am sharing what I have learned and how to find good products to eat.  I decided to add my learnings on all of this to my blog because I know it's so confusing and thought it may be helpful to others that read my blog.  I will have it posted tonight...I stil have a few things to add.  Redsky:  hang in there girl!  You are doing great!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2011 04:52AM mdg wrote: Today is Friday!  I am off to the gym and I have errands to run.  I always fel busy even though I am off from work.  For those of you interested in nutrition with breast cancer and what to eat/not eat, I started writing about it on my blog the last few days.  I am going to continue with other topics in the coming days as I think it may help anyone reading it.  I talked about dairy and organic food so far.  I am going to write about different kinds of fat, meats, sugar and soy in the coming days in regards to BC - FYI.  We have a busy weekend here.  Tonight I am making black beans and rice for dinner - it's lent so I have to do no meat on Fridays.  I love black beans and rice...yumm!  What are you cooking this weekend?  Still considering starting my breast cancer cooking blog in the coming weeks...you CAN eat good with BC if you do your homework and plan!  Rennasus:  I am jealous you have hiking buddies!  All of my friends work and have young kids...no one has time to do anything so I have to workout alone.  I am sorry about the oncotype wait.....I know waiting is the worst.  Just keep busy to try not to dwell on it.  We will tackle that when you get the results.  Good job on the hikes and keeping fit! SueBee:  I am glad I am skipping the fill!  It finally does not feel like I have bricks in my chest which is a welcomed break.  After the next fill I will be over 450cc's for sure....lordy!  My back feels a little better this morning...I hope the pain goes away soon.  How sore are you legs today?  Hurts so good hu? Annieof3:  I would love another dog I just can't do it with a puppy and breast cancer.  I am actually waiting til later this year to see if I get laid off from work.  If I will be laid off and working out of my home (I have a side business I have been starting while working full time and it's my plan B should I get laid off) I would be more likely to get a dog so I would be home more to take care of it.  WIth my other dogs (I had two highly energetic border collies) I had to hire a dog walker for a few days a week to get them out otherwise they were too rambunctious.  We would walk them when we could in the evening, but being a mom, wife, working full time plus teaching aerobics (oh and all of the entertaining we do) was making it hard.  For now I will continue to dodge my son when he says "when can we get another dog?" .  He wants another border collie just like our other dog....they require a lot of work because they are SO smart and so full of energy and if they don't get that out of their system, the are destructive.  Supersally:  How are you feeling post chemo?  Double up on the water to flush the chemo out of your body.  Just force yourself to drink water.  My SE didn't hit until day 3 post chemo.....I hope you feel good the whole time and have no SE! Annielynn:  WHen do you find out more about the lump on the sternum?  What exactly does your doc think about it?  I hope it is nothing.  HOw does it feel after that fill? I am 410 cc's and the last fill is what messed up my back.  I hope you are feeling ok and the bricks in the chest feeling goes away in a few days.  Is this your last fill or do you have more? I am glad you hit the gym girl!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 05:49AM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...Good morning.  It's Sunday and I am still warding off the chemo side effects.  I feel so much better this time around which is nice!  The whole eating thing is driving me nuts.  I am getting a bread maker for sure as even bread has the crap in it!  I am also going to try to bake once a month (a full baking day) and freeze a ton of stuff I can eat.  I was going to make muffins, brownies, crackers, graham crackers, cookies and pancakes.  I have even found some recipes for baked sweet potato chips that I will try.  I am not a huge snacker but sometimes when you have people over or are on the go you just want to grab something quick and healthy like some wheat crackers or a few pretzels.  I can't believe that every item on the store shelf has soybean oil, safflower oil, sunflowe oil or corn oil.   It's crazy!  My son was having pancakes this morning and they looked SO good...but again contained soybean oil....blech!  I started even looking at vegan recipes for baking because at least they don't contain any animal products.  The hard part is a lot of these things still contain a lot of sugar which is also still bad for us....I just bought some Blue Agave to use in place of sugar as another option to honey.  It has a lower glycemic index than honey too.  What a pain!  I told my husband I am starving but there is nothing to eat in our house that I can have.  I keep shopping and reading labels, but there are no choices at my markets including Whole Foods.  I did find whole wheat pita bread and organic whole grain flour tortillas at Whole Foods that don't have the bad oils, but who pays almost $6 for a few flour tortillas?  Nuts!  I did find some flour tortillas at Trader Joes made with olive oil, but I don't think they were organic.  Whatever.  I feel like I  will be eating sticks and grains the rest of my life.....ick!  For now I snack on wheat pretzels, almonds and apples.  Sometimes you just want something "good" though....oh how I crave tortilla chips and salsa......
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2011 11:38AM mdg wrote: Hey gals!  I feel like we have not chatted in a while.  I am happy to report that I finally washed my hair (it took me days to get up the nerve after the shedding....) but it turned out good.  I am 4 1/2 weeks out from my first chemo and still have a full head of hair!  It's not my normal styled hair (because I can't blow dry and straighten) but it's a full head of long hair down to the middle of my back.  I had to touch up roots with a non-chemical root touch up kit and I have about 1/2 inch of growth since my last dye job which was in February!  So not only do I have hair, it is still growing like normal!   I started using latisse on brows and lashes....it looks like one brow is starting to thin here and there and I have not had to pluck anything for weeks (do you know how much time that saves??) SueBee:  for lipstick I finally gave in and went to Aveda.  I feel like woman again with good lipstick!  I got two shades and like them so far.  I have not tried that specific Burt's Bees lip stuff though but so far had trouble finding organic or more natural lipsticks.  So glad you got go zumba!  I wish we could all go workout together......so wish there was not so much distance between us girls! Supersally:  Good choice on dinner!  Good for you.  I bet it tasted good too afterall.  There is nothing wrong with splurging here and there, but it does feel good to make a good choice and still enjoy the meal!  Another thing that is a great price at Costo is Organic Olive Oil.  I got a large bottle for $9 and some change.  It's Fillipo Berio organic brand too which is what my mama uses (since I was a kid).  Add that to your list.  I was there yesterday and they had a 12 pack of large, organic braeburn apples for $4.99.  There were SO GOOD!  I don't usually see those there..I hope they start carrying them because it's my favorite snack!  I will have to post my good finds at other markets for you guys.  Please do the same as it will help all of us save some money and know what's available.  Those pancakes sound great...you must post the recipe!  I just bought buckwheat with the intention to make a bunch of pancakes and freeze them for quick re-heating in microwave.  I haven't settled on a recipe yet though! As far as getting more veggies...here is my tip.  Once a week I saute a huge pan of the following:  (all organic) mushrooms, onions, garlic, red pepper, parsley, spinach and olive oil.  Through the week I use it for panini sandwiches with lowfat organic cheese, toss it in whole wheat orzo with parmesan as a side for dinner, throw it on wheat pizza crust with a sprinkle of parmesan for healthy pizza, put it over chicken, toss it with brown rice.  By the end of the week it has been eaten and if it's that easy because it is already cooked you can easily get creative.  You could even throw a layer over some wheat lasagna noodles with sauce and some organic ricotta for veggie lasagna.  Just an idea.....it's working for me. Rennasus: Glad you are going hiking.  I am being lazy today...I rest on the weekends after my M-F workouts right now.  I feel great!  I had a decent time getting through chemo #2 with minimal side effects. I was busy this week...not much time for blogging with my DH out of town.  I want to blog about fats....oh there is some bad stuff in the fats in our pre-packaged foods (from Anti Cancer book).  It shocks me how the bad crap is in EVERYTHING!  Don't get me started....I am so jealous it is 90 degrees there!  I was happy it was just a bit sunny this morning....it's still a bit cold but getting warmer slowly.  My hyacinths are coming up...crocus still blooming. Tulips are coming up too.  Can't wait til they actually bloom! I want to get some pansies in my pots in the next week or two! I just wanted to share that this month's Cooking Light (April) magazine is worth picking up.  Not only does it have some GREAT recipes (I have picked too many to try in the coming weeks!) but there is a really good article on Whole Grains and another really good article on Meats (grain fed animals vs. grass fed animals)  really worth reading!  I would pick it up if you can or at least read a bit at the store when you have a few minutes.  The article on whole grains really explains the differences and what kinds are the best and how much you should have.  Let me know if you pick up the magazine.  Would love to hear what you think.  You fit gals have a FAB weekend!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2011 06:27PM mdg wrote: Renasus:  Don't worry about "hijacking"...there is no hijacking.  We are all here to vent, support, laugh, share experiences and a little bit of exercise!  As far as the recipe....here's what I did: 1 lb ground chicken (you could use turkey I suppose) 2 - 3 cups baby spinach 1 med onion 3 cloves garlic salt, pepper, dried oregano 1 egg 1/2 cup whole wheat bread crumbs 1/3 cup parmesan cheese 5 or so sundried tomatoes (the kind packed in oil) Olive Oil Preheat oven to 375 degrees.  Grind up the garlic, onion, sundried tomato and spinach in the food processor and place in a large bowl (I used a small food processor and did each ingredient separately to make sure they were fine).  Add in egg, parmesan, bread crumbs, salt, pepper, oregano and ground chicken.  Mix well.  Lightly oil a cookie sheet with the olive oil.  Form small meatballs about 1 1/2 inches big and place them on the cookie sheet.  Bake in the oven for a total of 30 minutes, turning them every 10 minutes or so using a thin spatula so they don't fall apart.  Once cooked, put them into your favorite tomato sauce and cook for an additional 45 minutes or so to add flavor to the sauce. *I had to guess on the measurements as I am Italian and we don't know how to measure anything (LOL!).  If you need to add more of something, go for it.  The meatballs didn't really taste like the sundried tomatoes but they had good flavor and it was just right with the tomato basil sauce I made.  My son loved them...a good way to sneak some spinach in him secretly too!  Anniemomof3:  Please tell my you got out of your jammies today???!!!  I don't want to kick you in the butt!  Ha ha!  Glad you got to work out and do the poop clean up!  What fun! SueBee:  20 miles!  That's awesome!  What a great way to get exercise.  I wish it was nice enough to do anything outside here.  We had horrible thunder/lightning last night like crazy!  I too hate the uncertainty of the PS with the size thing.  I guess 375 will have to do.  Oh well.  I will take that as long as I don't have issues with the permanent implants.  Silia:  Look at you and the exercise!  That's awesome!  Keep up the exercise...whatever you can do.  It's a start and a step in the right direction!  As far as the TE issue, it's small considering all the other crap we have had to deal with.  I am OK with it.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2011 01:04PM mdg wrote: Hey Ladies!  So nice to hear from all of you.  I did the elliptical yesterday and took a step aerobics class today.  I also had PT today.  I had another fill yesterday - now I am 470cc's.  Holy boobs!  I have one more fill and then I get the exchange in June.  So far this time the fill did not hurt really at all.  I do believe the stretching and PT have really done there job.  No back pain either which is great news after the last fill that was horrible.  SueBee: That's great on the fill.  YOu are exchanging to a 350cc implant?  I am going to do a mid 400 range implant (maybe 450cc's).  My doc says that will make me a C.  I hope so.  I filled to 410 and it looked like me in my slightly padded bra before surgery so I decided to go just a little bigger.  We will see what happens...... Redsky:  What did your doc say about the black stool?  That can be an issue with GI bleeding...I don't want to worry you, I just want to make sure you are OK.  I hope you are feeling better....Hugs!  It will get better.  I can honestly say that 2 months after my surgery is the BEST I have felt in the past few years!  All of my other body aches are gone (injured foot and hip) because I have been taking such good care of myself.  You will feel better....a little more each day!! Hang in there.  Soon you will be like me - 9 weeks out and feel wonderful.  Supersally:  I have chemo next week.  How do the weeks in between go SO FAST????  Ugh!  Good luck!  I hope you do OK this round.  Melanie:  Awesome on the 10K.  You amaze me!  How did chemo go?  I hope you have NO side effects this time......hugs! Annieof3:  Wow you world traveler!  Sounds so fun and so needed!  I hope you are rested and feeling better.  My hemoglobin and iron are low from the chemo now.  I am taking Iron pills and hope it helps.  I keep eating spinach...gave up red meat so not doing that.  Trying to build up the iron but they told me it does not rebound quick..takes time.  I hope you are healing up well.  I picture you at the beach or pool with that hat and sunglasses looking like a movie star or something!  How did it work in a bathing suit?  I am so scared of the TE's in my bikini.  I guess I have to go shopping for a new bathing suit to get me through early summer with the TE while the stores have a good selection.  Here is the first recipe for our collection. My husband LOVES this one (it's my own recipe) and always has seconds.  Tomato and Artichoke Bruschetta Chicken 4 boneless chicken breasts (I use organic) 9 oz artichokes (from jar or frozen and thawed) - quartered (can't find any organic) 4 fresh vine ripened or roma tomatoes diced (I use organic) 1T balsamic vinegar 1T Olive Oil 1 cup chicken broth (I use organic) ¼ cup bread crumbs (I use whole wheat) ¼ cup parmesan 3 T basil - chopped fine (fresh - organic if possible) S & P Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees.  Pour chicken broth into casserole dish (11x 13 or so).  Place chicken breasts in casserole dish.  S & P chicken to your liking.  In a bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients and toss well.  Spoon the mixture over each chicken breast to cover most of it.  Cover with tin foil and bake for 25 minutes.  You may need to cut into chicken to see if it is cooked through depending on how big chicken breasts are.  When chicken is almost done, remove tin foil and bake 5 more minutes to let top get a little color.  I like to serve this with organic brown rice and steamed broccoli with EVOO and garlic.  Calories:  240; Fat:  7.6 grams; Carbs:  21 grams; Fiber:  5 grams;  Protein:  23 grams Let me know if you give it a try.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 11:08AM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...I am in the chemo chair now.  I finished the chemo but have a few more hours of cold caps.  We will be here until 5:30pm for sure.  No exercise for me today but I hope to hit the gym tomorrow as well as go to the mall and treat myself to Pandora ring #2 (I am getting one for each chemo treatment).  I can't wait to go pick another one out!  It is going by fast though.  We had a great lunch, chicken, spinach and roasted red peppers topped with homemade Taziki sauce on multi grain sandwich rounds.  I and apple slices and whole grain pretzels along with pumpkin spice muffins for dessert.  Now I am chugging the water to flush that crappy chemo out of my body.  I will write more later tonight.  I hope you are all having a fit day!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 02:02PM mdg wrote: You guys are the best.  I feel so happy when I chat with all of you.  I got my exercise in and my PT exercises done for the day.  Feel a little tired...maybe the chemo is catching up with me a little.  Right now I too have stopped reading a lot of the scary stuff on this site.  Every now and then I see an active post listed at the top and I click on it.  Then it ends up being on the Stage IV board and I get all freaked out!  I have decided to stop going there.  I am on the Cold Cap Thread, here and the Chemo Lounge thread.  I do try to offer support to newbies because so many were kind to me when I first got on here.  Other than that, I am focusing on diet and exercise.  With the Anti Cancer book I am overauling everything we eat and have in our house.  I am trying to find a new normal.  It is working for me and my family last night...it was nice to see my 4 year old eat a full plate of pasta tossed in tomatoes, spinach, ground chicken last night!  He now loves spinach and ate a whole serving of garlic green beans the other night without arguement.  I am so glad I can teach him how to eat healthy at such a young age!  Like I said, he even likes my healthy muffins.....go figure!  As far as surgery, I spoke with the surgeon and explained my pending lay off at work in addition to the added stress of waiting.  He was very understanding about my company announcing another re-org with lay offs and scheduled me for June.  They called me back yesterday and told me that if there was an emergency surgery that week I would be the one bumped but they try not to do that unless they are completely stuck...they wanted me to know there was a slim possibility.  I asked when I would be rescheduled if it happens...she said within a week or two.  I guess there is nothing better I can do.  I will pray.  We just rebooked our vacation....I have two reservations held right now and am waiting for my friend's final vote (we are going to the Outer Banks and renting a huge house with pool with 4 other families!).  We are going August 6th. If my surgery gets delayed, I told my friends they can just wait on me hand and foot all week and carry my bags up to my room.  I am not putting anything else on hold that is fun right now!  I am done with that and plan on going on vacation!  Oh and the other PS did call back and was willing to take me if I needed to change.  Nice to know I have an option.  SueBee:  My boobs look huge right now!  At leas this is bigger than what my real impants will be....my hubby is obsessed with them but that is a whole other story I won't go into.....and just think, I was worried he would no longer find me attractive after surgery....don't know what I was thinking! Renasus:  So glad you are healing well.  That is great news!  I am glad you found a new trail...maybe some new motivation to keep you moving!  Fabulous!  I am glad you can start fills in May.  It's fun to watch them grow!  I have been waiting all my life for the "booby fairy" to come....and she finally came! Annieof3:  glad you are staying away from the other stuff...me too.  I get too freaked out.  I need to stay positive and focus on what I can do to be healthy and get through all of this.  I am reading the Anti Cancer book.  I also read the Foods That Fight Cancer book....both are great and really help you overhaul things.  I am LOL at the coconuts.  I am worried about getting through Memorial Day weekend and early June covering these things up!  I think I will go shopping for a suit now.  I am going to find something that looks distracting....maybe a print or one that has the straps that come up and tie behind the neck.  I am a bikini gal...don't know how I am going to keep them both in a top since they are uneven.  Should be interesting......hopefully I won't be kicked out of the public pool! Silia:  I too am considering therapy just to cope with all that has happend.  Right now I didn't schedule it because I am still going to PT twice a week, getting weekly fills, chemo every three weeks and a blood draw weekly.  I just don't want any more appts!!!! I finish PT after next week I think so now may be a good time.  I think there is so much to process that it will help to have someone to talk to and provide perspective.  I hope it helps you through all of this.  It is one LOOOOONG road!  Glad you have a personal trainer....that should be some great movitation!  Do whatever exercise you can - when you can.  If you have 10 minutes, go for a walk.  You don't have to do some big, structured activity to get exercise in.  Try do to a little each day!  You can do it and you will feel better when you do.  Supersally:  Good luck tomorrow in the chair.  I will be thinking of you.  I am always so busy the day before chemo too....trying to get everything organized and meals prepared for a few days in case I feel crappy.  I hope it goes well and you feel great!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2011 06:14PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...it was 80 and sunny today!  Ya hoo!  Felt like summer is really going to come!  It was such a good feeling to open the windows and air out the house too!  The sun is not kind to chemo gals...I am Italian and never burn.  I did not burn but my arm has itchy bumps on it from the sun I am sure.  No more sun for me until chemo is long over I guess. I wanted you to know I am seriously considering starting a cooking blog using the principles in the Anti Cancer book.  I talked to my DH about it and he was even excited as he loves to cook too (we had guests over for dinner last night..he made chicken marsala, orzo with garlic/parsley, garlic green beans, and a spinach salad with goat cheese, almonds, goat cheese and sundried tomatoes).   I am trying to figure out how I am going to juggle my new art business, cooking blog, full time job, aerobics classes, being a mom/wife, working out and taking care of me.....  Yes I am completely type A and completely crazy (pazzo completo in Italiano).   I really want to do it though and my husband wants to contribute with me on the blog.  It would be fun to do it together...we are both foodies and cook together all the time.   You will be the first people to know about it when I get it going.  Rennasus: I am so jealous you are near a beach....the best I can do is the Detroit River!  Ha!  It's not even worth the effort to get there going downtown and all (it's not a nice area as you can imagine).  I am glad the pizza sounds good...it does feel good to eat REAL food that is actually healthy.  My son loves making pizza so it's fun to teach him how to cook and he is learning about healthy food in school (at age 4!) so now he asks me "is this healthy?" before he eats just about everything!  I am so glad I can teach him this at such a young age!  SueBee:  I will have to make the business or the current job work...there are NO jobs in Detroit since the auto companies are the only industry here.  THe unemployment rate is really high here.  I don't even want to think about it.  I hope you can find something job-wise.  I am so jealous you got BFF time.  Mine is 5 hours away.  She is coming for my last chemo for 2 days though.  I can't wait to see her!  She is also coming in early June with her kids for the weekend.  She is also going on vacation with us in August.  I am so glad I get to see her so much.  We try to talk on the phone but it is usually limited to her time driving to/from work when we don't have kids around or dinner to make.  It was almost 80 degrees here today!  I guess I have to paint my toenails tomorrow - it will be sandal season!  Have you ever tried turkey burgers?  I do all kinds...southwest, italian, greek...if you add a lot of seaonings and stuff they are really good!  I do it as an alternative to beef.  Just another guilt free idea. MelanieAnn:  sorry you felt so bad...glad you are getting better.  I am so jealous you can do a 10K run.  I use to run and would run one longer run each week - 6 miles or so and a few shorter runs (3/4 miles).  I have not gotten back into it for longer runs since my son was born (he's 4 1/2).  The most I have run in the past few years is 4 miles.  I keep having injuries......so I have avoided it.  I actually have wanted to start running again but figure my docs will have a fit if I do it now.  Oh well....maybe later this summer when I am done with chemo...then I can do whatever I want without getting grilled about it.  That is awesome on the running.  I now have a new goal.......thanks for the inspiration!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 08:06PM mdg wrote: Hi all.  I have been so busy again today...I did hit the gym and did the elliptical for 45 min.  I also had PT today.  My back is really feeling better...maybe I can get that other fill after all in the coming weeks!  That would be nice.  I am going to call the nurse tomorrow and have her talk to the PS.  So far with chemo ok but the side effects are starting a bit tonight like last time.  I just start getting sensitive tissue around my upper back skin, neck and jaw area.  Yes...I had to have the stupid neulasta shot again so I am sure I will be in the "chemo cave" for a few days again this round.  Boo!  It especially stinks because dear hubby has to travel for work Mon-Wed next week and last time Tuesday was the worst day I had.  I pray it's better this time....on the bright side...the GI tract is working so far....I hope that continues so I don't have issues like last time!  (someone say a prayer for me on that!!!!)  On the not so bright side I had a little shedding start today which is 22 days post my first chemo.  Even with cold caps there are shedding periods.  I just hope it stops.   Feeling nervous....talk me off the ledge please!  Annie of 3:  Here is the link to the ring I got after chemo 1:  http://www.pancharmbracelets.com/content/product.cfm?sessionid=59878311094205565&site_id=4&color=&pricerange=0&item_id=21824 Here is the link to the ring I got today:  http://www.pancharmbracelets.com/content/product.cfm?sessionid=59878311094205565&site_id=4&color=&pricerange=0&item_id=12123&parentCategory_id=0&category_id=184&startRow=65&searchValue=&currentPage=5 They have so many cute rings...you just stack a few different one's on the same finger.  I love it.  I also got my sister the same ring as I got from chemo 1 as a thank you for helping with my cold caps yesterday and taking the whole day off to be with me.   Now we are ring twins.....so lucky to have her.    SueBee:  The workout went well for me today...I am on steroids so I have energy like crazy.  That bike thing your are talking about sounds cool.  What a good workout!  I don't know if they have that at my gym...may have to look into that!  Good job getting a good workout in.  It will prepare you well for the real outdoor bike rides when it's not so cold up here!  It got pretty darn cold again here in MI today. I want spring to come!!!! Redsky:  that's great that all is going well!  After like 2 fills you feel like a woman again!  Keep up the range of motion exercises after the fills.  I always got so tight again for a few days after fills.  I usually do the stretches after a hot shower when I am warmed up and again before bed so I loosen up so I can sleep well and not be so tight when I lay down.  I noticed that after each fill it would take about 5 days for me to feel not so tight but I was getting 100cc's on some fills which was a lot!  Keep us posted.  You are doing great!!! Supersally:  what a wonderful day!  I so wish I could have been with you....that lunch is making me hungry now!!!!  I know what I am having tomorrow...as it is Friday during lent so no meat for me....I usually do omelettes for lunch if I am home on Friday.....sounds so good.  I am jealous it was warm...it was 20 degrees this morning...brrr!  I am glad those pups are keeping you going if I am not around - ha ha!  I also went to the mall today and got my rings (link at the top) and went to Aveda and treated myself to some more make up.  Two new shades of lipstick to give my face some life.  It felt good!  Rennasus: that is great news!  I know what you mean on this stuff.....it seems like you are always waiting for the other shoe to drop and it's hard to really relax.  For me oncotype was 17 but I am grade 2, pre-menopausal and had angiolymphatic invasion present.  I am going the chemo route...it stinks, but I have to for my son and husband.  I am so happy for you.  I too will get tamoxefin when I am done...just another adventure after chemo I guess.  All of this is so emotional...it's hard to believe good news...but you did get good news so try to relax and celebrate.  You can pull me up from my chemo hangover in the coming week as you will have the strength...I need your strength on this one my friend!  I think you should make those brownies I posted and celebrate a little... :)  Now you can focus on healing that incision and move on.  Stay focused on that.

Saturday night DH is taking us out (he doesn't know that yet....but he is - he he!).  I hope you all exercised for me today!  What else are you cooking for dinner the next few nights?  I am working on next week's menu..... Sue Bee, Rennasus and Annie:  So glad you all worked out today!  NICE!!!! I will join you tomorrow.  No excuses ladies...If I workout the day after chemo, you all have to workout!

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2014 05:26PM mdg wrote: Kristin, So sorry you find yourself here among us.  The beginning is the hardest part.  Once you get details and a treatment plan, it somehow gets a little easier.  Take it one step at a time.  This is a horrible time of year to be diagnosed.  For me next week will be 4 years since my diagnosis.  This time of year always reminds me of what happened.  Just know that in time life does return back to something more normal.  Hugs!

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2011 06:51PM mdg wrote: Hey gals....hope you all had a great day.  I did the elliptical and had more energy than yesterday which was good.  I have to just vent for a minute.......I am so bummed!  I emailed the aerobics director that I was ready to come back to teaching and she emailed me back and basically told me in an email that she replaced me with another instructor on my Sat class but I could still teach on Monday.  (Monday night is a small class and she has always had trouble getting anyone else to teach but me!  Can you believe that????.  I kind of feel used....like I am not good enough for Sat but I am good enough for the time slot she has no other instructors for. I have taught there for 9 years!  I emailed her back and politely told her to shuv it and rubbed it in her face that I was out for BC and it never crossed my mind that while I was fighting cancer I would be replaced.....I totally played the "cancer card" and I don't care!!!!  I am soooo bummed.  I never even got to say good bye to my class. I have known many of these people for 9 years.  I guess I will email the few people from my class I coorespond with and tell them what happened and try to meet them out for breakfast on a Saturday.   I am just so sad about this.  I have decided it is OK to be sad about this today but I will not waste time and energy stressing over it like the "pre cancer" Maria would.  I am going to let it go and move on and find another place near my home to teach (that club was 30 min from my house but we use to live over there so I kept teaching there for the past 7 years after we moved because of the people in my class).  I am taking a deep breath and moving on.....I guess I have to put together my aerobics resume now.  Another thing...I don't have to worry about whether to tell my class I had BC or not anymore...I guess it won't really matter, right?  Enough said on that.....or as Forest Gump says "I don't have anything else to say about that".   I hope you all had a healthy day!  It is a short week - yea!  I am going to get the Easter goodies ready tomorrow.....Jayden is so excited!!  SueBee:  I too had boob greed...I am 510cc's now.....that makes me very greedy considering I was an A+ or very small B before BLMX!  I am excited about finally having clevage!  (so is my DH!).  I never thought I would fill this much.....but the boob greed got me!  I hope to be a C too with a 450cc implant.  That's my plan......  Did you ZUmba today???  Hope so! Supersally:  Nice little rack you have going at 480cc's!  You are almost catching up to me!  What size implant will your PS use at exchange?  Just curious....  Good for you going out without the wig.....who cares what people think?  You are beautiful and this stupid BC does not define you at all girl!  Did the person you know ask you about your hair?  Just curious what someone would say to you in that situation....I can't imagine saying anything if I ran into someone I knew that no longer had their hair.....So glad you got to workout a bit....it will keep you moving!  My PS also does fat grafting from thighs and make nipples from the tummy.  I asked if it would be like liposuction and a tummy tuck and he said no.  He said they need such small amounts it would not really be noticable.  Should I ask him to use a lot of fat then and make huge nipples??? LOL!  I was hoping for lipsuction and a small tummy tuck in all of this too! Annie:  Glad the girls are "perfect".  That's nice to hear.  My PS does the fat grafting when he does nipples which is 3 months after exchange at the quickest.  It will be a long time before I have everything done....probably next year since he won't do tatto's until 3 months after nipples.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 05:41PM mdg wrote: Hey gals...eventhough I had no "formal" workout today...one can get a workout chasing a 4 year old around a water park from 10-4pm!  Lord...I walked the lazy river as he floated in it....for what seemed like hours.  Have you ever walked in thigh high water for hours?  My quads really felt that!  We had a great time.  I did come home to find I must have picked up some infection from the pool...one toe is swollen, painful and warm to touch.  I called my sis (the chemo onc nurse) and she said soak it in epsom salts twice tonight and call the dr tomorrow.  Great......hu?  Oh well....it was a really fun day though.  Felt like a mini vacation except DH wasn't there with us.  I do have an update the aerobics thing...so instead of sending the message I was going to email (in which I politely was going to tell her to shuv it) I simply asked for clarification and said "If I understand your email correctly, you no longer need me on Sat and I have been replaced by Sue?".  She sent me a long email saying "that's not what I meant...I am sorry, blah blah blah".  The odd thing is the first message talked about how great the class was going with the other instructor and that the class is so much bigger now (that's a real slap in the face, but whatever).  So now I think she is backpeddling but she said I can teach all of my classes in May if I want.  I think I will go back and teach for May but look elsewhere.  Then I can see my class and say good bye if I leave.  I think she is going to see how the class numbers are and if they go down put the other instructor in.  I am over it.  I will teach what I can in May but look elsewhere because I am sick of dealing with her and want to remove stress from my life.  It's aerobics...it's suppose to be fun, right?  In the meantime...I am still going to bug all you ladies about your workouts! Annie: Your dinner sounds so good.  I love sundried tomatoes and always try to find ways to include them!  That is so awesome that you finish on Monday.  What are you doing to celebrate that when you are feeling good????  Retail therapy?  Spa day?  Dinner and tons of wine???  I can't wait to be done in 2 weeks (not like I am counting or anything.....).   Maybe we should start posting an exercise of the day along with the meal of the day.  I am working out with my sister tomorrow and told her I was going to make her do the really sore hamstring exercise with me so we can both be in pain in the coming days.....he he! SueBee:  Love the marsala recipe.  I make mine with shallots, EVOO, WW flour, chicken stock, marsala and tons of mushrooms.  Now I am craving it....no, there is no more in the freezer - I ate it the other day!  Did you get to workout today?  I love the green onion tip.....very cool.  I often have some left over and don't know what to use it in and it goes bad.  I will remember that.  I also do that with chopotle peppers in adobe.  A small can has several in there and since they are so hot I can't use much and then  I have leftovers.  I put 1-2 peppers in a baggie or small tupperware and freeze it for the next batch of chili or something else spicy.  Redsky:  I am fillled to 510 in a 350 cc TE right now.  They are not really bad....not as hard as I thought they would be really so don't let that stop you.  I am going for a 450 cc implant at exchange which my doc thinks I will give me a C cup.  Isn't it funny how all of our docs have a different formula for size?  I don't know who to believe.  Whippetmom told me I would probably want a 425-450 cc implant based on my measurements.  OH and I had surgery on 1/27 and I have only vacuumed twice (yes I have cleaning people come every 2 weeks but I have been avoiding it and milking it...he he!).  As far as the swimsuit I have one from before surger that worked without the padding in it (LOL!).  I can't believe it fits these boobs considering I use to wear it before as small as I was.  Boy it must have really sagged....even with the padding before surgery.  Oh well....this is a 3 piece set I have.  It has a bikini top, long top that covers tummy and bottoms.  THe bikini top has the triangle type shaped fabric over the boobs and ties behind the neck.  The trick is that the triangle part needs to come up higher to hide my ugly R side (TE is really high and looks like a shelf).  There is also a thin strip of fabric that goes under the breasts that is about an inch thick and is flat and then ties behind the back.  I like this because some of the bikini's are like a string bikini which has a thin string like thing that goes under the breasts and ties in back (and you feed the triangle boob part on to it - do you know what I mean?).  The string one's move around too much....look for one that has more fabric under the boobs.  I hope that helps.....I don't know how to describe that! Anyway....ladies it's a long weekend for some of us so enjoy.  I am spending tomorrow with my little guy as he's off school.  Yes - I am working out first thing in the morning so you all better hop to it too!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2011 12:29PM mdg wrote: GMA:  welcome!  We are always talking exercise and good food so please join us.  I will even give you a gentle kick in the butt if you don't exercise with us (once you can of course!).  SueBee:  I looked at the may with EVOO and it still had the bad oils in it.   Did you find any that is free from the bad stuff?  I was never a huge mayo fan but now and then or for egg salad especially I like it (the low fat stuff though...not full fat - ick!).  As far as the weights...I too am laying low on upper body other than some light things and focusing on legs for now until my port is gone and PS gives me the OK.  I think once my port is out that shoulders, biceps and triceps would be OK.  I will probably not do heavy overhead shoulders...more lateral raises, posterior exercises and anterior  exercises for shoulders only.  I think I will wait on back and chest and just continue stretching them.  I wanted buff ams for summer so I have to get this dang port out! Tonight's dinner for us is chicken enchiladas in a green chili sauce.  I add in food processed white beans with the chicken to add more fiber and to hide them from my son!  Works like a charm.  I will get it on the cooking blog.  I am having a hard time getting it started with some editing challenges, but hopefully it will be up soon!  Did my 60 min on the elliptical today and I was a maniac!  I had a lot of energy and I have no idea why but it was nice to burn almost 600 calories!  No wonder why I was so hungry at lunch!  OK and off topic here, but who is watching the big wedding on Friday?  I am a sucker...I will be watching......I rember watching Diana's wedding when I was young(er).
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2011 05:51PM mdg wrote: Supersally:  I am off from work so I do have time to exercise.  I don't know how I will do it all when I go back to work next month...dreading that!  SueBee:  I have been changing things one thing at a time too.  It's so overwhelming.  Now I am trying to get rid of all plastic food containers/tupperware and switch to glass with BPA free lids.  I still am not happy with all of my new make up so that's a work in progress.  I changed toothpastes last week.........I feel like this is never ending.... Dinner tonight at my house was a stirfry with broccoli slaw, carrots, onion, red pepper and chicken served over organic brown rice.  So glad my 4 year old ate it!  He is doing well with many of my  changes which makes my life sooooo much easier!  We also had apple slices on the side.  I have also been baking healthier things for my son to eat.  For breakfast he is on the go and likes to eat when he gets to school so usually he wants a granola bar or nutrigrain bar (both full of sugar - ick!).  I have been making him whole grain/lowfat and low sugar banana muffins which he loves.  Today I also made him some healthy corn muffins (he loves the fatning bad corn bread).  He loved them...they were with whole wheat pastry flour, cornmeal, honey, egg whites, canola etc....  I am going to have to bake a lot before going back to work and freeze things.  I am trying to get away from the packaged foods for him as much as I can.  This is a full time job!  This afternoon I watched a replay of Charles and Diana's wedding....so hard to believe it was so long ago!   Makes me sad to think that she is gone...sad story - certainly no "Happily ever after" for her.  I hope Wills and Kate do better...... Hit the gym tomorrow ladies......come on gals!  It's almost the weekend.

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 02:40PM mdg wrote: Chrissy:  I am sorry you are having such pain. I am not sure I can answer your question exactly as I had BLMX with immediate reconstruction with tissue expanders.  I can tell you having the TE's under my pec muscles and expanding them with fills weekly had caused me SO much tightness.  I worked with a PT 2 days a week for several weeks and did the PT exercises faithfully twice a day for at least 6 weeks post op.  I started walking about 2 1/2 weeks post surgery and was back at the gym doing cardio and my PT exercises and streches about 4 weeks post OP.  I don't know exactly what cording is, but my tightness was in the peck muscle itself and where it inserts up into the upper arm area.  My PT use to massage that area and manually stretch me which helped.  I also started doing more stretches on my back and letting my arms/elbows fall open to stretch the pecs about 1 1/2 months post op and that really helped me.  I do not want to recommend any specific exercises/stretches as your doctor and PT may not approve....but if you are not getting relief I would be talking to the PT.  If he/she has not worked with MX patients before I would get another referral.  My PT was great and extremely knowledgeable on MX which was a benefit to me.  I can tell you I had surgery 1/27 and had tissue expanders put in.  I was tiny chested before.  I now have 510 cc's in each TE and have NO tightness in chest/pecs at all.  I believe doing the PT stuff, stretching and exercising did it for me.  Best of luck!  I hope it gets better for you soon.  Hey ladies.....I am enjoying Saturday with family. I got my blog started with only a few things posted right now.....I have some formatting issues and editing I can't figure out yet but at least I got it up and running for a start.  I have more recipes to add.....oh if I only had more time!  I will get on it in the next few weeks and add some things in.  Link should be below.....The Healthy Cucina is the name.  Tonight I made chicken marsala burgers.  If they taste good I will post the recipe!   Cross your fingers...they smell soooo good!  Making me hungry! SueBee: That's great on the job interview....sending GOOD vibes your way on that.  It is SO hard to plan anything for the future with all the treatments and surgeries...I am trying to have some fun along the way though.  I can't wait to spend a weekend with my boys in Chi-town!  Will be a blast.  I am going to splurge and get Garrett's Popcorn and some pizza....you have to live a little right???  So a trip to NH?  That would be a looong drive, or would you fly?  By the way - where are you in Ohio?  I can't remember if I asked.  I use to live in Cinci.  I LOVE your dedication to exercise on Friday night....good job!  I hope it warms up a bit so we can enjoy the days outside.  It was only about 60 here today.  Not bad though... Annie: I get done this Wed.  I will let you know how it goes.  Did this last round for you make you feel crappy?  Sorry.....but you know, it was your LAST one girl!  Once you get feelin' better you won't have to worry about that nasty old chemo again!  Well gals...it's the weekend so I have no exercise to report.  I take the weekend off to rest.  I ate a lot today though....I am on steroids from an allergic reaction from last week and they are making me hungry!!! I tried to be good...popcorn popped in organic EVOO with just a bit of salt.  Then the lowfat whole grain banana muffins started calling me.....ohhhhhh sooo good.  Will post them in the blog. Have a good weekend.  What are you ladies cooking this weekend???

Can you believe it?  I am a bit nervous...worried people will ask too many questions or notice my large boobs...going to wear something a little baggier on top to hid the girls.  They don't know I had BC at all.  Anyway it should be fun.  It's suppose to rain here all weekend...boo!  Oh well.  I introduced my son to the movie ET last weekend...we may have to curl up on the couch and watch it again.  He wants to see it again....he loved it.  I did my workout today.  I did just the elliptical...I just wasn't up for weights and my legs are sore from yesterday.  I am back on the steroids for the rash. It seems a little better today.  Now they think it may be a reaction to the chemo....fun fun!  Glad that's over so it hopefully won't happen again.  Ick!  Anyway gals...have a great weekend.  Be healthy!!!  Renn: I am glad you had a good hike.  Watch those snakes girl!  Scary!  I guess we have nothing like that here in Detroit....no rattlers (thank goodness!).  Hiking and girl time....gosh I a jealous!  I wish we were closer..I would join you.  I am just so happy that you are healing better........what a relief. Posts.Content: May 15, 2011 04:23PM mdg wrote: So it is raining and freezing here today...down in the 40's.  We just got home and turned the heat on!  Yikes!  Glad I did not plant flowers in my pots outside yet..they may freeze tonight.  We went to see my 6 year old neice in an ice show this afternoon....so adorable!  I was a competitive figure skater growing up so it was so cool to see her in the show at the skating rink that I started skating at when I was five!  It was so cute...all the little girls in costume and make up!  I don't get to do this stuff since I have a boy so it was really fun for me.  Poor hubby was realizing he was greatful we have a boy and no girls....he's a sports guy.  That show seemed long to him I think.....too many tu tu's I suppose.  Oh well.....it's good for him.  I sit through baseball and football games on TV all the time!  I tried out my new bread maker last night and made cinnamon wheat bagels.  They were good but I need to add in more cinnamon next time....I will post on the blog when I get it perfected in case anyone likes bagels.  I am going to do some different varieties too.  I can't find any bagels that don't have soybean oil/white flour.  I have not had a bagel in months so it was a treat today!  I teach aerobics again tomorrow night.....I will see my other class again!   Hopefully no one will ask too many questions.....ugh!  I hope you all have a healthy week!  I posted a recipe for Italian Wedding Soup the other day on my blog....it's SOOOO good.  Got me through chemo.  I made a few batches and it's my ultimate favorite (probably because of the tiny meatballs and spinach......).    Supersally:  Eat what you want during chemo...I let myself do more than I should on some things because it was all that I could taste (lost my tastebuds...still not back) and it was all that sounded good. I am trying to be healthy but trying to heal my body from the chemo too.  Some days are better than others.  When you are done with chemo and the body gets back to normal it will be easier to make better choices.   Don't feel bad...we went out today to a restaurant and I could not really find anything healthy to eat....ended up with a small bowl of tortilla soup and low cal black bean roll ups but they were on white flour tortillas.....I completely forgot that when I ordered them...oh well!  I am not perfect either girl!  Roll with it.  The party sounds so sweet!  Now I am craving lemon cake........bad, bad!!!  Is this your last chemo?  I can't remember.....gosh I hope it is!  What day are you in the chair? SueBee:  I have just tried to leave it as I had some lifting restrictions from my surgery and that's why I was out so long but I have been working out lower body all along.  People are so direct!  I can't believe it.  This same person asked me last week on the phone too (I am doing a project for her with my business on the side as a favor because I promised to help her months ago) and I had to avoid her question then too.  I am just shocked and felt so uncomfortable!!! Geez!   I also get it about too much DH under foot...we love them but sometimes if they are home a lot it can disrupt things for us!
