Suebee:  I know how it feels to have them jerk you around with e-days.  It is a BIG deal to us and they just don't care sometimes.  My surgeon waits 2 months after your last fill before exchange.....consider yourself lucky you don't have to wait 2 months!  I hope your fill is not hurting horribly for long.....take it easy.  I agree Zumba may not be a good idea today!  So how are you going to clarify what you are doing and when with the doctor? Are you going to call them?  Let us know what happens.  I hope you can get it done soon so you don't have to go all summer uneven.  That would be hard.  Renn:  I am glad you have come to a decision YOU feel good with.  That's great.  What a relief!  As far as the fills, my first two were 100cc's each.  You never know how your body will do...see what your doc says when it's time.  I freaked when my PA wanted to do 100cc's...thinking she was nuts.  It was OK though.   I hope all is still staying healed well on your incisions....I can't wait for you to get some fills.....you too can have "boob greed"! RedSky:  I think my PS is going to do the same implants on me.  Yes, my exchange is scheduled for 6/23.  I don't even see him again until surgery day!  I have to make sure I have all my questions together for that day and discuss the size with him again.  I keep reading posts about people unhappy with their exchange saying implants are too wide...I am scared about that!  My TE"s are already too wide...I hope the implants are narrower!  I hope you all had a healthy day!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 10:13AM mdg wrote: Annie: So nice to hear from you!!!  I am sorry your counts are low..,a big huge bummer!!!  I too am slightly anemic and I keep taking iron pills.  I was told it takes a while to come back up.  My med onc did clear me for surgery though which is 6/23.  I am glad about that.  When can you get your port out?  Is there a reason you need to wait besides your counts?  My arm is really bruised and very sore from getting the port out.  I wonder how long that will last.  When I got it  in I had a softball sized nasty bruise...I hope this doesn't get like that.  Oh well.  Be kind to yourself with your low counts.  If you don't feel up for exercising, sit outside and get some fresh air or take a stroll walk.  You can take your vitamins, eat healthy and sleep well...all of those things contribute to your overall fitness and health.  You will bounce back so be kind to yourself!  Redsky:  Talk to your PT about the tight spots where the muscles insert into arm pits..my PT would massage them regularly and it really helped me a lot!  The area she massaged was on the front down in the arm pit where the pec muscles go in there.   Maybe your PT can help with this on a regular basis and it will make you feel better.  I am sorry about your mom.  As far as chemo my recommendation is to make notes of all side effects she experiences from the first round and try to seek solutions for the next round.  I had bone pain, body aches, constipation, heartburn and I took meds for the followig chemos and did much better and had hardly any side effects.  I hope she does well....saying a prayer for her right now! I did workout today and my chemo legs were dying!  OMG!  My legs are so heavy and feel like a ran a marathon even before I do anything.  I got on the elliptical and after 5 minutes thought I was going to get off and leave.  I did it though...slower than usual but I stayed on there for the full 60 minutes.  Thank God for good TV and good music in the IPod. Now I am pooped.  I treated myself to a healthy brownie (black bean brownies) and am relaxing now...........I thought I would be getting better and have more energy after chemo - maybe it's the anemia like Annie.....who knows.  Oh well........I will keep pushing through.

Annie:  I am DREADING going back to work.  Ugh!  It is especially hard knowing that as soon as DH gets a job I will probably just quit.  For now we are on my insurance and I have my exchange surgery next month so I will work from Tuesday until 6/22 then go out for exchange surgery for another month.  Hopefully by then DH will have a new job....then I can quit.  I am sorry the exchange got delayed....what is with the PS's?  It seems like everyone keeps getting delayed......I am waiting for them to call and reschedule mine.  I will lose it since DH is interviewing and we are trying to coordinate everything around my surgery.  Supersally:  Your weekend sounds busy but so fun!  We leave tomorrow for Chicago as soon as DH gets off work.  I will have everything ready.  It's a 5 hour drive with no traffic but we are driving about 4 hours and I have a hotel about 1 hour outside of Chicago for tomorrow night.  We will get on the move early Sat morning to drive the last hour.  It's just cheaper that way (parking is $45 a night in Chicago!).  Can't wait.....I need Garrett's Popcorn. Anyone ever had it?  It is sooooooooooo good.  I hope it is not painfully warm at the golf event.....90 degrees is hot!  I would be in trouble as I am still fighting this allergic rash from chemo and the heat gets it going worse.  Have a great weekend!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 07:00PM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...work went OK today.  My boss was kind and did not make me work a full day so I hit the gym at 3:30pm!  That was nice....now I have to pack my gym bag or go first thing in the morning before work.  This is going to be hard to juggle everything.  Oh well....it's life.  I am still itching from chemo...the rash is driving me nuts!  Wish it would just go away already!  I am popping a Benedryl as I type this so I can sleep well and not itch while sleeping......I sleep like a baby on xanax and benedryl....what a great combination!  I wish I knew about this months ago - perhaps I would be rested by now!  SueBee:  SOOOO glad you can have your exchange in June!  You will be 10 days before me so you can give me the scoop.  That is certainly great news...not ugly TE's for the summer - yahoo!!!  It is hard to fit the exercise in when life gets in the way.  Glad you are planning to bike. I plan on going to the gym before work tomorrow - that should make for an early morning.  Oh what fun..... Renn:  So I guess you should nap daily and not attend anymore BBQ's...gosh I wish I could not attend BBQs and that would get me out of going to the monster in laws BBQ in two weeks!  I am glad the incision is getting smaller....that is good news.  I am only bummed it is taking it's sweet time in healing completely.  I can't imagine how frustrating this must be for you......I am sorry it has been so uncooperative!  It's not fair!  Too funny your PS was in Vegas.  Maybe he was checking up on you to make sure you were not out dancing and partying with that incision!  Supersally:  thanks for the encouragement with work...I know there will be light at the end of the tunnel but it's nice to hear someone else say it too!  How is your energy level?  I am still a little tired here and there but the itching just won't go away!  I hope your energy level is back.  Have you been able to exercise yet or is the body not ready?  I do need to find a counselor.....now with the pending move I may wait...I don't want to start with one and then have to start all over again.  Since DH has interviews this week/next week I will just see what happens.  If it looks like the move will be soon - I am waiting.  If no job offers I am going to get started.  Gosh I wish someone would give me a do not see or call list - I can think of a few people that have acted less than appropriate to me since my dx that I would like to not see or not call ever again.......(I guess I am a little bitter towards some family members that have not supported us in any way during my BC situation or even acknowledged my BC since dx in Jan).  I guess this gives me even more to talk with a counselor about! (LOL!)  Renn:  Glad your mom did OK.  I know how scary the first chemo is.....once she gets into things she will hopefully know what to expect.  That's too bad her first infusion lasted so long...but glad they were careful and made sure she was responding OK.  My tastebuds were off for a while.....food is finally tasting real again.  It makes eating not appealing when you can't really taste anything.  I hope she continues to eat so she has strength.  Hang in there with the chest pain...mine was like that too for a long time but it went away.  I hope yours will too with time and finishing the fills.  I will check in tomorrow night.....now that I am a working gal again I can't play on the computer all day!  Have a great Wednesday - be fit and healthy!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2011 06:49PM mdg wrote: Today was work day two.  I got out early because I had a follow up appt with my surg onc since I have not seen him since my surgery in Jan.  All was OK.  I am still suffering with the rash from chemo...I broke down and started taking steroids again.  I am completely desperate...right now my neck, chest, shoulders and under my foobs is completely red, irritated and inflammed.  It is so red it looks like a sunburn and the skin just hurts.  I have been dealing with this since Easter.....none of my docs seem to help me.  They keep saying it will go away.  I am getting desperate....I would call the doc back but I don't know who to call...the med onc says "well you are done with chemo so it should go away".  The dermatologist gave me topical steroids and said if it doesn't go away take oral steroids again.  The IM sent me to the dermatologist and told me to come back and see her in 3 weeks (which is next week).  No one will actually follow me through on this...they keep passing the buck.  I am sooooo frustrated and uncomfortable and sick of being ignored by my doctors.  I try so hard to be positive most of the time...I am sorry for the negative message.  I am just suffering and sick of getting no help from my doctors and sick of trying to research how I should "self treat" since they are not doing their jobs......ugh!  My boss commented on my itching and rash...he said he could see the rash spreading up my neck (which is true).  I look horrible!  It is SOOOO red and I have olive skin being Italian at all...it is hard to make me look red!  I am popping a benedryl and xanax shortly and calling it a night so I can have relief..............for a while at least.  Aside from that, I got up early and worked out before work (ick!).  I only had time for the elliptical for an hour.  I don't know how I am going to find time for weights.   I guess I will have to do the weights on the weekend when I have more time.  I will be working from my home office for the next few days and all next week so it will make it easier to head to the gym in the morning before working since I can just shower and not worry about getting fixed up or driving anywhere.  Melanie:  where have you been girl???  Hope you are OK!  What is going on with you these days? Suebee:  Good luck tomorrow..I have a good feeling about you getting the job!  Oh and you surpassed me on the "boob greed" since I am a mere 510 cc's and you are 550.  You go girl!  What size implant will you get???  As my DH says "those are some ginormous boobies" ....ha ha!  I think you get the "largest boob award" in our group!  Anyone going to surpass 550 cc's???  Supersally:  I hear you on the chemo legs...mine have turned a corner in the last few days.... I notice the burning less.  I am 4 weeks out of chemo and you are a little behind me.  Hopefully you will have less chemo legs in the next week.  Hang in there.  It's good you have been able to walk.  You just do what you can do....it's all good for your body.  I am so glad you are getting to take a girls trip.  You deserve it!  WHat do you have planned on the girl trip?  Shopping, lunch, spa, chick flix???  It all sounds fun to me!  I don't remember the last girl trip I had...maybe before I got married (I have been married 7 years....that's frightening....).  When do you leave?   Renn;  I am so glad your PS is so optimistic this will heal OK.  He would not say that if he didn't think it was true.  I know it is taking forever, but getting you healthy before doing anything else is the most important thing.  Hang in there!  I am sorry you too have not had family members be supportive or understanding about your situation.  It has really bothered me....I just don't want to spend time around those people anymore despite the fact that it includes most of DH's family and my own brother and his wife.  I know I should not harber negative feelings about things like this, but it does hurt especially when I am the type of person that tries to help others and be there for others.  I know I have to get over it......I am giving myself time to be bitter for a while and then I need to move on.  I guess I also look at it like this...I now know what I can expect from these people so don't expect anything different than what they have already done (or "not done" if you know what I mean).  On the topic of BBQ's...if you get that "out of control" at a BBQ, I want to party with you girl!!! (ha ha!).  I do hope you rest and get that incision healed up!  I want to hear that it is shrinking in the next few days!!!! Pattibear:  welcome!  I know my PS would not have let me do yoga, but your PS may feel different.  I did not do much upper body stuff for a while but I had a port put in my arm for chemo not long after surgery.  I just got the port out last week and will start doing some weight training for my arms but I have surgery again in 3 weeks.  I would see if your PS will refer you to a physical therapist that specializes in MX patients.  They can give you some exercises and stretches.  Mine also massaged the areas where it was tight in the arm pit (where the chest muscle inserts) and that helped a lot.  It was super tight there.  If your PT gives you exercises and stretches, you can do them with them on the days you are there and then at home on your own the other days.  I did my PT twice a day faithfully and have no tightness at all in my chest.  Shannon:  I do agree it is odd to put my arms up above my head or something when I am sleeping.  It seems like that was hard to do for so long I forget I can do it now!  It feels good.  I can tell you all that stretching daily is SO important.  I don't exercise on the weekends much - I usually take Sat/Sun off.  By Monday, I am definately tighter in the arm pits and chest when I move around.  After I stretch, it feels so much looser.  You can't stop stretching...those TE's try to take control of those muscles I am convinced!  I also didn't know the Cancer Society had a booklet with exercises (my cancer center had their own booklet).  That's good to know because several people have asked where they can get a booklet of exercises.  That's also great you have been able to start yoga again!  I wanted to during chemo but when I got the port in my arm I knew it wouldn't work.  I just got the port out but I have surgery again in 3 weeks.  I guess starting yoga will have to wait until recovery from surgery.......
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2011 05:08AM mdg wrote: Melanie;  So glad to hear the energy and enthusiasm in your post!  Exercise makes the difference....it gives you a boost.  I hope the new PT can fix your arm super fast.  I am glad it is better - that is so encouraging.  We had some storms here too...some of my lawn furniture is in the neighbors yard this morning.  I must have been tired....didn't hear a thing last night.  We will all have to look for some type of protein shake that is not soy.....sounds like we all are interested. Renn:  How is the incision today?   You better be resting.....eating well too.  Suebee: I like "flattered and repulsed".....too funny!  I too have had men check them out but I figure they are wondering why one is an inch higher than the other and why they are in my arm pits..... I am off to meet with my boss this morning.  I will have to hit the gym later today after that.  We are going to some friend's house tonight for dinner....I will be bringing a good salad so I have something to eat with whatever they may serve that is not so good for me.  I know wine will be involved......we always have wine when together.  At least I can taste it again so I may have a small glass.  Hit the gym if you can ladies...it's the weekend and it's too easy to not eat healthy when the weekend comes.  Oh and I have a fab recipe for slow roasted tomatoes I have to post on the blog.  They are sooooo good.  You can make bruschetta with them, toss them in pasta/couscous, put them on meat (chicken or seafood), put them on pizza....whatever.  They taste so good....me and DH are hooked!  I have not been cooking much since going back to work...a bit overwhelmed.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2011 09:29AM mdg wrote: Renn.....i am posting a big concern from my phone...be careful we want you healed!!!!!! I will post tomato recipe this weekend.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2011 09:20AM mdg wrote: Shannon:  Bosum buddies is hilarious!!!!  Job update:  DH is going to Chicago for an in person interview Monday.  Offer from KC coming today and second phone interview with Seattle tonight...........so confusing.  I feel so bad for him.  He is so stressed...maybe I should do something to make him smile.....(that would be sex I imagine).....ugh.  Still have little interest in that these days....thank you chemo...thanks a lot!!! (OK I imagine since we talk about foobs/boobs all day it is OK to talk about sex with you good friends).  Now I wish we could change the name of our thread to Bosum Buddies......there is no way to do that though......I tried :(
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2011 06:23AM mdg wrote: Happy Sunday ladies!  It's a gorgeous day here.  I had my neice and nephew over for a sleep over (ages 7 and 9) last night so I had 3 little one's giggling up in my son's room until after midnight!  Thank God they fell asleep....I was pooped!  We took my nephew to the pool with us yesterday.  While they tackled and dunked DH in the pool, I was hiding in the shade trying to keep my TE's under wraps...that's a big job as you all  know!  LOL!  It was so nice yesterday morning, I took a 40 min walk even on my day off from exercise....I may go again today seeing as surgery is this week and I won't be allowed to workout again for a month.  Anyone else exercise this weekend???  Between Renn being down for the incision, SueBee post OP and me having surgery next week, there won't be a lot of exercise in the coming weeks!  I guess we will all have to talk healthy eating and good healthy recipes.  Oh and I LOVE chopped!!! DH often wonders how I can watch it so much.  Cupcake wars is another one on late night I watch before bed.  I am an HGTV, Food TV and Cooking Channel junkie.....  I always wonder during Drive In's Diners and Drives what Guy Fieri's cholesterol levels are....anyone else?  That show features the most unhealthy food ever and I always wonder about his health because he eats it all!  My stomach would be a mess after filming that show if I was the host.  SueBee:  Hope you are getting some sleep....you are reminding me of what my next week or two will be like...blech!  After reading your posts I know I have to get my wedge pillow back out and stock up on stool softeners and laxitives.  My last surgery and first chemo had me needing an enema things were so bad.  I am so worried it will happen again after this surgery so I am going to take a ton of that stuff just in case.  Julie:  Welcome!  Stay a while and hang out with us.  We like to talk about good food, exercise, our foobs of course and families.  I think we even mentioned sex recently so you never know what is going to come up!  This is a fun group of gals.....I am sure you know that if you read the posts!  As far as constipation, I seem to be the queen of that around surgery or chemo times so here is my advice.  I take Senakot S in the morning and Docolax in the evening.  This gives me a stool softener and laxitive.  That worked for me.  I does leave me with some cramping before going, but at least I go (that is the lesser of two evils I guess knowing the alternative is an enema!!!).  Oh and Melanie, Supersally and I all had chemo and finished in the last month or two.....ask any questions you have. Renn:  What's the latest healing report????  I forgot to check out your photos on the photo forum.  I will do that...I hope it is improving.  I need to get my photos on there.  Maybe after surgery I will have time since I will be sitting around 24/7.  I took pre-surgery photos, photos after various fills but I have to take a photo before exchange of my 510cc TE ta ta's too.  So strange....did you ever think you would be taking photos of you boobs and sharing them with people on the internet?  At least it's not in a "Weiner" way!  LOL!!!  We don't have that bundt store.....sounds fabulous if they sell bundts!!!  Every time I hear the word "bundt" I think of my Big Fat Greek Wedding when the groom's parents bring the bride's Greek parents a bundt and they don't know what it is...anyone remember that?  Sorry...I am rambling...  Oh - also I think we all want to come to CA for a girls weekend.  Can you imagine us all hanging out at Renn's house saying "look at my foob" and cooking good food in the kitchen over wine????  Can we take over your house for a weekend Renn?  LOL! Redsky:  Your photos look great!  I am going to work on getting my photos on there soon so you can all check out my foobs too (this is so strange......to be saying that LOL!).  You know how you have gotten some pain in the chest area?  Yesterday I went for a walk and I had chest pain under my R foob and I had this pain back when I was getting fills and doing walking for exercise.  I have not been walking for months and I think it's something to do with the arm movements.  The elliptical does not bother me, but swinging my arms during walking does.....maybe if you are still having pain, change the type of exercise you are doing and it will go away???  Just an idea. Supersally:  I am a big fan of xanax.....SueBee I never would even take aspirin for a headache before BC...now I look forward to xanax every night.  Works like a charm.  How are those ankles Sally?  I hope better.  I wonder what is causing it??!?!?  The heat alone could cause that.  I can't imagine it being 100 degrees daily....we have had mid-upper 70's and sun this weekend.  It's been perfect weather. Shannon:  I told my sister about the kickstand comment....she was laughing her butt off!  She's a chemo infusion nurse so she deals with gals like us all day.  She told me she has actually had patients come in and lift their shirts and show her there foobs in the office!  LOL!  Can you imagine?  I could maybe share the foobs with you gals over cocktails, but never do that!  If you guys want more laughs, go over to the thread "you know you are a cancer patient when".  I laughed so hard I was crying one night.  I sent the link to my sis at work and the nurses will all in stitches!  I guess you have to find humor in all of this at times....even if it seems a bit sick.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2011 07:24PM mdg wrote: LOL Shannon..yes these gals are addicting because they are all Rock Stars in my book!  I love checking in - just so you know I often check in with you gals from my phone but I don't like typing on my phone as it takes too long so I wait to respond most of the time from my laptop.  I think my E surger will take about 2 hours.  It is same day surgery so I will go home on Thursday too.  I hopefully will be able to log on and give an update on Friday...can't stay away too long you know:) Well at least DH's Seattle trip got moved until later next week...then I won't have to worry about being home with DS on Monday or driving...yea!  He won't go until Wed, Thur or Fri...he's not sure.  That is a relief that it's not so soon after surgery. Melanie:  You are going to be sore tomorrow girl!  I love the energy coming from you!  Awesome!  You should ask your PT about bras and if that will contribute.  Maybe new one's would be good and could help a bit.  I have no idea on that as I have TE's that don't move when I jump up and down and don't require much of a bra......LOL!  Nothing like jumping around and your boobs stay still...very strange.  SueBee:  Glad you made a decision....good for you!  I like stable hours and a set schedule because I am a control freak and like to plan things... :)  Renn:  I am sorry that you have to get the TE removed :(  You know though if you get it out and get healed up things could be so different when you go back and try to start this process over.  I know it must be disappointing to you but at least you have made a decision.  Some times the anticipation of the outcomes or decisions is emotionally exhausting and draining.  Maybe you are breathing a small sigh of relief now?  As far as that comment about chemo.....it was not validating what you are going through and would have been offensive to me too.  People always seem to deminish things to others because they have not walked a mile in their shoes!  Disregard that comment from her and just realize that we get it....not many people do.  I often think people think "well you are only stage 1 so what are you worried about".  We all worry.  When you live it, you will worry and be scared.  I don't know why people don't understand that!  Your walk sound amazing.....I want to come to CA and hike with you!! Supersally:  I feel the same way about doing stupid crap at work..seems like such a waste of my time and energy!   Some of it is so worthless but the bad part is that some of the other people I work with have not learned that lesson yet and they think it's all "productive" and "great"...blech!  I hear ya girl!  Work and jobs have a whole new meaning after BC or something similar..........I think others may say I have a bad attitude or something...he he!  Oh well...walk in my shoes a mile and maybe they will understand too!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2011 05:44AM mdg wrote: Good morning!  I am back! OK - yesterday was a long day. I left at 5:30am got to the hospital at 6:30am and surgery was at 8:30am.  It was 3 hours at least as my PS had to revise both sides to even things out....I did not get home until 7pm last night.  I got realy nasesous after surgery and they gave me all kinds of stuff for that which knocked me out (compazine and a patch).  I could not wake up and get moving. We finally left and on the hour plus trip home I got sick twice (thank God my cousin had a bucket ready and waiting for me in the car!).  I went right to bed when I got home.  My son walked me up the stairs - he insisted and gave me tons of hugs.  So cute.....  I am popping vicodine every 4 hours.  I am pretty sore from the revision part I think...it hurts most where he was going to move things around (undrneath and down on the sides under arms).  I slept on and off since surgery yesterday.  I would sleep an hour and wake up and be up for an hour or so....but I do feel more rested today for sure.  So much to catch up on.  Suebee and her bra shopping extraviganza is hilarious!  I think she should just get a shirt that says "32DD" on it!  LOL!  Shannon...love the balancing tricks.  I never tried that but I bet I could have put the TV remote between my boobs for safe keeping (you know how you always misplace it??).  Melanie...people asking if boobs are real....really?  I can't imagine anyone having the nerve (or stupidity for that matter) asking that!  That's like asking someone if they are pregnant when you don't know if they are for sure...a big NO NO!  People are nuts.  Supersally - glad you were swimming..I am watching you girl so keep moving!  Also I expect a hair measurement update next week!  I bet it will be 1/2 inch for sure by then!  Renn:  glad you are well!  Annie:  work does stink...I am going to enjoy my month off but then I will be back into it again..blech!  As far as the foob results which I know you are all dying to hear about...I got a 450cc high profile round smooth implant.  I looked this morning....they look like they may be even (not lopsided) and they are a little smaller than my TE's.  The shape obviously looks different than the TE's (thank the Lord!). I am still a little bandaged so it's hard to tell...Sue Bee:  I am not in a bra or anything..my PS said no bras at all and if I do a jog bra if I need to put something under clothes, only one that hooks/unhooks so I don't pull any stitches pulling a tight one over my head.  Interesting how he does not want me in anything and your PS has you all strapped in tight......wonder why they all do it different.??!?  Oh well.  Once my boobs don't hurt I will try to balance something on them so I can say I did it too!  LOL!  I will write more later...Have a healthy day ladies!  Thanks for all the well wishes and cyber hugs!  I felt them all!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 11:02AM mdg wrote: I just thought I would post an update...poop fairy visited...I know you girls would be happy to hear that (LOL!).  No one else appreciates my news except you gals!  I did take the bandages off..boobs are smaller than I wanted.  I am a little disappointed but nothing I can do about that now.  I will be ok with it.  I don't have much bruising yet.   I got nauseated again late morning and I finally ate something and feel a bit better.  I even took a shower and put real clothes on...feel like a new woman.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2011 07:21PM mdg wrote: Renn:  Jayden's bday is really the 29th but we are having it on the 30th.  Tonight I made chicken piccata with mushrooms (it was in a lemon and caper sauce) with steamed broccoli and some of the slow roasted tomato bruschetta.  I forced myself to cook....I enjoyed it.  I have not been into cooking lately and I hate that.  I will have to post the recipe.  It was pretty good and pretty simple.  I hear you on the sleeping.  I get about 6 hours a night and that has been going on since December.  There were a few nights in there I slept 8 hours but only during chemo.  I have the darkest scariest circles under my eyes but I am not tired.  I am taking lots of vitamins....maybe that's it.  I also think eating better gives me more energy. The ambien did not work for me AT ALL!  Xanax is the only thing that works.  I tried Ativan but I would only sleep 2 hours and then wake up and not get back to sleep.....crazy to think I will never sleep again because of BC.....another nice thing to digest along with your dx.  Oh and I am jealous you have somewhere scenic to see the sunset.  One day we are all just going to show up at your house for a girls weekend and go hiking and drink wine! Supersally:  I too am jealous of you swimming.  I am so damn itchy I would kill to jump in a cold pool to put out the flaming skin.  (I broke down and called the dermatology office today...going in the morning).  I have had this skin issue for 2 months now....joys of chemo.  It just keeps giving doesn't it?  I am picturing you in the pool with TE floatation devices......do they help keep you above water?  I never got to swim in mine.....just curious!  Melanie:  You can be skipping lunch girl!  I wish I were closer, I would make you lunch and pack it for you just like I do for my son every morning!  Oh - I would get you a cuter lunch box...not Star Wars.  Maybe something peppy like Hello Kitty - LOL!  It is so nice to hear you say you have knocked out 8 rads already!  I love meatloaf........I usually make it Italian style.  I will have to post it on the blog soon.  I too use turkey or chicken.  I even like to add in fresh chopped spinach for some extra veggies.  SueBee:  Jeans?  You are lucky.  No halter tops with those though!  LOL!  I am glad you like your new nickname.  Oh and I wanted to let you know I itched my foob and it did not make any noise or say anything :)   LOL!  Have a fun trip!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2011 06:46PM mdg wrote: I am signing on real quick before DH and I look at houses on line....are you dying to know where we are moving????   Drum roll please......Chicago!    We spoke with them again today and are still finalizing some things but I am 90% sure DH will take the job and we will be moving by mid August (Help me please!!!!!).  This is going to be an adventure for sure...but you know I hope to have a guest room...my family and friends are welcome...that includes you fine ladies.  You know I will cook some mean, unhealthy Italian at least once while you are there...but with organic ingredients. Where do I start to respond?  You have all posted so much.  About plastic wear for food...I have replaced most of mine with glass wear from Anchor Hocking.  They have plastic lids that have no BPA.  The glass part can go in the oven (up do 425 degrees), freezer or microwave. (no lids in microwave though).  Some of the glass wear does not allow the oven so make sure you read all the info first.  I love the glasswear and lids because when you put them in the freezer or fridge, they are stackable.  Better than corning wear with those lids with handles that you can't stack.  I don't know why more companies don't use BPA free cans and packaging....I wish I knew.  I will do some more reading on this in the next week and let you know what I find out.  As far as non bean protein...quinoa is an option and oatmeal.  Here is a link with a few ideas:  http://commonsensehealth.com/Diet-and-Nutrition/List_of_High_Protein_Foods.shtml The foob sensation....I don't even know yet really.  I still have some numbness and since I still have my steri strips until Tuesday I just have kind of stayed away from the foobs a lot.   The rash is still bothering me...I am just putting special creams on about 10x a day to manage the symptoms....I am sick of it......I really have no idea if/when it will go away and the dermatologist doesn't know either.  They said up to 12 weeks from the end of chemo to get that out of my body.  I am bummed...we leave for vacation on 8/5 and now it seems like I won't even be able to be in the sun......that in addition to the fact that my sister can't join us now has me really bummed out.  I guess I will be sitting in the house by myself all week while everyone enjoys the sun and beach.....that will suck.  I can't even drink either.... Well..I have to go back and re-read everyone's posts and respond to everything else tomorrow...off to look at houses.  I can't believe we could be out of here in a month or so...........things are about to get even more crazy here.....bring on the xanax!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2011 06:08PM mdg wrote: Marie: I can tell you I did have a lot of pain when I was going through my fills.  I actually stopped filling for several weeks as it was too painful. It even pulled something in my upper back.  I felt like my TE was pushing into my chest at one point and it actually had more pressure when I ate.....It did get better in time....you are in the rough part right now.  Take it day by day....it will get better.  Hugs Shannon:  I got the glassware at Meijer.  I have seen it a few places....I can't remember where I saw it last - maybe in a cookware store catalog like Sur La Table or William Sonoma or similar.  I thought Eden Glen may be BPA free.  I have some more reading to do on all of that....  I wish we did not have to deal with moving and vacation all around the same time....it will require xanax or something.  The rash does not wake me up at night...thank God!  I take an antihistamine at night which knocks me out.   I go tomorrow for my post OP check up with the PS.  I am not happy with righty.....still looks odd.  I am bummed and had hoped it would not look odd after surgery.  It is better than it was but it sits strange and there is a ridge where the implant is kind of.  I notice it and hate it.  I hope he can fix it with fat grafting but I am worried he can't.  The left one looks good except they both seem so wide.  I am petite....not use to having breasts on the side.  Never had that before with my real ones......oh well.  At least I have breasts now that don't have BC.  I am a bit disappointed though..... Supersally:  DH will work in Elmhurst so we are thinking about living in Wheaton or Naperville so it will be a farily easy commute for him.  Who knows....they are calling him back tomorrow.  He has not officially accepted yet as we are hoping to work out a few details.....cross your fingers.   If you come to Chicago that would be a blast!  I am hoping lots of people come and visit.  Well had I known we were going to move, I would not have planned a vacation.....now that we have paid for the trip we are going....this is going to be a crazy several weeks......... We had such a busy weekend...BBQ's and parties all weekend.  We are all tired.  I am so bummed my boys will be back to work and school tomorrow. I have so much to do though...grocery shopping (remind self - no lifting anything heavy!!!), errands, PS appt, going for a walk and a few other things.....this week is going to be busy.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Maria Maria Visit my BC Blog at breastcancerwontdefineme.blogs... Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 09:48AM mdg wrote: Marie:  I had pain and tightness through my arm after my lumpectomy and SNB.  It took about a month to go away with daily exercise and stretching.....it's gone now and did not come back when I had my BLMX in that arm.  One day at a time...it will get better.  I like the whole "shopping for nipples" anaolgy....too funny!  Sue:  I have not seen Lago's photos..I guess I will have to check them out.  My thighs do have fat....I am not a size 0 or anything:).  I wish they could take some off my butt while they are at it too....a girl can dream, right?  Right now righty looks fake....lefty looks good.  Now that swelling has gone down, they seem smaller.  Oh well. Dh says he likes them.... :) I am trapped in my bedroom all day as I am having a new kitchen floor installed downstairs.  That's one way of keeping me from doing much......  I am organizing our whole vacation today online.  Now I have to call the mortgage broker and talk new mortgages....at least rates are low. Then I call the relocation expert with my daily list of questions...then the realtor in Chicago.  Joy....I am so busy...it's overwhelming a bit.  I need a master list so I can cross things off as I do them and feel like I am making progress.  Sue - you probably have a whole book on how to move......shoot me some help sister!  :)
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2011 11:50AM mdg wrote: Melanie.....good to hear you are knocking out more rads..... I am glad you got some rest too.  You have time to decide if any fix ups need to occur on the breasts.  You can always do it later if you want to.  I did think of you for an easy meal idea.....I always make extra pasta when I make it.  I toss it in EVOO, garlic powder, S&P.  I then reheat it with leftover cut up chicken, fresh spinach, leftover steamed veggies and just top it with some hormone free parmesan.  I use the whole wheat pasta so it's healthier.  I always just add in a little extra EVOO when I heat it and toss the parmesan after it's warm.  You can use any leftover meat/veggies...quick and simple.  FYI.  Today I did it with leftover chicken and some fresh spinach.  Super good.  So my brother called me today...he doesn't call much.  He had no idea we were moving....well, if you call sometime perhaps you would know....ugh.  I feel so disconnected from him and his family.  That's sad because we use to be so close.  I never hear from them and we only live 10 minutes from them.  His wife only called me once since I got BC.  Why do family members act like they don't care?  Anyone know the answer to that question?  I have not spent much time thinking about it lately but now that he called today it's on my mind again.  At least he finally called..I was worried he was going to find out we moved when I sent a "we've moved" card in the mail......OK I am done venting.  Thanks!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2011 04:11PM mdg wrote: Melanie:  Glad I am not the only one with hair reports...thanks for the update. I agree about the job..don't worry...Dr. Strangelove really could hire you and it may work out nicely!  The hair on my temple that I lost from chemo is growing in...looks fine, light and very thin.  I am sure that is how your head will come in too....It seems to grow so slow.  Renn:  Hope you are having a good visit Supersally:  When/where are you  vacationing?  I don't think I remember..maybe it's chemo brain or something.  I am disappointed in projection on my foobs..go for projection!  Sue...so glad you are riding.  Be kind to Lefty!  You are doing too much....I so wish you could come over my house.  THings are a mess and the house got officially listed today!  The kitchen floor is in and the bathroom is painted....lots of cleaning tonight.  THe garden needed some attention but that will have to wait until next week....oh well.  I can't bend over and do it - afraid it will hurt my rib Rib was feeling better until I vaccuumed today....and cleaned the kitchen and laundry room.  I still have so much to do....tomorrow I have to finish vaccuuming and dust and do a final sweep in the kitchen/bedrooms once the boys are gone.  I don't know how I will get all of this done.  I didn't know my realtor was doing an open house this weekend either....the garden weeding will have to wait until next week.  DH is still grumpy......
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 05:16PM mdg wrote: Julie:  Thanks so much....I am feel like I am making progress on my things......got a lot done today and DH is helping right now so that really makes a difference.  You have a co pay for every rad?  I didn't do rads so I don't know how that works...but then again I maxed out on our out of pocket back in February (seriously!!!).  We don't pay squat anymore for but now that we are moving and getting new insurance, I will have to pay out of pocket for my next surgery later this year.  I will pray for you mom....I hope she is OK.  Let us know what happens. When will she know something? Where is everyone else today?  I feel like a slacker...I did not have time to workout today - boo!  I am going to try to go first thing in the morning though.  I did manage to get the apartment secured...it's cute.  1100 SF with 2br/2ba and a W/D!  Third floor though...I guess I will get lots of exercise just going home each day!  Oh well..it's good for me I guess.  I did get a car leased today....pick it up tomorrow.  DH is doing food shopping for the birthday party this weekend - he's at Costco right now....I got the cupcakes, cake, Harry Potter cookies for party favors, etc.... all done today.  By the way - did you know you can get a edible photo cake topper???? Kroger does them!  I got Harry Potter...exactly like the invitations I designed!  I will have to post photos if it comes out cute..I pick it up Saturday.  This will be the last cake from my favorite cake lady...chocolate chocolate chip....OMG it's to die for!  I am for sure having a piece on Saturday..I don't care!  It's the BEST!  She even delivers to your house.  Gosh I will miss her when we move....my cake lady is the best.  I did also rent the bouncy house..... So back to exercise...anyone doing it?  I need to...I hope tomorrow is a bit easier to fit it in!

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 05:33PM mdg wrote: Good for your Cindy.  I am starting a yoga class as the cancer center when my PS says it's OK which means...2 more weeks.  I can't wait though! Welcome Annie!  Glad you are joining us.  Mall walking is the way to go in the winter if you are freezing like me.  I am starting my mall walking on Monday so I don't get yelled at for driving before then (my husband is freaking out about me driving before then.....what am I twelve????).  I did my PT exercises tonight....they seemed harder than this morning.  I felt tight tonight doing those.  I will just do them again tomorrow and soon it will get easier!

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 11:30AM mdg wrote: I have been craving sweets so I keep some hard candies around instead because they take longer to eat.  If I have chocolate, I would just keep eating.  There are some sugarless hard candies out there to take the edge off...for now I am having an occasional Jolly Rancher....yum!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 02:33PM mdg wrote: SueBee...I met with a nutritionist through the American Cancer Society...it is free for cancer patients to check out their website for local contact information.  It did not help much really - just some basics.  I have been reading the books I mentioned in an earlier post and www.foodforbreastcancer.com too.  I am just trying to be more deligent when I can be since hormones are an issue for me now.  I don't drink coffee, so I don't know on the caffiene thing. Supersally...I am jealous of the temps there and still freezing here!  It was barely 20 for a high today!!! At least we have had tons of sun....it's super pretty with all the snow and blue skies! Did my morning exercises today right after the hot shower and they felt good.  I had my first tissue expander fill today and now I am TIGHT!  I am sure my next round of exercises tonight will be hard.  I took some motrin right after I got home from the PS office though just to ease things.  OK -confession....I drove today!  And you ask....."where did you go on your first trip?"  I went to no other place than TARGET!  Too funny.  I did hit the post office as I had no more stamps from writing a bazillion thank you notes for food/gifts over the past few weeks.  Eventhough I had a fill today, I am going to try those exercises tonight.  I will let you know how it goes in the morning!  Get that body movin' ladies!!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 05:36PM mdg wrote: Elizabeth....glad you joined us!  OK am I going to have to get on you about the rehab exercises???  We are doing them twice a day (that's what most of us have been instructed).  Try to get them in each day as what you think is goog ROM may be diminished from where you were prior to surgery and you may not really even notice.  I went through knee rehab and I tell you I thought I was doing great until they actually measured my ROM and it was not improving even doing the exercises.  Then I had to double time it to get my ROM back.  So keep up with the exercises you were given.  That's great you are getting your cardio in too!  Good job.  My PS won't let me on any equipment until after 4 weeks.  I had my first mall walk today...not a power walk as he won't let me do that either.  Oh well....in a few weeks I will.  I am being good and listening to him even though it is hard for me! Sue Bee....what are we going to do with you and your leaking?   OK - yes you must back off some things for now but it will be worth it.  Let things heal.  Work on relaxation and your nutrition.  That is still part of the big picture in getting your energy and body back.  Keep me posted on your progress. Glad some of you endulged today too with some chocolate.  It's that time of year:)  Everything in moderation ladies - that's just fine! One more round of my exercises before bed....get your secound round in for the day!  Oh and my dinner tonight was good and healthy.  I made tacos with lowfat ground turkey (hormone free and vegetarian fed), with fat free organic refried beans on a whole wheat flour tortilla (I found some that were without soybean oil and bad fats at Whole Foods) and garden fresh salsa.  I had a nice salad on the side.  It was really good, healthy and my 4 year old even ate it (minus the salad).  Think of some healthier ways to make some things you enjoy.  My dinner was guilt free and tasty.  Just an idea for you all.  Have a good night!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 01:21PM mdg wrote: Hey Ladies.....so I did my exercises this morning and they felt easier after the first PT session from yesterday.  Maybe it's in my head...who knows!  I am still sensitive on the skin on my chest and have beed doing the washcloth thing....it ain't fun or pleasant!  Oh well, like I said before, I should do that twice a day too! Sally - I don't know anything about the bruising.....sounds like a big ouchy!  Sorry about that...hope it goes away quick.  As far as the fill - I responded to your Jan 2011 MX comment.  It does get better.  Try some motrin if your doc is cool with that.  My NP told me to take some as soon as I got home from the fill appt and I did.  It did feel hard to breath like you said, but now I don't feel any of that (my fill was Fri) but then again I have another fill this friday so it will happen again..... Let me know how you are all doing on exercises.  I didn't get to the mall to walk today but I had a ton of erronds to run today so I did a lot of walking around anyway.  That will have to do for today.  I will do my exercises again tonight.  Get that second round in ladies!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 05:39PM mdg wrote: Sue -the recipe sounds good.  My email is mgfit1@hotmail.com.  I would love to have it!  I love soup.  My problem is that I am not a snacker.  I rarely eat between meals.  Since getting dx I just have to force myself to eat 3 meals a day....tonight I forced in some fat free organic yogurt.  I am still full and it's 8:30pm.  I did force an apple down as a mid morning snack.  I feel so full.  I don't remember the last time I felt really hungry - a few weeks ago maybe.  I guess it's the stress of this....that is a usual pattern for me under stress - less eating.  I am trying.  I have 7 large glasses of water in today...one more before bed.  Doing my second round of exercises tonight before bed.  I have a fill tomorrow....joy joy! Annie - I will check out the CDC on iron.  I guess I should pay more attention to that too!  I am giving up beef for the most part.  Turkey and chicken for me and tons of veggies.  I do know that when I make my real Italian meatballs I am having beef though!  I don't make it often....but boy is it good.  My fav!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2011 06:51PM mdg wrote: Hey Gals!  I didn't forget about you...I have had my family around and I just don't get any down time when my boys are around!  Ok - I did half my exercises this morning and got side tracked because my husband was not home and I had my son with me (he's 4 so not much gets done). I was busy with stuff all day today - grocery and cooking and my sis and her kids here all day...I am doing my exercises tonight though!  I need to for sure.  Just so you know, we are getting blasted here with 6-9 inches of snow and an ice storm.  My sis and I got in an accident in her car today on the way home from the grocery store...we are fine - shaken but her poor car....not drivable.  Boo!  My poor sis.....  Leesie - welcome to our workout club!  As far as the exercises...did you do TE's?  I would first get some direction from you PS so you know that you are not doing anything you shouldn't be doing.  If you want a copy of the booklet I got from the cancer center where I am getting treated, PM me with your email address and I will email it to you.  I would then sugget you show it to your doc before doing anything since I don't know what your doc has for your restrictions.  I too had BLMX and TE so this is what I am doing in addition to physical therapy twice a week.  They are mostly stretches and some range of motion movements - with some very easy strengthening with 2 lb weights.  Let me know!  I personally think I keep my energy level up by walking and staying busy.  I notice that around dinner time I get tired, but after dinner in the evening I get a second wind.  I think the fatigue can be a normal part of this process....so listen to your body.  If your doctor allows you to walk, do it!  I have been hitting the mall several mornings a week.  Be careful with stretching things as you don't want any stitches to tear.  Talk to your PS for restrictions first.  So glad you joined us!  Also, where are you in MI?  We may be neighbors! Cody...your walks sound so much better than my mall walk...and less expensive.  No one should have to walk by Pandora jewelry in the mall on a daily basis.....it's torture!  LOL!  That's great you are doing 45 minutes so many days a week!  By spring you will be good to go!  Let me know what your doc says about stretches.  If you want my booklet from the cancer center to show your doc, let me know.  I can email it..PM me your email address.  LLL6500 - I just started the PT.  I am going to go as long as I can as I think it will help me get back to teaching my fitness classes.  I have found it helpful at this point in addition to the exercises and stretches I do on my own.  I am sorry you are having a bad few days...don't fret!  That's probably normal. Your body is going through so much.  On those days where you are fatigued from chemo and such, just treat your body and mind well. Put in a relaxation CD and take a long hot shower to relax or a bath.  Eat right and healthy those days.  Even if you are not "exercising" you are treating your body well and helping it rebuild itself.  All of that is part of the process.....give yourself permission to have tired days...It's OK.  Try a short walk - even 10 minutes is better than nothing if you can.  My IPOD is my best friend on those days where I don't feel like it.  Good music helps pick me up!  As far as massage, it could help with overall body aches and helping you relax.  Just make sure to see a massage therapist that has had special training for lymph drainage as we are all more at risk of lymphedema after surgery.  Hang in there...I hope tomorrow is better :) Anyone else checking in???? I am off to do my exercises for the night....we'll chat tomorrow!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2011 06:00PM mdg wrote: So this morning I did force myself to do the 40 min mall walk eventhough my arm was sore.  I took some tylenol and my arm did not hurt really while I was walking.  I didn't do my rehab exercises until this afternoon because I was afraid to because of my port in the arm, but surprisingly, I was able to do them all!  I will do them again tonight.  My chest feels nice and loose and did not hurt sleeping flat last night....just in time for another fill tomorrow...ugh!  I know it will take a week to get back to feeling like this again and then I will be going back for another fill.  Oh well....I only need 1 to 2 more fills so maybe tomorrow will be it..??  I will have to see how my new girls look and decide on the size.  I think my doc will push for an additional fill...they like more room in there to work in the exchange surgery and like things stretched out good.   On an off note, I am trying to eat all the veggies that are good for me.  I made cauliflower tonight..never been a fan.  Even tons of garlic and olive oil didn't make this taste good.  Anyone have any good and healthy ways to serve/cook cauliflower?  I am trying really hard......got my 5 servings of veggies/fruit in today :) Anniemomof3 - thanks for encouragement.  I guess I will get use to it...I have no choice now.  The odd thing is I have a 2"x4" horrible bruise from getting the port  (on my arm near the port) and I didn't barely have any bruising from my BLMX.  Oh well.  At least it is winter and I am not wearing short sleeves for anyone to see that!  Your exercising is going so well....keep it up!  I hope the diet is helping with the iron so your body can continue to heal.  I am going cereal shopping tomorrow - thanks for sharing the Iron thing...I had not been too focused on that and have no idea if mine is OK or not.  I just plan on making sure I get a good cereal and include it as a snack or breakfast each day to be sure. SueBee - As far as suplements, talk to your doc.  Most don't have an issue with you taking a multi-vitamin but I would ask about other things just in case.   If you are feeling like you are doing too much, then you probably are!  Slow down a bit....let's get you healed!  Again eating right, resting and such are part of getting your body back to a healthy state.  If you are still doing those things and not exerising, you are still doing your body good! ReSky - Yea!  I am glad you have a date.  I hope this one sticks for sure!  I am sure you are getting tired of the waiting.  I am so glad you are exercising now...it will make a difference later.  Like I said, don't forget those ab and back exercises now as you need them a lot those first several days post surgery to move around.  I could really feel my abs and needed that strength to move around in bed and get up!  We will be coaching you through your surgery and after....keep joining on this thread throughout!  You will have a lot of cheerleaders here! Did you all get your rehab exercises in?  I am feeling less tight in the arm pits these days...the exercises and stretches work ladies if you do them daily!  No skipping out on me now..... (smile)
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2011 09:41AM mdg wrote: Thanks Cindy.  I am pretty small framed and had small breasts before so there isn't much room in there.  I think it also doesn't help that my body has not been through it's regular workouts in so long I think it is tight.  She put in 70cc's this time and the last time.  I am now at 360cc's.  This is huge for me (the boobie fairy finally came...I have been waiting since I was 12!).  I am doing a lot of stretching today.   I think that helps.  I will also be having a very long, hot shower!!! I got a surprise today....my hubby planned a night out for dinner and the casino in Winsdor with my cousin and her husband tonight before I start chemo this week!  He even had a hotel room but since my back has been hurting so bad we decided to just sleep at home in case I need my pillows.  I told him we would do an overnight date in a few weeks.  I am so happy...we have not had any kind of date in months with all of the BC crap.  Yippy!  Wish me luck....maybe I will win some money tonight at the tables....I am not much of a gambler.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2011 08:05AM mdg wrote: Hey ladies...OK so I have an update on my back pain.  The pain was agonizing...like my upper back was pulled out of whack and my vertebrae even hurt.   Here  is the strangest thing....I swallowed water wrong and coughed (which was painful) but then something popped when I coughed and about  80% of the pain was gone!  I think I needed a chiropractor!  Later the pain got bad and I had a huge sneeze (which also hurt and jarred my back) and guess what...the pain was less.  I managed to go out to the casino (and did not lose money....won it back playing 4 card poker...it was my first time playing too!) went out to dinner and then gambled some more.  I had a great time and totally forgot about BC for a few hours!  :)  I love my hubby!  I did my exercises this morning and my back feels good.  My chest is less tight today too...so the exercises do work ladies!  Now I am getting ready to do my trial run with the cold cap treatment (to save my hair during chemo) since my first session is Wednesday.   I am already cold thinking about it...wish me luck!  I will check in later when I thaw out so let me know what exercise you ladies have been up to yesterday and today!!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: mdg wrote: OK ladies, I got the final OK yesterday to do all of the post BLMX surgery rehab exercises and I will be starting physical therapy next week.  I just went through all of the exercises in my booklet from the breast center.  I decided to do them right after a nice hot, relaxing shower knowing the shower would warm my muscles up so they would not be so tight.  That worked well for me. It hurt less than I thought!!  I recommend doing them after a warm shower.   I have to do my exercises two times a day.  I will wait until this evening to do the second round.  They were not that bad.  My PS says I need to get my arms closer to my ears when they are overhead.  Things definately feel tight but it felt looser after I did the exercises.  I want to start walking but we are covered in snow and I can't drive to the mall yet to walk.  I am going to by driving next week and plan on doing some leisure walking starting next week.  My PS says as long as I am not on a treadmill or doing WORKOUT/power walks, I can walk as much as I want.  I think that will really help. So, here is our official daily check in thread.  If you all don't remember, I am an aerobics instructor so you will now be me virtual class :)  Get off your behinds ladies....get those rehab exercises going.  If you don't have any exercises, please call your doctor and ask for them.   I don't want to tell people to do things they shouldn't be doing.   I am looking for a website or online resource that mirrors some of the exercises I have been assigned for BLMX with TE surgery as a reference.  I have not found anything yet.....will keep looking and post a link when I find something.  Let me hear about today's activities ladies!!!!  Don't make me shout at you :) Let's get those bodies moving!  Think spring with new bodies and nice new breasts!  We are all going to be looking beautiful ladies...just beautiful! Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2011 10:43AM mdg wrote: Good afternoon my healthy girls!  Did my 45 min on the elliptical after I had a pap (lord that was fun but at least it was not a breast exam).  I am glad I had it scheduled because the chemo gave me a yeast infection....it just keeps getting better, doesn't it?  I didn't know that could be a side effect of chemo too.  Oh well...a trip to the pharmacy and hopefully all will be good.  I did my stretches after working out but my range of motion on the R is not as good.  The TE sits up higher on the right and it looks odd compared to the L side and it is just tighter.  I will talk to the PT about this again tomorrow, but as I continue to fill I think the range of motion gets worse.  Other than that, I feel good.  I have had an appetitie...hungry! Suebee:  Yes, they keep filling me up.  It's odd though because they don't project out forward...the TE sit more towards the arm pits and they seem to fill sideways...not out as much.  They are definately bigger than I was before surgery and I too hoped to be a fully B or small C.  I am going to call the nurse and discuss this with her.  I wonder what 410cc's will yield with my exchange surgery and real implants......They don't look huge on my frame...I am 5'3" and weigh about 119 lbs and wear a size 2/4 now (due to the weight loss and dietary changes with BC).  I hope to stay about this weight (as this was my normal size for years and year...working full time and kids has made me get bigger in the past 3 years!).  The other thing to think about is if you do gain some weight back, with implants, your breasts will not get bigger with weight gain.  I am curious what your doc says on how many cc's he wants to fill you to in order to achieve a full B or small C with exchange....let me know.

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2011 05:54PM mdg wrote: Supersally:  I am glad you are going to get to ride your horse!  What fun it will be to do something normal again.  Good luck with the port...it's not bad at all. Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2011 04:27AM mdg wrote: Rennasus: You and your poor hubby have had quite a time.  I am thinking that once you get healed you two will be on a coast for a while with happy times.  I am saying a prayer for that.  He must have so much emotion inside and I can't imagine how scary this is for him...I want to hug you both!  As far as working out...don't make me PM you daily and get on you!  All I can say is find something you enjoy...it doen'st have to be crazy exercise....just something you like.  If you have a favorite CD, put it in your Ipod and just walk or dance til it's done.  Exercise is some type of movement...it doesn't have to be a big gym workout.  Even doing your post op exercises and stretches daily is a good start.  You can do it!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2011 12:55PM mdg wrote: I hope all of you ladies heal up those incisions.  I can't imagine how frustrating that is.  I feel like I am all filled up (410cc's now) that hearing all of your stories, I am scared for them to fill any more!   Since my upper back is still sore and I am finally sleeping again after my last fill and being past this round of chemo, I have decided to skip my fill for tomorrow.  I just need a break from being uncomfortable so I can sleep at night and just get some rest.  I am finally back to sleeping flat and on my sides again which feels good.  My upper back is sore on the right side - that is the side that the TE is higher on.  The whole front of the R side is tighter and feels like a brick.  The Left side actually looks good and does not hurt at all.  I hope that if I need any more fills it will only be one more.....the right side is just uncomfortable to me and I hate the idea of it being like that for 3 more months.  So you ladies with the incision issues....listen to your docs and don't do anything to compromise that incision healing.  Work on your diet - lots of water, lots of good foods with a balanced diet.  That will help you in the long run.  You will have plenty of time to workout...don't worry, I will whip you into shape as soon as you are healed!

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2011 11:28AM mdg wrote: Thanks Anniemomof3.  I meet with the PS in 2 weeks so I am going to talk about all of that.  My projection is not that great...that's why the nurse wants me to fill again.  I am concerned because of the R TE.  When I breath in deep I feel pressure.  I am worried about filling more and living with that for 3 more months at least.  I am almost thinking about  just waiting and meeting with the PS first before another fill and see what he says.  If he thinks I should fill, we still have time as chemo is delaying my exchange anyway.  My L one actually looks less coconut like at all...looks pretty good really and it does not hurt my back or chest at all and they are the same size. Since the position is sitting different the feeling on each side is completely different.  I must have the small size TE because mine does no feel mega and I am only 5'3", 119 lbs and size 4.  I don't have much body fat especially on my chest area...skin, musle and bones.  I have been talking to wippetmom (did you see her thread under reconstruction?).  I have sent her photos along with measurements and she gave me recommendations for what my PS should consider using....I am going armed with my info when I meet with him.  If you have not seen her thread, check it out and PM her.  She was very helpful.

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2011 10:50AM mdg wrote: Barbara:  I was the worst on days 3-6 post chemo then I completely bounced back.  Hang in there!  You will be saying the same to me this time next week.  Just rest.  I did get a confused/dizzy/foggy feeling here and there on days 3-5 so I think that is normal...well at least I hope it is!  Rennasus:  I just whipped up those meatballs....because it was what I had in the fridge.  When I have time later, I will post it.  I have my little one home today and can't get much done!  Tonight I will have time! I did my elliptical for 45 min this morning and then headed to the PS office.  Good news and bad news.....the good news is skin looks good and has room for more fills.  The bad news is my PS thinks I have capsule contracture going on in the R TE.  If I was not on chemo he would recommend surgery to take it out and fix it and put another TE in.  Because of chemo that is not an option.  He thinks that is causing the back pain too because there is more scar tissue building up.  He wants me to keep doing the PT in hopes that it helps a bit.  For now no more fills. I am at 410ccs and he thinks he can make me a full B with a 375 cc smooth high profile implant.  I wanted to be a full be or small C.  I wish I had a little more projection but since I can't fill anymore that isn't going to happen....boo!  He said if my back heals and I really want one more fill we could try in a few weeks, but he doesn't think that will make much difference.  He also said he can do some microfat injections when he does my nipples under the nipple area to add a bit of a projection under the nipple.  Now I am worried the same thing will happen to the new implant and the scar tissue will come back......I am also bummed because he said he won't do my exchange surgery until at least 6 weeks post chemo.  I was originally told 4 weeks.  My summer is going to be screwed up because of this.  I know a few weeks shouldn't matter, but it does at this point to me. I am sick of this crap and want my life back.  I had hoped to be at the pool with my son by late June.   Now I can't even have surgery until mid to late June.   I know there is nothing I can do about it.  It just is disappointing.  Oh well.   It's not the end of the world - I will get over it.  It's the least of my worries right now I guess.

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2011 08:49PM mdg wrote: I just wash the brussel sprouts and discard any bad leaves.  Half them.  Put them in a bowl and toss with EVOO.  Season with whatever you like and toss well.  Put them in the oven on a cookie sheet lightly sprayed with EVOO and bake at 400 degrees for about 45 minutes.  Be sure to turn them at least once or twice while cooking.  I mixed them with carrots and cauliflower the last time....really good!  You can try different seasonings...Italian stuff, more spicy, mexican, Indian spices with all of these veggies.

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2012 10:38PM mdg wrote: I would review ALL options (lumpectomy+rads and mastectomy).  Ask about recurrence rates for both and survival rates for both.  I would read up on oncotype tests and see if they will order one for you to further evaluate your tumor.  Get a copy of the pathology report so you fully understand everything on there.  I would also ask for a referral for plastic surgeons in case you choose to go the mastectomy route.  I would try to meet with a plastic surgeon to discuss all of your options before you make any decisions.  This way you have reviewed everything before deciding.  I would make sure the surgeon you see is a Breast Surgeon and if you see a plastic surgeon, make sure he/she specializes in reconstruction.   The beginning is VERY overwhelming.  Take it one step at a time.  I know it's hard..I have been there.  Hugs and good luck!

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 03:58PM - edited Sep 11, 2011 03:58PM by mdg We have similar stats.  I am 45 and had an oncotype score of 17 which left me with an 11% chance of recurrence.  I also had angiolymphatic invasion present in my tumor which scared the crap out of me.  I was given a choice to do chemo or not...I chose chemo because of the angiolymphatic invasion, the fact that I have a young child and I wanted to look back and know I did everything possible to prevent this from coming back.  I used cold caps to keep my hair and that made chemo so much easier.  I finished chemo in May and feel good about my choices.  Oh and I also had BMX with reconstruction and am on Tamoxifen.

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2011 09:43PM mdg wrote: Chemo was the most agonizing decision for me...it was worse than the BMX.  I had an oncotype of 17 which is the highest number in the "no chemo" group.  I got two opinions.  One said no based on oncotype but said if I felt chemo was something I wanted as insurance they would to 4 cycles of taxotere and cytoxan.  The other opinion said they felt I would benefit from chemo and 3 of 4 of the med oncs there recommended chemo - also 4 cycles of taxotere and cytoxan.  I was 45 at diagnosis with a 4 year old child and I was in excellent health other than BC.  I also had lymphavascular invasion present but clean nodes.  I had to decide on chemo.  I chose chemo.  I did cold caps to keep my hair during chemo after researching them in depth.  My med onc supported cold caps and had them available in her office too which made it easy.  I finished chemo on May with my long hair.  You have to decide what is right for you personally.  There are no guarantees...just because I did chemo doesn't mean I don't worry about recurrence.  I just know I had to make a decision that I could live with.  I knew I could never look my son in the face if this comes back and I had not done the chemo.  I wanted to know I had done everything I could do.  I am happy with my decision.  It was the right thing for me.  TC was not that bad.  I tolerated it OK.  Now I am moving on with my life and no one would ever know I had BC let alone chemo.  Good luck with your decision...just remember there is no "right" answer.....only the right thing for YOU.
